loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys L. C. belongs to the village bank called “Solución,” which is a Spanish word meaning “solution.”

Gladys and her husband are in the type of business known in Spanish as “vender por campañas,” which directly translates into “selling through campaigns.” What this means is that they vary the types of products they sell according to the season and the demand. For example, in September they sell back-to-school supplies to families. When it is time to begin planting a new crop, they sell fertilizer to farmers, and during the Christmas season, they sell decorations. Gladys and her husband sell the majority of their products in “ferias,” or large, open-air markets in the countryside. Sometimes they must travel many hours outside of Ayacucho.

Gladys began with just a small supply of “abarrotes,” which is the name given to the general supply of a variety of bulk food products. These Gladys continues to sell year round. This was twelve years ago, and today Gladys is the owner of a thriving business that has branched out into several different markets. It is a dynamic way to do business, however, Gladys says it is the best way to earn the highest returns. Eventually, Gladys would like to enter the construction market, selling different types of materials to a variety of companies.

Within her village bank, Gladys says she feels like she has a second family. She says it is an incredible resource for women, and the savings aspect has helped her in constructing her very own house where she and her two children, ages ten and two, live. It has also helped her save enough money to buy a van that she and her family are able to use to take their large amounts of goods for sale to the "ferias". Gladys is asking for a $400 loan, with which she will be able to buy a large supply of fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: o buy a large supply of fertilizer for re-sale

loans.name: Kossi Mawutowou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi Mawutowou B., 34 years old, was born in Kuma Adamé and lives in Alinka. He is married and the father of five (05) children and is also responsible for another one. He became a driver after his elementary schooling. His wife is a nurse. As a taxi driver, his car often has problems which does not allow him to provide well for his family's needs or to save money. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy another car to better increase his daily income. This amount will be repayed in 2 years.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 34 ans, Monsieur B. Kossi Mawutowou est né à Kuma Adamé et réside à Alinka. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants et une autre à sa charge. Il est devenu chauffeur après ses études primaires. Sa femme est infirmière. Etant chauffeur de taxi sa voiture a souvent des problèmes ; ce qui ne lui permet pas de bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de faire des économies. Il sollicite un montant de $1200 pour acheter une nouvelle voiture pour mieux accroître ses revenues journalières. Ce montant sera rembourser en 2 ans.

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Felícitas Fortunata

texts.en:
Felícitas Fortunata A. M. is part of a village bank called “Amaquella,” which is Quechua (native language) for “Don’t be lazy.”

Felícitas has a soft spot in her heart for children which is immediately obvious as upon entering her “bodega,” or small grocery store. Amidst the daily necessities every grocery store provides--staple foods, soda, cleaners, utensils--Felícitas has dedicated an entire wall to children’s toys. There are stuffed animals, dolls, games, costumes, and anything else a small child’s heart desires. Felícitas says the neighborhood children always stop by for candy or for a birthday present on their way to a “cumpleaños,” or birthday.

For four years, Felícitas has owned and maintained her grocery store in a pleasant neighborhood just outside of the city center of Ayacucho, Peru. Years before, and for the majority of her professional life, Felícitas rented a store in downtown Ayacucho, where she sold children’s clothing. Though she greatly enjoyed her work selling clothing, it was very expensive to rent space in the city, and Felícitas preferred to buy her own place to run her own, more independent business. Today, this is exactly what she does. After switching from selling clothing to groceries, a more practical market in her current neighborhood, Felícitas now spends every single day behind the store counter. She arrives at 5:00 a.m. each morning to begin selling fresh bread for breakfast and doesn’t leave until 9 p.m. that evening. It is tiring, she admits, but also very rewarding, and she does get the occasional break when one of her six grown children stop by to take over the counter from time to time.

Within her village bank, Felícitas is extremely happy. She loves that is a place where she can spend time with her friends, laughing and chatting, while at the same time getting down to business, paying loans, and accomplishing goals. Through the loans she receives from her village bank, Felícitas is always looking for ways to increase business and attract new customers. With the $600 loan she is hoping to receive, Felícitas will be able to buy more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.use: With the $600 loan she is hoping to receive, Felícitas will be able to buy more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Agbikpè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agbikpè IDOAGBODJI, 45 years old, is married and the mother of nine (09) children. She is specialized in the production of “gari” (manioc flour), she is well appreciated in her region because of the quality of her gari. The income from her activity allows her to provide for the needs of her family. However to do it better, especially the schooling of her children which she can not meet, she would like to improve her working conditions by purchasing a manioc grater and a leaven mill. With this in place, she will be able to have a higher yield. The higher yield will contribute to an increase in her income allowing her family to thrive. Being in financial need, she is requesting a loan of $650. Dedicated and with good ethics, she is capable of repaying this loan without trouble.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 45 ans, Madame M. Agbikpè est mariée et est mère de neuf (09) enfants. Spécialisée dans la fabrication du « gari » (farine de manioc), elle est très appréciée dans sa zone de par la qualité de son gari. Le revenu de son activité lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Mais pour mieux le faire, surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants qu’elle n’arrive pas à remplir, elle voudrait améliorer ses conditions de travail par l’achat de rappeuse de manioc et de presseuse de levain. Ceci réalisé, lui permettra d’avoir un rendement plus élevé. Le rendement élevé contribuera à l’augmentation de son revenu source de l’épanouissement de sa famille. Ce trouvant dans le besoin financier, elle vient solliciter un apport financier de $650. Dévouée et de bonne moralité, elle est apte à rembourser ce crédit sans difficulté.

loans.use: Purchase of a grater for manioc and a leaven mill

loans.name: Gabe Avelina

texts.en:
Gabe Avelina J. Alcahuamaní belongs to the village bank “Sarita.”

She sells clothing in the middle of the bustling “Mercado Nely García,” a popular market in Ayacucho, Peru. She can be found there daily, shaded from the hot sun under a colorful umbrella and behind her display of clothing of all different types. There she waits with a smile on her face to chat with interested customers. Gabe buys her large supplies of clothing from a larger market in Lima. Twice a month she makes the 10-hour bus trip to the Peruvian capital. The majority of the clothing she keeps in her home, and daily brings a smaller supply to the market.

Before she was selling clothing in the market, Gabe sold “especias,” or spices, traveling between grocery stores and even between provinces to find markets for her products. When Gabe’s oldest daughter entered elementary school, she decided to change occupations to something more permanent and less tiring. That was one year ago today, and already she has her own space in the market and several regular customers.

As a long-term goal, Gabe hopes to open her own clothing store in the center of town where she would supply clothing of all types and occasions to the community. She says she loves her village bank because it is a place where she can meet with friends and also learn about how to better care for her home and her family. Gabe is asking for a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy larger quantities of clothing to sell in the market.

loans.use: Gabe is asking for a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy larger quantities of clothing to sell in the market.

loans.name: Egah

texts.fr:
Mr. Egah A., 35 years old, lives and works in the village of Avégloédjigan. He is the father of three (03) children and is responsible for four (04) more persons. For 8 years now he has been selling various tools such as hoe, rakes, machete... This activity allows him, with the little income generatesd, to provide for his family's needs. According to him, this is an activity that would be profitable if he had a working capital available. Thus, he is soliciting a loan of $1000 to increase his investment. This would allow him to improve his income level and the quality of life of his whole family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 35 ans, Monsieur A. Egah réside dans le village d’Avégloédjigan où il mène son activité. Père de trois (03) enfants, il prend en charge quatre (04) autres personnes. Depuis maintenant 8 ans, il commercialise des outils divers comme houes, râteaux, coupe-coupe… C’est une activité qui lui permet grâce au petit revenu généré, de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Selon lui, c’est une activité qui est rentable si un fond de commerce est disponible. Ainsi, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour y investir davantage. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de revenu et la qualité de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Stockage des outils

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Madame Kayi A. is a 48 years old widow living in Akoin. She sells small fish and condiments to provide for the needs of her five (05) children. This poor widow lacks working capital funds to increase her activities. This is why she is requesting a loan of $300 to revitalize her commercial activities. She is counting on your help to improve her living conditions and that of her children.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Kayi âgée de 48 ans est veuve et réside à Akoin. Elle est revendeuse de petits poissons et des condiments afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq (05) enfants. Cette pauvre veuve est en manque de fonds de commerce pour accroître ses activités. Pour cela, elle sollicite un apport financier de $300 afin de relancer ses activités commerciales. Elle compte sur votre aide pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de ses enfants.

loans.use:
Purchase and stock of fish

Achat et stock de poisson

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda P. M. belongs to the village bank “Cusi Urpi,” which is Quechua (native language) for “Happy Dove.” To everyone who enters her home, a modest rented room in downtown Ayacucho, Yolanda gives a warm welcome and sample of the fresh honey she sells on a piece of bread. When Yolanda was a student at the university, she began to support herself through selling honey. Today, 28 years later, she is still selling honey by the kilo. Every weekend she drives to the nearby town of Huanta to buy her supply. In addition to selling honey, for the past 10 years Yolanda has been selling jewelry from her home. Three times each year she drives to Lima to buy beautiful earrings, bracelets, rings, necklaces, and broaches. She sells these to professionals, neighbors, friends, and also to brides preparing for weddings. But her business ventures aren’t limited to honey and jewelry.

She studied nursing at the university in Ayacucho and now works at the nearby technological institute supervising nursing students as they complete their practices. Although this is a full-time job, Yolanda is a single mother and it does not sufficiently provide for Yolanda’s two children, ages nine and six. In order to supplement her income and provide for her family’s needs, Yolanda has followed in the footsteps of her mother as an entrepreneur. In addition to these three commitments, Yolanda has just recently begun selling cookware through an international company to her friends and family. She says she is always looking for a new market and a new way to support her family. One day, Yolanda hopes to open her own jewelry shop. It is very important to her that she is able to be independent in her businesses, and her village bank is helping her toward this goal. She appreciates her village bank because it has helped her establish her businesses with economic security. With the $700 loan for which Yolanda is requesting, she will fund her jewelry business through buying larger quantities and varieties of jewelry from Lima.

loans.use: With the $700 loan for which Yolanda is requesting, she will fund her jewelry business through buying larger quantities and varieties of jewelry from Lima.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Born in 1962 in Atsansi-Djita, Mr. Jean K. is married and father of 5 children. Although he is primarily a farmer, he also raises animals, a sideline which he feels passionate about. Selling animals he has raised is his special source of income. However, he raises his animals in the traditional fashion, which does not provide much in the way of financial returns. Interested in modernizing his operation so as to earn more from it, he would like to build a pen for his animals and also add other species to his flocks. Accomplishing this will allow him to increase his income and better provide for his family. He is asking for a loan of US$ 900 for this purpose.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1962 à Atsansi-Djita, Monsieur K. Jean est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. Agriculteur de profession, il associe l’élevage qu’il exerce avec passion. La vente d’animaux constitue sa source privilégiée de revenue. Cependant, c’est un élevage traditionnel qu’il pratique, ce qui ne donne pas un rendement aussi important. Soucieux de rentabiliser cette activité à travers la modernisation, il a voulu construire un enclos pour ses animaux et y introduire d’autres espèces. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit de $900.

loans.use:
construction of a pen and purchase of additional sorts of animals to raise

construction d'enclos et achat d'autres espèces d'animaux

loans.name: Norma Cecilia

texts.es:
Norma is a diligent, 38 year old woman who has a small business distributing breakfasts in the markets and to the public in general. She began three years ago, and feels very happy that she has been able to run this business. Thanks to her work, she has been able to gain many benefits and provide things for her small family, improving their quality of life because of her efforts.

With the sacrifice Norma makes every day, she can satisfy her requirements, but she needs to construct her own home with her boyfriend, whom she plans to marry next year. She is requesting this loan to grow her business, and begin a new business selling clothing door to door. With this she will be able to increase her savings and get closer to the day when she can have a family.

Norma es una diligente señora de 38 años, que trabaja en su pequeño negocio de distribución de desayunos a los mercados y público en general. Empezó hace ya tres años y se siente muy feliz de haber incursionado en esta noble labor, debido a que gracias a su trabajo a podido adquirir muchísimos beneficios y bienes para su pequeña familia que ha mejorado notablemente su nivel de vida gracias a su ocupación. Con el sacrificio de todos los días Norma puede satisfacer sus necesidades y no deja de esforzarse por cimentar sus bases económicas sin dejar de lado la construcción de su propia base familiar con su novio con el cual tiene planes de contraer matrimonio el próximo año. Hoy solicita un préstamo para implementar su actual negocio e iniciar uno nuevo con venta de prendas de vestir a domicilio con los que podrá incrementar sus ahorros y hará cercano el día de poder tener una familia.

loans.use: TO GROW HER BUSINESS SELLING BREAKFASTS IN THE MARKET, AS WELL A LAUNCH A NEW BUSINESS SELLING CLOTHING DOOR TO DOOR, INCREASING HER INCOME SO SHE CAN PLAN FOR HER FUTURE.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa S. V. is part of the village bank “Señor de Huanca,” which is Spanish for “Father of Huanca,” or the patron saint of Huanca, a region in the highlands of Peru.

Tomasa’s days are split between two different businesses. Every morning, between 6:00 a.m. and 8:00 a.m., she can be found in the market selling bunches of alfalfa to customers with livestock to feed. Each bunch costs about 0.50 Nuevo Soles, which is equivalent to about US$ 0.16. Tomasa began her alfalfa business ten years ago when her husband passed away and she was left to support a family of two children ages ten and eighteen. Today her business has grown significantly and she has many regular customers who come to her stand every single morning.

Every evening at 6:00 p.m., Tomasa changes gears to focus on her business selling “emoliente.” For four hours she is at her stand selling this hot herbal drink that combines water, wheat extract, poppy seed extract, fresh lemon, and several other herbs to create a delicious warm tea. It is traditionally consumed in the very early mornings or late at night and is well known for its many medicinal qualities. Tomasa charges about 0.50 Nuevo Soles per glass. She just recently began serving "emoliente" to her community. One year ago, her best friend suggested it as a good additional source of income, and Tomasa already has many regular and very interested customers who come to her every evening for a delicious warm drink.

Tomasa loves being a part of her village bank. She says it has helped her immensely with the growth of both of her businesses. She is now asking for a loan of US$ 500 dollars, with which she will buy more materials for her businesses such as larger quantities of alfalfa and a variety of herbs for her "emoliente".

loans.use: buy materials for her businesses such as larger quantities of alfalfa and a variety of herbs for her hot herbal drink

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Selling the simple necessities of everyday life is a business that Mrs. Ablavi A. inherited from her mother when she was still very young. Now, at age 37, she herself is married and mother of three children. This very lucrative business permits her to support her family financially, since her husband, who is a farmer is not able to do so because his income is meager.

Very dynamic and conscientious in her position as principle breadwinner for her family, Mrs. A. is always trying to do better by her children. For that reason, she would like to vary her inventory and build a little kiosk to sell out of, so that her little general store can become better known in her neighborhood. This will permit her to increase her income so that she can better care for her children whom she loves so much. She is very concerned about their future and especially their schooling, because she herself is illiterate and knows that that makes life very difficult indeed. To accomplish these goals, Mrs. A. is asking for a loan of US$ 700.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

La vente des produits de premières nécessités est une activité que Madame A. Ablavi a hérité de sa maman depuis son jeune âge. Aujourd’hui, âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants. Cette activité très rémunératrice, lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famille car son mari cultivateur n’arrive pas à remplir sa responsabilité de père de famille à cause de la faiblesse de son revenu.

Très dynamique et étant consciente de son titre de mère de famille, elle cherche toujours à mieux faire pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Ainsi donc, elle voudrait augmenter son étalage et construire un kiosque pour mieux se faire connaître dans sa zone. Ceci va lui permettre d’améliorer son revenu pour mieux s’occuper de ses enfants qu’elle aime tant. Car elle tient beaucoup à leur avenir surtout à leurs études parce que son analphabétisation ne la profite pas. Pour réaliser ce projet, elle sollicite un crédit de $700.

loans.use:
building a kiosk and increasing her inventory

construction d'un kiosque et approvisionnement de marchandises

loans.name: Saxo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Saxo A., 55, is married and mother of three children. She also cares for her brother's two children. She lives with her husband who is a mason. They reside in Akoin (Alinka) where she has a vegetable garden. She manages to help support her family thanks to her earnings from selling her vegetables.

Although she is illiterate, Mrs. A. is very intelligent and very good at managing her business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 300 so that she can buy chemical fertilizers to increase her vegetable plot's productivity.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Saxo âgée de 55 ans est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants de son frère. Elle vie avec son mari maçon. Elle réside à Akoin (Alinka), où elle exerce comme activité les cultures maraîchères. Elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de la famille grâce à la vente des légumes. Bien qu’analphabète, elle est douée d’une intelligence remarquable et a une bonne gestion de ses activités. Elle sollicite un crédit de $300 pour l’achat des produits chimique pour améliorer sa productivité.

loans.use:
Purchase of chemical fertilizers

Achat de produits chimiques

loans.name: Victoria Zorida

texts.en:
Victoria Zorida V. T. belongs to a village bank called “Nobleza,” which is a Spanish word for “Nobility.”

Victoria spent the majority of her professional life as a practicing obstetrician in the outskirts of Ayacucho, Peru. When she moved into the city some years ago, however, she could only find work sporadically which was not enough to provide for her newborn son. Victoria was eventually able to find work in “Rosita’s Pharmacy,” which she inherited from the owner eight months ago.

Now the owner/manager of a small pharmacy, Victoria hopes to be able to hire an employee so that she can spend more time with her five-year-old son, Fabio Fernando. Her long-term goal, however, is to one day run a health clinic for adolescents which would provide health advice and care, as well as a pharmacy.

Within her village bank, Victoria says she has been able to utilize her knowledge as an OB-GYN by advising the many mothers within her group. Victoria is asking for a $1000 loan with which she will buy more reliable name brand drugs for her pharmacy to replace the generic brands stocked by the previous owner.

loans.use: buy more reliable name brand drugs to replace the generic brands she presently sells

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Huamaní T. belongs to the village bank “Bienestar II” which is Spanish for “Wellbeing II.”

Vilma makes her living through the sale of “abarrotes,” or general food items in bulk, such as flour, rice, cereals, cooking oil, and a variety of other products. She is based in Ayacucho, however, because it is difficult to generate profits in a city with much competition and a high level of poverty, she travels great distances to find more profitable markets. Four days of the week, Vilma wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to travel at least two hours outside the city limits to sell her products, only to return the same night and leave again the next day. It is a difficult way to make a living, but worth it, she says, as it is much more lucrative and necessary to support her family as she was, until recently, a single mother. She has two grown children and a brand new baby girl with her new husband.

In addition to the great amounts of traveling, Vilma also has a stand in a local cooperative open seven days a week, which her older daughter maintains while she is away. Vilma has been selling “abarrotes” for a little more than twenty years. Her goal she says is to one day own a large grocery store where people can come and find everything they need.

Vilma loves to be a part of her village bank. She says it is a very beautiful thing. She thinks it is an essential part of helping women to become economically independent and better support their families. With the US$ 500 loan for which she is asking, Vilma will be able to buy food supplies that she can sell, as well as gasoline for the long distances she travels in her car.

loans.use: to buy food supplies that she can sell, as well as gasoline for the long distances she has to travel in her car

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi A., 35, was born in Tado and lives in Akoin (Alinka). Married and mother of four children, she lives with her husband who is a surveyor. Her primary business venture is kerosene sales as well as sales of soap made from palm oil (traditional Togolese soap). Mrs. A. had to leave school during her primary school years. She is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 800 that she plans to use to stock kerosene so as to grow her business and increase her income from it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 35 ans, Madame A. Amavi est née à Tado et réside à Akoin (Alinka). Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle vie avec son mari. Son activité principale est la vente du pétrole et du savon fait à bas de l’huile de palme (savon traditionnel) elle a abandonné ses études au cours primaire. Son mari est géomètre de métier. Elle sollicite un montant de $800 pour faire le stockage de pétrole pour mieux accroître son activité et acquérir des bénéfices.

loans.use:
Kerosene sales

Stockage de petrole

loans.name: Yaovi Richard

texts.fr:
Married and father of 5 children, Mr. Yaovi Richard S. is 44 years old and lives in Amégnran, the village where he was born. A trained carpenter, he owns his own carpentry shop, "Lom Nava Dynamique". The quality of his work earns him a good reputation in his area, and the earnings from his shop are used to support his family. However, the regularity of this income depends on a steady supply of wood and on having modern tools and machines so that he can fill orders in a timely fashion.

For this reason, Mr. S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood and appropriate tools and machines. This will allow him to be certain of a steady income so that he can better cater for the needs of his family and improve their standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, Monsieur S. Yaovi Richard est âgé de 44 ans et réside à Amégnran, son village natal. Menuisier de profession, il est maître de la menuiserie « LOM NAVA DYNAMIQUE ». La qualité de ses ouvrages lui confère une bonne réputation dans sa localité. Le revenu tiré de ses prestations de service lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais aussi, la stabilité de ce revenu dépend elle de la disponibilité des bois d’œuvre et de machines modernes afin de pouvoir satisfaire à temps voulu les demandes. C’est ainsi que Monsieur S. sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter du bois d’œuvre et des machines appropriées. Ceci lui permettra de stabiliser et de sécuriser son revenu pour mieux répondre aux besoins primaires de sa famille et d’en améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use:
Purchase of wood and tools

Achat de bois et de machines

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia P. G. belongs to the village bank “Azucenas,” which means “tiger lily” in Spanish.

Lidia has been selling clothing for many years. Originally in the Peruvian “selva,” or the Amazon Rainforest, but ten years ago Lidia moved to Ayacucho. She now has a clothing stand that she sets up every Sunday in one of the local markets, selling shoes of all types as well as clothing for all occasions. As many of Lidia’s customers are of limited resources, the majority of the clothing she sells is second-hand. The rest of the week Lidia sells her products from within her home where she says her regular customers prefer to come.

Eventually, Lidia would like to establish a clothing store with a fixed address, growing her business as much as she can. With the $1100 dollar loan for which she is asking, Lidia will be able to buy a permanent stand, the first step she says, in accomplishing her long-term goals. Within her village bank, Lidia feels very happy and her face lights up when she talks about it. She says it is a place where she can socialize with friends and be distracted from the difficulties of life.

loans.use: to buy a permanent stand (booth) to display her clothing for sale

loans.name: Haydee Luz

texts.en:
Haydee Luz A. Q. belongs to a village bank called “Bonanza.”

Haydee earns her living making and marketing beautiful handicrafts (artesanías). The majority of her works are “tejidos al telar” which are crafts such as tapestries and carpets woven on a loom. Haydee says her specialty is in “artesanías finas,” which are very complex pieces stitched onto processed fabric. Together with her husband she owns a shop called “Qory Qayto,” which is Quechua (their native language) for “Thread of Gold.” Their clients, mostly foreigners, contract with them for specific projects which Haydee and her husband help design. The time it takes to complete one piece can range from one day for a simple tapestry to more than two weeks for large and elaborate orders.

To supplement their income and support their two children, ages 7 and 19, every Sunday Haydee prepares several dishes such as “ceviche,” Peru’s national dish of fresh raw fish soaked in lime juice, which she sells in the local market. Although she has been weaving tapestries for twenty-two years with her husband, Haydee loves to cook. She says her real dream is to open up a small restaurant to which she would be able to dedicate herself full-time.

Haydee loves to be a part of her village bank, which she says provides an enormous amount of support to the women who are involved. She is asking for a $400 loan, with which she will be able to buy the necessary materials for her weaving including fabric, thread, and various tools.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for her weaving including fabric, thread, and various tools

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi A. is 40 years old and lives in the village of Atsèti in the Vo prefecture. She is married with five children. A devoted mother, she manages the household thanks to a small business selling rice. In fact, she cooks the rice and sells it on the street. The business makes her tired but it is very profitable. She has a lot of confidence and wants to build a shed in which to do the cooking and vary her menu. In addition, she needs to stock up on grocery items in order to satisfy her customers. To do this, she is asking for a loan of $600. This will enable her to improve her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afi est âgée de 40 ans et vit dans le village d’Atsèti dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Très dévouée, elle participe à la gestion de son ménage grâce à son petit commerce de riz. En effet, elle prépare du riz qu’elle vend à la sauvette. C’est une activité qui la fatigue mais très rentable.Confiante, elle a voulu construire un hangar sous lequel elle fera sa restauration et diversifier son menu. Outre cette construction, elle doit faire un ravitaillement en produits alimentaires afin de pouvoir rassurer sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $600. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: To build a shed and stock up on grocery items

loans.name: Hilda Maurina

texts.en:
Hilda Maurina M. C. belongs to the village bank called “Pura Vida,” which means “Pure Life” in Spanish.

Hilda, along with the rest of her family, open up their home on Sundays as a restaurant. With a big back patio, colorful umbrellas, and lots of green flora, Hilda’s restaurant has become a popular destination for families on their day of rest. Hilda and her mother are always in the kitchen cooking Peruvian favorites such as “puca,” a dish containing potatoes, peanuts, meat, and rice. Meanwhile, her sister and father are running the logistical side of things.

Although the restaurant keeps the family busy throughout the week, Hilda also has her own separate small business of fresh meat supply. Each Saturday, she wakes up very early to drive four hours and buy sheep, cows, and pigs. She then takes the animals to a nearby market and her customers request specific cuts of meat. The rest of the week is then spent selling any animals that are not sold immediately in the market.

Hilda says her dream is to one day open up her very own butcher shop, complete with a corral. She says she has done everything she can to support her four children, one grown, two in high school, and the other in elementary school. This is why she says she loves her village bank which has helped her to save money towards her goal. Hilda is requesting a US$ 700 loan which she will invert back into both of her businesses, buying ingredients for the restaurant and more animals for the market.

loans.use: buying ingredients for her restaurant and more animals for the market

loans.name: Soenyihoin

texts.fr:
Mr. Soenyihoin A. was born in 1947 in Atsansi-Djita. Married and a family man, he works in agriculture. The income he makes from selling agricultural products enables him to manage his household expenses. But today the profit from agriculture has decreased considerably and it is difficult for him to meet the needs of his family. To make his agricultural business more productive again, he is asking for a loan of $750 to buy fertilizer and thus increase the production capacity of his land. This will improve the living conditions of an entire family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Soenyihoin est né en 1947 à Atsansi-Djita. Marié et père de famille, il exerce l’agriculture. C’est grâce au revenu tiré de la vente des produits agricole qu’il gère son ménage. Mais aujourd’hui, le rendement agricole a considérablement diminué et difficilement, il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Pour redynamiser son agriculture, il demande un crédit de $750 pour acheter du fertilisant pour augmenter la capacité de production de sa terre. Ceci permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de toute une famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer valiente y con alto sentido de servicio que cada día busca obtener ganancias con su labor y también procura que las personas que acudan a ella por su servicio se beneficien. Desde siempre se ha caracterizado por sus inmensas ansias de conocimiento y es gracias ha este apetito que en sus años de juventud decidió estudiar la carrera de sociología porque siempre tuvo anhelos de observar y ayudar a construir una mejor sociedad; es por ello que se dedicó por mucho tiempo a la docencia al igual que su esposo. Pasaron los años y cuando su esposo se jubiló recibió una liquidación por sus años de servicio y después de hacer un análisis de demandas generales en su sociedad ambos decidieron abrir sus pequeñas microempresas para continuar satisfaciendo sus necesidades con éxito y sin ninguna premura. Rosa se decidió por instalar un molino de granos y su esposo por una empresa productora de yeso. Gracias a su incansable labor les ha podido brindar educación y bienestar a sus hijas y ahora desea seguir cumpliendo esa noble labor con su hija menor de 14 años. Ahora desea implementar e incrementar los servicios de su molinera para seguir ofreciendo a las diligentes familias de su localidad un excelente servicio además de las rebajas y promociones acostumbradas con el objetivo de que ellas también puedan verse beneficiadas al momento de realizar la venta final de sus productos. Tu aporte será muy valioso decídete hoy a colaborar con esta solidaria mujer.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa is a strong woman with a great work ethic who, every day, seeks new ways to increase her earnings by working hard. She also works every day to ensure that the people who depend on her are satisfied. She has always been characterized by her immense thirst for knowledge and it is thanks to this that in her younger years she decided to study sociology. She always had a desire to observe and help others in building a better society; it is because of this that she chose the same course of study as her husband. A few years later, when her husband retired, they received a pension for his years of service. After analyzing their community, they saw a demand and decided to open a small business to continue to meet their needs successfully and quickly. Rosa began work on a grain mill and her husband on a plant producing herbs. Through their tireless efforts they have been able to provide for education and wellbeing of their daughters and hope to continue with their youngest daughter who is 14. Now she would like to begin and increase different services in her mill to be able to continue offering excellent service to the local families who depend on her, besides the usual discounts and promotions, with the hope that they too might benefit from the final sale of their products. Your contribution will be very valuable! Decídete today to work in together with this Rosa!

loans.use: Improvement on the mill to increase productivity

loans.name: Fiovi

texts.fr:
Aged 50, Mr. Fiovi D. is married and the father of 11 children. He lives in Avégloédjigan in the Vo prefecture. His profession is making jewelry, which he handcrafts. He makes a good living from selling his products (rings and other jewelry) but it is not enough to meet the needs of his large family with any ease. He works sporadically, mainly when he has collected enough materials, but falls into poverty when he cannot afford to buy what he needs. To ease this situation he is asking for a loan of $900 to buy plenty of materials and a machine, so that he will not disappoint his customers. This will provide him with a steady income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 50 ans, Monsieur D. Fiovi est marié et père d’une famille de onze (11) enfants. Il réside à Avégloédjigan dans la préfecture de Vo. Il est bijoutier traditionnel de profession et travaille de façon manuelle. La vente des produits qu’il fabrique (bagues, bijoux) lui procure un revenu important mais non suffisant pour subvenir sans difficulté aux besoins de sa grande famille. Il exerce de façon périodique surtout lorsqu’il réunit des matériels ; mais il tombe en disette quand il manque de matériels faute d’argent. Pour palier ce problème, il demande un crédit de $900 pour se procurer en abondance de matériels et d’une machine afin de pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de régulariser son revenu.

loans.use: To buy materials and a machine

loans.name: Soaleme

texts.fr:
Aged 60, Mrs Soalémé A. is married and the mother of three children, with 10 other people in her care. She lives with her husband in Togblé. Her main business is selling fish and condiments, which she has been doing for over 10 years. Often faced with stock shortages and lacking funds, she is asking for financial help of $600. This will enable her to obtain a solid stock so that she can once again operate her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 60 ans, Madame A. Soalémé est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et dix (10) autres personnes à sa charge. Elle vie avec son mari à Togblé. Son activité principale est la vente des poissons et des condiments depuis plus de 10 ans. Souvent confronté à la rupture de stock et manquant de fond de commerce, elle sollicite un apport financier de $600. Ceci lui permettra de faire un stock consistant afin de pouvoir relancer son activité.

loans.use: To buy small fish

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Born in 1962 in Ahonlogoé, Mr. Yawo A. is the father of seven children, some of whom are apprentices and others are in school. He specializes in market gardening and has a business growing chili peppers and vegetables. But when the water dries up, he can no longer run his business and has to temporarily cease trading. His ability to manage his income has, until now, allowed him to meet the needs of his household. Hoping to increase the area he farms in order to make more profit, he plans to buy a motorized pump to make it easy to water his garden. He also needs fertilizer. To do this, he is asking for a loan of $1,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1962 à Ahonlogoé, Monsieur A. Yawo est père de sept (07) enfants dont certains sont en apprentissage et d’autres sont scolarisés. Spécialiste du maraîchage, il produit du piment et des légumes qu’il commercialise. Mais lorsque les eaux tarissent, son activité n’est plus possible et il est obligé de rompe. Sa capacité de gestion des revenus lui a permis jusqu’ici de subvenir aux besoins de son ménage. Dans le souci d’agrandir la surface qu’il exploite en vue d’accroître le rendement, il prévoit se procurer une motopompe lui permettant d’arroser facilement son jardin. Il a aussi besoin de fertilisant. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit $1000.

loans.use: To buy a motorized pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Ablam Renaud

texts.fr:
Ablam Renaud D., age 30, currently resides in the village of Amégnran. He is married and the father of four, but he supports two more, which brings the number of his dependents to six. A painter by profession, he is a recognized artist in his area and is known for the quality of his work. His shop was wrecked, so he is forced to stay home due to a lack of funds. Yet he is more and more in demand and feels the need to fix up his shop, so that people can locate him when the time comes. He is requesting a loan of $1,000.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 30 ans, Monsieur D. Ablam Renaud réside actuellement dans le village d’Amégnran. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants mais il en supporte deux de plus ; ce qui porte le nombre des personnes à sa charge à six (06). Peintre de profession, Monsieur D. est un artiste reconnu dans le milieu de par la qualité des services qu’il rend. Son atelier étant démoli, il est contraint de rester à la maison faute de moyens. Cependant, il est de plus en plus sollicité et il ressent la nécessité de réaménager son atelier où les gens peuvent le retrouver au moment opportun. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000.

loans.use: To refurbish his shop

loans.name: Gladys Karina

texts.es:
Gladys es una trabajadora mujer que se esfuerza día a día y agota todas sus energías para poder ofrecer sus excelentes platos de comida china a sus exigentes comensales que la visitan durante todo el día en su modesto restaurante. Esta actividad la viene desempeñando hace ya siete años y comenzó vendiendo en una pequeña carretilla siempre con la ayuda y compañía de su querido esposo, esto gracias al préstamo de su suegro. Después de tres años de éxito decidieron establecerse en un local alquilado donde ya llevan cerca de cuatro años y es así que siguen manteniendo el inmenso esfuerzo que requiere su negocio ya que les permite incrementar el número de sus clientes y generar mayores beneficios para sus pequeños hijos. Sus metas son grandes pues sueña abrir otros establecimientos de comida y se ha propuesto seguir trabajando diligentemente para lograrlo ahora aún más debido a que su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud y actualmente requiere un costoso tratamiento médico para aliviarse pronto. Gladys seguirá trabajando y es por ello que necesita un préstamo de 350 dólares que invertirá para mejorar las instalaciones su establecimiento. No pierdas esta valiosa oportunidad de colaborar con Gladys, al apoyarla también apoyarás a toda una familia.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys is a dedicated woman that works hard every day and devotes all of her energy to offering excellent Chinese food to the diners that visit her small restaurant every day. This venture began seven years ago, selling from a small cart. It was made possible by the help and company of her beloved husband and thanks to a loan from her father-in-law. After three years of success, Gladys and her husband decided to establish their business in a rented shop where they have been for nearly four years. They have continued to put incredible effort into their business and have been able to build their clientele little by little and create more earnings to support their small children. Their goals are big and they dream of opening other restaurants. They have committed to continue working diligently to achieve this goal. However, right now a more urgent matter is that her husband is in poor health and needs an expensive medical procedure. Gladys will continue working and this is why they are asking for a loan of $350 to improve the facilities of their location. Don't miss this valuable opportunity to work with Gladys. Helping her will help her whole family!

loans.use: Starting up a small Chinese restaurant

loans.name: Seidou

texts.fr:
Séidou S., age 44, was born in Lomé and resides in Togblé. He has been a truck driver for 15 years. Married and the father of six, he also has three other dependents to care for. During his free time, he takes care of his livestock (cows, chickens). His vehicle's current condition prevents him from earning a good living; to do so, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a new one in order to improve living conditions for him and his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur S. Séidou, âgé de 44 ans est né à Lomé et réside à Togblé. Il est conducteur d’engin lourd depuis 15 ans, marié et père de six (06) enfants et trois (03) autres personnes à charge. Pendant ses heures libres il s’occupe de son élevage (bovins, poules). L’état actuel de son véhicule ne lui permet pas de bien faire son travail. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter une nouvelle afin d’améliore sa condition de vie et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr:
Catherine A. was born in 1975 in Yohonou (Vo Prefecture). Married and mother of two, she runs a second-hand clothing business. By this work and because of her large customer base, she has acquired a great deal of basic management experience. The income she generates enables her to provide for the needs of her family and provide valuable help in maintaining her household. A very energetic woman full of initiative, she wishes to make use of substantial working capital in order to grow her revenue. She is requesting a loan of $1,200.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Catherine est née en 1975 à Yohonou dans la préfecture de Vo. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle mène comme activité, le commerce de friperie. Elle a à travers cette activité et l’importance de sa clientèle, acquis une grande expérience en matière de gestion de fonds. Le revenu tiré de ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de participer valablement à la gestion de son foyer. Très dynamique et pleine d’esprit d’initiative, elle a le désir de disposer d’un fond de roulement consistant afin de pouvoir accroître son revenu. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1200.

loans.use: To buy bails of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Manuel Rolando

texts.es:
My name is Manuel R.. I provide transport services in my city Dali. I have an itinerary that goes through the city from Colonia Nuvea Esperanza to Danli's regional hospital. I've done this for three years since I'm retired and it is my only means of income. These days, I need to buy various parts for the motor and steering wheel of my bus to provide better service to passengers. I also make trips to the park during the weekends - this is another activity that generates a bit of income on the side. With the earnings I make, I can sustain my household.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Manuel R. me dedico a prestar servicios de tranportes de pasajestos en mi ciudad Danli, cuento con una ruta urbana de la Colonia Nueva Esperanza al Hospital Regional de Danli, actividad que realizo hace tres años, ya que soy una persona jubilada y es mi unico ingreso monetario, en estos momentos necesito comprar varios repuestos del motor y la direccion de mi bus para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes, tambien hago viajes a parques los fines de semana y esta es otra actividad que me genera un poco mas de ingresos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Victor Sindolfo

texts.es:
Hi, my name is Victor Sindolfo. I have a grocery store in the center of my community. I operate it under the name "Pulperia Norma". I have years of experience in the small-store retail business. The income from this business allows me to cover my expenses and make other types of payments to my vendors. Thanks to previous loans, I've been able to fill up my inventory since my business is growing, but my customers' demands require me to yet again stock up. Since the busy Christmas season is approaching, I especially want to buy certain items like chicken and ribs to sell and provide better service to my customers. The profits I earn will allow me to sustain my family's needs and educate my children, since my store is the only source of income for our household.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Victor Sindolfo, cuento con una pulperia en el centro de mi comunidad,operando bajo el Nombre de Pulperia Norma, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias al prestamos que se me otorgo anteriomente pude surtir mas mi negocio, pero a las exigencias de mis clientes necesito surtirlo mas ya que mi negocio va creciendo y como ya viene la epoca navideña quiero comprar pollos y piernas de cerdo para vender y asi brindar un mejor servicio a mis clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia y educar a mis hijos ya que mi negocio es mi unica fuente de ingresos.

loans.use: Buy goods like sugar, salt, bread, beans, ham, fritters, soups, sauces, chiles, spices, oil, lard, pasta, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is a hard-working woman. She strives each day to move ahead. She focuses all her energy on her 2 young daughters. One is 10 and the other one is 11 years old. Raquel wants to be able to give them a better future. They give her energy and strength to face any dificulties ahead. Her husband is non-existent for 10 years. She suffered from a terrible depression and she spiral down into debt because he was the only breadwinner.

Out of pure necessity she worked many odd jobs to be able to support her girls. With time and with some savings, she was able to purchase a cow. She worked very diligently at it and was very satisfied with the results. About 6 months ago, she decided to open up a hardware store because there was a need for it in her town. With the sale of some of the animals she had previously purchased, she was able to buy some merchandise for her hardware store. She wants to find ways to increase her profit even more by delivering materials/merchandise to job sites and/or residences.

To continue with the goals Raquel has made for herself, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $350 USD to purchase more merchandise such as tools, nails, etc. Be part of this business and of the well-being of this family by helping this energetic mother and her two girls.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel es una mujer luchadora y cada día con entusiasmo sale adelante, invirtiendo todas sus fuerzas para forjar un mejor futuro para sus dos hijas de diez y once años que la motivan, le dan fuerzas y valor para enfrentar situaciones difíciles.Hace diez años su querido esposo dejó de existir y este hecho la sumió en una terrible depresión e inmensa crisis económica porque era él el único miembro del hogar que sostenía las necesidades diarias de su familia.Y ante la necesidad de ocuparse en alguna labor para generar ingresos para la satisfacción de las necesidades de sus pequeñas niñas ha desempeñado diversos trabajos, con el tiempo y con suma diligencia en sus ocupaciones pudo ahorrar para comprarse una vaca y trabajó denodadamente para aumentar su pequeño establo, obtuvo muchas satisfacciones al observar que sí logró lo que se había propuesto. Y hace seis meses se traza otra meta para incursionar en ella ya que su localidad carecía de este servicio y la demanda se acrecentaba notablemente; así con la venta de uno de sus animales pudo comprar mercadería para su ferretería y sigue trabajando para seguir generando mayores ingresos y desea implementar una estrategia de negocio la de repartir a domicilio su mercadería cuando la soliciten. Para continuar con las metas que se ha trazado Raquel solicita 350 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de mercadería tales como fierros, clavos y demás.Solidarízate y aporta con tu colaboración para bienestar de esta enérgica madre y sus dos pequeños tesoros.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane A. is 29 years old and a single mother. She lives in Kouassi with her 11 year old daughter who is starting secondary school this month (October 2007). Viviane has been selling various dry aromatic products in the Koumassi market since she left school eight years ago. After she got her baby she was not able to continue her studies because she did not have resources to care for her baby and pay school expenses.
Viviane got her first loan from AE&I in January 2006 and has performed very well since then. She wants to use part of the loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses for her daughter.

loans.use: Viviane Ano will use the loan to purchase goods and school expenses

loans.name: Saul Hipolito

texts.es:
Saúl has a small tailor shop set up at home which is located downtown Danli. He has been a tailor for many years and this activity has allowed him to support his family. This business is doing very well; Saúl has picked up ongoing orders to make pants to be sold in San Isidro market (Tegucigalpa). He makes dozens of pairs of pants to supply these orders, so he needs to have enough fabric in stock. Now that the Christmas season is coming, the orders have grown and clothes will sell well. Saúl’s expectation is to get a sewing machine with the profits of the incoming season. He believes that taking care of the family is the most important thing.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Saul, cuento con una pequeña sastreria en mi casa de habitacion, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente me va muy bien con mi negocio ya que hice unos contratos permanentes para la elaboracion de pantalones de tela los cuales son vendidos en el mercado San Isidro en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, fabrico los pantalones por docena, en estos momentos necesito tener mucho inventario de telas ya que tengo un pedido muy grande por motivo que vienen las fiestas navideñas y la ropa se vende muy bien, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme una maquina de costurar y alimentar mi familia que es lo mas importante.

loans.use: To buy suiting fabric, zippers, reels of thread, buttons, and hangers.

loans.name: Roxana Arezon

texts.es:
Roxana is a young mother and has a very young three year-old daughter, whom she gives her love and shares with her the sweat and fruits of her labor. For various years, with the support of her relatives in the dressmaking business, she obtained work in haute couture like dressmaking and designing various items of clothing. By profession, she is tailor; it took her three long years to prepare and make beautiful articles of clothing to satisfy her very demanding clients. Given her excellent work, she has become one of the best and sought after dressmakers in the region. She likes to make each item with extreme care and in line with each client's style.Currently, she makes beautiful,exquisite articles of clothing that are ready to be sold and/or rented. She offers additional services like mending or does any other tailor-related work at request. Her busiest season is from December to February because of the various festivities and holiday parties that happen in her area. She is seeking a loan of $350 to buy windows and-or counters to display her designs, so that she can be ready for the massive orders that are coming her way and increase her output. Let´s support the delicate and beautiful labors of this young woman who continue to complete and provide each and every one of her daughter´s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Roxana es una joven madre de una pequeña niña de tres años a la cual cada día le da su amor y siempre comparte con ella la noble labor que desempeña desde hace varios años con el apoyo de sus familiares en su pequeño centro de confecciones en el que realiza trabajos de alta costura como vestidos de promoción y prendas de vestir.Ella es costurera de profesión y le ha tomado tres largos años prepararse para confeccionar hermosas prendas para satisfacción de su exigente cartera de clientes y debido a su excelente desempeño se ha convertido una de las mejores y solicitadas costureras de su zona, le gusta elaborar cada prenda con sumo cuidado y de acuerdo al estilo de cada uno de sus clientes.Ahora está confeccionando hermosísimas prendas con finísimos acabados para venderlos y/o alquilarlos además de ofrecer adicionalmente el servicio de remiendo y otros trabajos de costura que le envíen o soliciten.El tiempo en que ella recibe mayores pedidos es desde el mes de diciembre hasta el mes de febrero por las diferentes festividades que acontecen en su localidad y para abastecer la enorme cantidad de pedidos que se avecinan e incrementar su producción solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para comprar vitrinas y mostradores para exponer sus diseños.Colaboremos con la delicada y bellísima labor de esta joven madre para que continúe brindándole finos acabados a cada uno de los sueños de su pequeña niña.

loans.use: To buy windows and/or counters to exhibit fine designs

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
Awa P. is a dynamic 21 year old lady. She lives with her family in Koumassi, a populated suburb in the south of Abidjan. Awa did not get the chance to go to school. She started selling goods with her mother when she was 16. Three years later she got her own space in the market. She sells various aromatic and crops products in the Koumassi market. Awa is very ambitious and courageous. She actively and consistently contributes to her family's revenues Her father, who is a taxi driver, is proud of her.
Awa joined AE&I microcredit program in June 2006 and has performed very well since then.

loans.use: Awa Pouya will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
My name is Alvaro R. and I've had a small business selling ice cream on the streets of my community and neighboring villages for the past two years. I distribute my products on a bicycle outfitted with a cooler. I have a lot of customers, because the weather in my community is very hot and people like to consume a lot of ice cream cones and paletas. With a previous loan I was able to buy a new cooler and a bicycle to visit more communities. Presently I need to buy more products to increase my sales, which will enable me to buy another cooler and use the old bicycle to offer employment to a family member; most importantly, it will allow me to cover my famiy's living expenses and provide for my children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Alvaro R. , tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de helados (ice cream) el que distribuyo en una bicicleta de manera ambulante en toda mi comunidad y aldeas vecinas, actividad que realizo hace un par de años, tengo muy buena clientela ya que en nuestra comunidad hace mucha calor y la gente compra bastante las paletas y los conos, gracias al prestamo anterior pude comprarme un freezer nuevo y otra bicicleta para poder visitar mas comunidades, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas producto para tener mayores ventas y asi poder comprar otra hielera y utilizar la bicicleta vieja para darle trabajo a un familiar en la venta de mis helados y lo mas importate cubrir con los gastos familiares y educacion de mis hijos,

loans.use: To buy ice cream, paletas (frozen juice bars), sugar cones and plastic cups

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
My name is Reina S. and I've made a living the past two years making and selling sweets made of sugar and honey. I sell these door to door, on the streets of neighboring villages, and at the local tobacco factories. Presently I need a loan to buy more raw materials, packaging materials and containers to be used in the production of my sweets, as my customers' demand is increasing and my business is growing. This will allow me to increase my sales and my earnings, which I need in order to cover my family's living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Reina S. me dedico a la produccion y venta de dulces de azucar y miel, actividad que realizo hace un par de años y los reparto de forma domiciliar y ambulante en aldeas vecinas y fabricas de tabacos, en estos momentos necesito un prestamo para comprar mas materia prima, material de empaque y recipientes para la elaboracion de mi producto ya que mi negocio esta creciendo y la demanda de mis clientes es bastante, esto me permitiria aumentar mis ventas y asi obtener mayores ganacias las cuales las necesito para cumplir con mayor solvencia los gastos familiares.

loans.use: To buy sugar, food colorings and flavorings, honey, firewood

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Ms. Amelia A. is 46-years-old, and married to Mr. Amelio Cabrera. Mr. Cabrera is in sales. Together they have four children, the oldest works in the neighboring country of Argentina. The younger three are still in high school. 

Amelia has had a small convenient store, known as a despensa, for the last three years. She has established a regular clientele that is very thankful for the good-quality products and friendly service Amelia offers. 
In talking about her store, Amelia tells us that her husband worked very hard for several years to pull together enough Money to open the despensa. They began by selling herbal medications to the despensas and other small shops closet o their house. This activity brought them a good deal of success. From this they were later able to establish a small shop out of their house. 

Through their hard work Amelia and Amelio have been able to obtain a number of conveniences. The Money they earned allowed them to build their own house as well as provide their children with a higher quality of life and an education. For Amelia, above all things, it is important that her children are well taken care of. 

The money Amelia has solicited from the Foundation will allow her to buy merchandise for her store. She plans to buy the following things: sugar, yerba mate (tea), noodles, sodas and other common products.

loans.use: She plans to buy the following things: sugar, yerba mate (tea), noodles, sodas and other common products.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
My name is Mercedes M. and my main occupation is the production and sale of Nacatamales (a type of tamale wrapped in plantain leaves) and fried plantains, which I have been doing for the past four years. My customers are very good and what they like best is the flavor of my nacatamales. Presently, I need to buy more ingredients to produce more of my products, as during the approaching Christmas season sales increase when people place large orders. With my earnings I plan to hire a helper to assist me in the production of the nacatamales to meet this increased demand, which will allow me to continue supporting my home.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Mercedes M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de Nacatamales y platanos fritos activiadad que realizo hace 4 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que yo los atiendo personalmente y lo que mas les gusta es el sabor de mis nacatamales, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de mi producto ya que en estos dias las ventas son muy buenas porque la navidad se hacerca y la gente empieza a hacer pedidos al por mayor, con las ganancias que obtenga dese emplear una persona para que me ayude a la fabricacion de mis nacatamales y lo mas importante el sustento de mi hogar.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, vegetables, chicken and pork, seasonings, plantains and plantain leaves

loans.name: Reina Marcelina

texts.es:
My name is Reina M. and for the past four years I have dedicated myself to the sale of staples such as beans, rice and corn. My customers are loyal because I sell quality products at prices which are affordable in our community. My children help me transporting my product to my small store. Presently I would like to buy more grains to meet the increased demand during the approaching Christmas season, when sales are very good. With my earnings I will continue to feed my family and remodel my store so I can provide my customers with better services.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Reina M. me dedico a la venta de granos basicos como ser frijoles, arroz, maiz, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, mis clientes me prefieren ya que la calidad de mi producto es muy buena y los precios son accesibles para nuestra comunidad, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para transportar mi producto a mi bodega, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas granos basicos ya que se hacerca la epoca navideña y las ventas son muy buenas , con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y remodelar mi bodega para tener una mejor atencion a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice and corn

loans.name: Erica De Jesus

texts.es:
My name is Erica B. and I've made a living the past four years by selling food and other staples. My son helps me tend to my customers, who like the products I sell and the affordable prices I charge them. Presently I need to buy more products to resell and to stock up on meats for the upcoming Christmas season, when chicken and pork sell very well. With my earnings I would like to remodel my store and buy a freezer to store meats and dairy products. Most importantly, this will allow me to feed my family, as my business is our only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Erica B. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencio de mis clientes los cuales son muy buenos ya que les gusta mucho el tipo de producto que vendo y tambien el precio que es muy accesible para nuestra comunidad, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas variedad de productos y tambien comprar carnes para vender a mis clientes ya que el pollo y el cerdo se vende mucho es estas epocas en donde ya casi estamos en navidad, con las ganancias que obtenga deseo remodelar mi negocio y comprar un frezeer para mantener las carnes y los lacteos asi mismo alimentar mi familia ya que este negocio es el unico ingreso que tengo.

loans.use: To buy churros (fried pastry), soft drinks, dairy products, beans, salt, bread, rice, corn, sugar, soups, candy, sweet white bread, matches, sardines, soaps, toothpaste, lard and meats

loans.name: Marlenia

texts.es:
My name is Marlenia A., and I dedicate myself to selling general consumer goods from my grocery store. I have been in business – which I manage myself -- for several years, and am very well known locally as I have lived in this community for 35 years. I would like to further supply my store with basic market products, and since prices have gone up I could use additional funds to buy a greater variety of goods. With my earnings I can help to feed my family, as being a senior this is my only means of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

mi Nombre es Marlenia A. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace varios años el cual administro personalmente, tengo muy buena clientela y soy una persona muy conocida y querida por mis vecinos ya que tengo 35 años de vivir en esta comunidad, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que muchos productos de la canasta basica han aumentado de precio y necesito mayor capital para comprar mas variedad de productos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia ya que como soy de la tercera edad es mi unica fuente de ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell in grocery store.

loans.name: Gloria Verónica

texts.es:
Gloria is a mother and enthusiastic woman who never misses a chance to live her life to the fullest, enjoying time with her husband and four children. Her children, now near the final years of schooling, attend a prestigious university in their small city and this effort to complete their educations requires a substantial economic investment. For this reason, three months ago Gloria decided to open a small general store with the help of a small loan.

Thanks in great part to her charisma, she has seen with much satisfaction a healthy growth in her business. This success serves to further motivate her to grow her enterprise to help improve her family’s quality of life. She has applied herself to learning about sales and customer service, and she is eager to apply her lessons to her business.

She is requesting a loan of $350USD to help increase the variety of products she carries in her store, and she commits herself to repay the funds in a timely manner. Let’s support Gloria’s efforts and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es una madre y mujer muy impetuosa que no pierde la oportunidad de vivir la vida sanamente disfrutando de la compañía de su esposo y de sus cuatro hijos, que se encuentran en la etapa final de su educación en una prestigiosa universidad de su pequeña ciudad y requiere de una fuerte inversión económica; es por ello que hace tres meses ha decidido abrir una bodega con un préstamo que le dieron y con el carisma que ella tiene observa con satisfacción el crecimiento y arraigo de su pequeña tienda ya que acuden a ella a cada hora en búsqueda de los artículos de primera necesidad que ofrece con mucha gentileza. Esto la llena de optimismo y muchas ganas para seguir incrementando sus esfuerzos a fin de consolidar su actividad y seguir incrementando el nivel de vida de su querida familia.Sus continuos deseos de mejora la han llevado a capacitarse en el tema de ventas y calidad de servicio y ahora está muy deseosa de aplicar lo que ha aprendido teniendo como referencia y campo de acción a su pequeña bodeguita. Para iniciar su interesante labor ha planeado incrementar sus artículos con el objetivo de poner en marcha sus proyectos; a razón de esto solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares que se compromete a reintegrarlos puntualmente. Apoyemos el ímpetu y el esfuerzo digno ganado con arduo trabajo de Doña Gloria.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods/products for general store.

loans.name: Karlita Suyapa

texts.es:
My name is Karlita M., and my enterprise involves the sale of jewelry which I market by visiting public and private offices throughout my city. I now have several years of experience doing this, and have developed a very good clientele – particularly women who like to dress professionally for their work. My sales activities generate income for my family, and thanks to this my children are able to be educated. It is important to mention that my reputation among my customers for good quality has led to an increase in demand for my products. For this reason, I need additional capital to increase my inventory and meet demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Karlita M., soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de joyas, producto que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en mi ciudad en oficinas publicas y privadas. cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que las mujeres de las oficinas les gusta ir presentables a su lugar de trabajo, esta actividad me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, gracias a los ingresos de este negocio mis hijos pueden estudiar, es importante mensionar que en la actualidad la demanda de cliente a crecido ya que ellos conocen la calidad de mi producto y necesito de mayor inversión para satisfacer a los clientes

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry to sell to customers.

loans.name: Doris Ondina

texts.es:
My name is Doris Z. and, for the past three years, I have run a business cutting hair for men and women. I have a good record for customer satisfaction with my services. I am asking for a loan to make improvements to my place of business and for the purchase of various beauty supply products such as shampoo, hair dryers, hairbrushes, styling gel, etc. With this investment I hope to increase my earnings and improve my standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Doris Z., me dedico al corte de cabellos a damas y caballeros, actividad que realizo hace 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta como les corto el pelo especialmente a los caballeros, Actualmente solicito crédito para invertirlo en el mejoramiento del local y en la compra de materiales de belleza como shampoo, secadoras de pelo, cepillos shampoo, gel, etc. Con esta inversión espero incrementar mis ingresos y mejorar mi condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for hair salon.

loans.name: Edis Consuelo

texts.es:
My name is Edis R., and I run a small grocery store in the center of my community called the “Pulperia R.”. I have been running the business for one year, and it has generated income to help cover my living expenses. I am looking to further supply my business to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Edis R., cuento con una pulperia ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, operando bajo el nombre de Pulperia R., tengo un año de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder satifacer la demanda de cliente.

loans.use: Purchase additional products (such as bread, coffee, sugar, beverages, rice, etc.) to sell in small grocery store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a strong physical and spiritual woman. Each day she works diligently to make sure that she takes good care of her crop. Not one minute goes by that she is not attentive to her crop. She plows the land to the best of her abilities.

She is originally from Sicaya but she decided to stay in the land where she was born to get ahead. Thanks to her energy and high spirit, she has been able to support herself for 10 years and she has been able to support her family and to offer them an education as well.

With her job, she has been able to pay for the schooling of her 5 young children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land.

Francisca sows potato, corn, carrot, green beans which she then sells at the local market. She has to make sure the timing is perfect so that her crop can grow just right, or her hard work is in vain.

She is a great role model to her kids due to her discipline and diligence which are good values for her kids to learn from and to help them throughout life. Her valley, where she currently lives, is ready for sowing. She is requesting a loan to increase production with the purchase of more seeds to sow.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es una mujer D. mucha fuerza física y espiritual, día a día trabaja diligentemente para lograr una buena cosecha y es por eso que no desperdicia ni un minuto del valioso día en tiempos D. siembra para preparar el arado que utilizará para un mejor desempeño D. su labor. ElL. es natural D. Sicaya y decidió quedarse en L. tierra que L. vió nacer para progresar; gracias al ímpetu que tiene ha logrado por diez años sostenerse y brindarle a su familia educación y bienestar. Con su trabajo mantiene satisfactoriamente L. educación D. sus cinco menores hijos y este hecho L. impulsa aún más a seguir labrando L. tierra. Francisca siembra papa, maíz, zanahoria, arveja y habas para ofrecerlos en el mercado local y tiene que aprovechar al máximo el tiempo en el cuidado D. sus tierras para que en L. cosecha pueda obtener excelentes frutos D. su trabajo duro. Este ejemplo D. trabajo diligente y disciplina les otorga a cada uno D. sus hijos desD. muy pequeños para que conduzcan correctamente por el sendero L. vida.Como el valle que habita está en época D. siembra elL. solicita un préstamo para incrementar su producción con L. compra D. más semillas para su cultivo. Solidaricémonos con esta increíble madre para que continúe sembrando valores en sus hijos a fin D. que pueda cosechar muchas alegrías y satisfacciones.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to increase production

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
My name is Maria H. and I sell cosmetics such as: creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc. I have been selling for 1 year because I lost my old job and in my city it is very difficult to find a job, my goal is to be able to increase my product offering so that I can sell more and be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria H. me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos para dama como ser cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, actividad que realizo hace 1 año ya que perdi mi trabajo anterior y en nuestra ciudad es dificil conseguir un trabajo en una empresa, mi meta es poder tener muchos productos para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy inventory for my business (deodorants, creams, toothpaste, etc.)

loans.name: Santos Euralia

texts.es:
My name is Santos H. and I sell basic grains such as: corn, beans and sugar; I started my business several years ago, my clients are very good since in my community there are not many other people selling basic grains so the demand is very high; At the present time I need to buy more grains because the demand for my product is quite high; with the profit I make I will feed my family, I am a senior citizen and selling grains is the only thing I can do and it’s the only source of income for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.
