mi nombre es Santos H. me dedico a la venta de granos basicos como ser maiz, arroz, frijoles y azucar, tengo mi negocio hace varios años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en mi comunidad somos pocas las personas que vendemos granos basicos y la demanda es grande, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas granos porque las exigencias de los clientes son grandes, con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia ya que soy una persona de la tercera edad y en esto e lo unico que puedo trabajar y es mi unica fuente de ingresos tambien,

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Claudia Petrona

texts.es:
My name is Claudia R., I have a business where I sell purses. I’ve had this business for 2 years. I sell to the people that work in different offices and to my neighbors. My best clients are the young women that work in the offices since I offer great prices and my products are of good quality and brand, I have maintained my clients due to my personal attention to them. At the present time I am requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and with the income that I receive from selling the purses to be able to help my husband with our home’s monthly expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Claudia R. tengo un negocio de venta de carteras. Este negocio lo tengo hace 2 años. Yo vendo a las oficinas y a mis vecinos de mi comunidad. Mis mejores clientes son las jovenes que trabajan en oficinas ya que brindo buen precio y mis productos son de buena calidad y marca, me he ganado mi clientela por la atencion y tratos que les brindo. en la actualidad estoy solicitando prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia y con los ingresos que tengo sobre la venta de cartera ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos mensuales que tenemos en nustro hogar.

loans.use: To buy purses

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Mrs. Diana belongs to the Banco Comunal Lomas de Yarina, del Jr. Comandante Suarez nro. 1069 del sector del Arenal del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali [a community bank]. She is 24 years old, she has two children, her husband works as a taxi driver and he has a monthly income of S/. 550.00 (US$ 177.00) which is not enough money to cover the monthly expenditures of the family. Diana was invited to participate in Kiva trough the Manuel Ramos Foundation. With her previous loan she already bought a clay oven where she bakes bread, pastries, corn and yucca cakes, and other like-products. She whole sells her finished product to other women that are able to get a 40% return once they sell to the final consumer. This new loan that she is requesting of S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 Aprox.), which will be repaid in 5 months will be utilized to provide maintenance to her existing clay oven and to buy another clay oven, 1 corn bushel, 1 sugar bushel, and 1 yucca bushel. Diana is pretty excited to be able to financially contribute to her house and also to enable other women to generate income as well.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Diana pertenece al Banco Comunal Lomas de Yarina, del Jr. Comandante Suarez nro. 1069 del sector del Arenal del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como taxista en motocard, apenas tiene un ingreso de S/. 550.00 (US$ 177.00) ingreso que no es suficiente para los gastos de la familia. Diana por invitación de su vecina decide participar en los prestamos de Manuela Ramos, desde entonces decide vender dulces, panes, etc. Ahora tiene un horno hecho a barro con el cual puede elaborar los panes, bizcochuelos, ñuto de yuca, turca (bizcocho de Maíz) y Puchucuy (hecho de maíz, masato), además dada la necesidad, tuvo la iniciativa de vender por medio de otras mujeres, les da una cierta cantidad de panes a precio de costo dándoles el 40% de utilidad. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 Aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, será utilizado para mejorar su horno actual e instalar otro horno de barro, además comprará 1 saco de maíz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de yuca. Diana esta muy contenta de dar oportunidad a otras mujeres para que generen ingresos así como contribuir económicamente para su hogar.

loans.use: To buy a clay oven and raw materials

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Mrs. Diana belongs to the Banco Comunal Las lomas de Yarina, del Jr. Adolfo Lobo 139 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali [a community bank]. She is 35 years old, she has two children, her husband works in the logging business and he is only at home two times per month.

Ivonne looked for a job without luck and that’s how her neighbors suggested she contacted Kiva by the Manuela Ramos Foundation to start a business. She sells the seed of Camu Camu (fruit of the zone). She has a planting bed in her house where she plants the seeds all the way until the seeds germinate and then she sells them.

With the loan that she is requesting to the Manuela Ramos foundation of S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 Aprox.), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy another planting bed and she will also buy 1 bushel of Camu Camu seeds, 3 bushels of wood mulch, and spare wood to close the plantings beds, to keep animals away.

She is pretty excited to be able to financially contribute to her house and her ultimate goal is to save enough money to be able to buy a lot, and to plant the Camu Camu seeds herself.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ivonne pertenece al Banco Comunal Las lomas de Yarina, del Jr. Adolfo Lobo 139 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su pareja viaja al monte para trabajar en el negocio de la madera, donde 2 veces al mes puede estar en casa, dado que la necesidades son diarias.

Ivonne buscó oportunidad de trabajo no pudiendo encontrarlo, fue cuando sus vecinas le sugieren que con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos puede poner un negocio, por ello decide vender Semilla de Camu Camu (fruta de la zona), para esto instaló unos almácigos en su casa. Ella hace todo el trabajo de la germinación de la semilla, quedando listo para que los agricultores los siembren y así poder venderlo.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 aprox.) el que será pagado en 5 meses, instalará otro almácigo en su casa, además comprará 1 saco de Semilla de camu camu, 3 sacos de aserrín, madera para cercar los almácigos, evitando así, que algunos animales los malogre.

Ella esta muy contenta de contar con un ingreso para cubrir los gastos de la casa, por otro lado tiene la meta de comprar un terreno para sembrar estas semillas de camu camu.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other materials

loans.name: Juana Cleofe

texts.es:
Juana is a young woman who has found the best way to fulfill her role as mother to her three beloved young children. For the last 10 years she has worked selling yogurt. She was assisted by a cousin who taught her the craft, using milk as the principal ingredient. In the beginning, before she could make her product at home, she had to purchase milk from various people and dairies. As she saw that the cost of these purchases was very high, she decided to save her money to purchase a small milk cow. Over time, and through her the hard work caring for the animals, her cow had a calf, which increased her livestock population. Currently, she has three cows, which allow her to produce a greater quantity of yogurt and to increase her profit. Juana is very satisfied with what she has been able to accomplish; nevertheless, there are many more goals that she would like to reach. Because of this, she has decided to learn to make higher quality yogurt, and to establish a dairy at her home. She has the strength and the desire, and because of this she is requesting a $500 loan for the purchase of an additional cow. With your support we will be able to help Juana continue to work for the betterment of her family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Juana es una mujer joven que vió la mejor manera de cumplir a cabalidad su rol de madre con sus tres pequeños hijos a los cuales ama con todas sus fuerzas. Decidió hace 10 años dedicarse a la venta de yogurt por medio de una prima que le ayudó y le enseñó a elaborarlo teniendo como insumo principal a la leche; antes de desarrollar esta actividad en casa tenía que comprar la leche de diversas personas o establos y observando que el costo que invertía era muy alto decidió ahorrar para comprarse una pequeña vaquita lechera. Con el tiempo y el inmenso esfuerzo que le dedicó al cuidado de su nueva aliada su vaquita tuvo un becerrito y así aumento la población en su establo.Actualmente tiene tres vacas las que le han permitido incrementar la cantidad del yogurt que elaboraba además de sus ganancias.Juana se siente muy satisfecha por lo que ha logrado hasta ahora sin embargo es consciente de que aún tiene muchas metas que desea llegar a alcanzar por ello decidió capacitarse en la elaboración de yogurt con estándares de calidad e inició el proyecto de establecer una planta lechera en casa; los esfuerzos y las ganas la acompañan y a razón de estos anhelos solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares para adquirir una vaca más. Con tu aporte haremos que Juana siga trabajando por el bien y el desarrollo de su familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of a cow

Compra de una vaquita.

loans.name: Erika Guadalupe

texts.en:
My name is Erika N. and I make and sell a sweet bread called "rosquillas", one the traditional bakery products in my country. Thanks to a previous loan, I was able to strengthen and expand my business. At this time, I require more supplies in order to produce "rosquillas", since now there is more demand than before. I have been able to produce good revenues thanks to orders from little grocery stores and mini-markets. This is a family business, since my husband helps delivering the orders. The income I produce helps me to support my children.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Erika N. y en mi pais uno de los panes tradicionales es la rosquilla, me dedico a la elaboracion y venta. gracias al prestamo anterior pude superar y engrandecer mi negocio, en estos momentos necesito mas materiales para fabricar rosquillas ya que la demanda es mucho mayor que antes. he obtenido buenos ingresos ya que tengo varios pedidos de pulperias y mercaditos . Este negocio es familiar ya que mi esposo me ayuda a entregar los encargos. Los ingresos que percibo me ayudan a mantener a mis hijos.

loans.use: Buying curd, corn, lard, salt, firewood and other items.

loans.name: Elena Gerenarda

texts.es:
My name is Elena Gerenarda and I dedicate myself mainly to the selling business. I own a natural medicine store, selling my products door to door. I have a good clientèle, since this product has a good acceptance in my city. Thanks to this business, I can help paying family expenses. With a previous loan I was able to make my business grow and creating a bigger demand from my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Elena Gerenarda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de medicinas Naturales, el que distribuyo de manera ambulante, cuento con muy buena clientela ya que este producto tiene muy buena aceptación en mi ciudad, gracias a este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares, con el prestamo anterior logre que mi negocio creciera y que la demanda de mis clientes fuera mayor.

loans.use: Buying natural medicine products

loans.name: Odalis Maritza

texts.es:
I have a small grocery store called Odalis, which I have run from my house for the last three years. Our clientele is satisfied with the service and attention we provide them, aside from the quality products and low prices. The profits earned with my sales help me cover my financial and family responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Wendy Wise, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una pequeña pulperia llamada Odalis en mi casa de habitacion desde hace tres años. Nuestra clientela se siente satisfecha por la atencion que les brindamos, ademas por los productos de calidad y bajos precios. Los ingresos que percibo por las ventas me ayudan a cubrir los compromisos familiares y financieros

loans.use: Purchase milk, bread, eggs, corn flour, sodas, coffee, sugar and other things

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
My name is Luis G. and I sell popular consumer products. I've had my business for 4 years. My wife helps me attend our customers, who are from my community. My store is located in front of a public school. This business helps me to support my family. I would like to give jobs to others who can help me provide better customer service. I hope to remodel my home, support my family, and provide a good education with the profits I make from this business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Luis G. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mi esposa para la atencios de nuestros clientes, los cuales son de mi localidad y son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en frente de una escuela publica, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia y me gustaría en mi futuro poder darle trabajo a otras personas para una mejor atencion a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, mantener a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mis dos hijas.

loans.use: to buy popular consumer products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes works tirelessly to give her two school age daughters a better life. She has always worked toward building a sustainable future. From a young age she has been involved in sales, and for the last 20 years she has sold fodder (animal feed) and alfalfa for farm animals such as Guinea pigs and rabbits, among others. She does this job together with her husband, working as a team. In the beginning, she worked as a reseller, purchasing lots of alfalfa and reselling them in the local market. Thanks to her enthusiasm and the advice of some friends, she was able to obtain an alfalfa field so that she could grow her own product. Her business has now grown in spite of the fact that in some respects the business does not offer the same profitability that it once did. Even so, Lourdes continues to work, as she has other goals that she wishes to attain for the good of her family. She would like to produce more alfalfa in order to increase sales. In order to begin her project she is asking for a $200 loan. Lets help her to continue her hard work without obstacles so that she may continue offering her best to her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes trabaja incesantemente para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus dos pequeños hijos que están aún en edad escolar.Siempre ha trabajado para forjarse un futuro sostenible y es por esa razón que desde muy joven se dedica al comercio y hace veinte años específicamente a la venta de forraje o alfalfa para los animales de granja como cuyes y conejos entre otros.Esta actividad la realiza en compañía de su esposo con una mentalidad de trabajo de equipo, en un principio lo hacía como intermediaria, porque compraba por lotes la alfalfa para luego venderlas en el mercado local.Gracias al ánimo y consejo de una de sus amigas decidió adquirir un terreno de sembrío de alfalfa para comercializar lo que ella produce, en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido a pesar de que existen oportunidades en que el comercio ya no tiene el mismo auge de antes, aún así Lourdes seguirá trabajando porque quiere lograr otras cosas más por el bien de su familia.Quiere producir más alfalfa para incrementar sus ventas y con el objetivo de poner en marcha su proyecto solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares.Ayudémosla para que pueda seguir realizando su labor sin dificultades y siga brindándole lo mejor a su querida familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of seed to increase production and sales

Compra de semillas para incrementar su producción y venta.

loans.name: Santos Dionicio

texts.es:
My name is Santos G. and I'm the owner of a grinder which we use to make dough for tortillas. We also grind coffee and cocoa, which are used for various drinks in my country. I'm requesting a loan to buy materials necessary to do mantainance on my shop. With the repairs I hope to increase the number of customers I have and increase my profits.

mi nombre es Santos G. y soy propietario de un molino en el cual fabrico la masa con la cual se elaboran tortillas, además muelo café y cacao con el cual preparan diferentes bebidas nacionales. Estoy solicitando el crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para realizar el mantenimiento a mi local, Con las reparaciones espero incrementar el número de clientes y elevar mis ingresos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY SPARE PARTS FOR A GRINDER

loans.name: Gloria Delia

texts.es:
Gloria is a working woman who engages in producing alfalfa for animal consumption for the families in her region who raise them. She tried to support her family through different activities because she could not find a stable job. Twelve years ago, Gloria and her husband decided to dedicate themselves to selling alfalfa. At the time, they made the decision to support their newly born daughter. Both have continued to work hard even till now, since their family and responsibilities have grown and their children are studying at a prestigious school in their community. Everyday, they work up very early to divide up the alfalfa for each home but before this, they amass and store the alfalfa in in large quantities to reduce the workload the following day. They long to increase their production; thus, they request a loan. Make a decision to support this family whose only means of support comes from selling forages. They want good futures for their children so they can contribute back to society one day.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es una mujer trabajadora que comercializa alfalfa para la alimentación a animales pequeños que mantienen en casa las familias de su localidad. Tras varios intentos de sostener a su familia con diversas actividades ante la carente posibilidad de encontrar un trabajo seguro. Gloria y su esposo decidieron hace doce años dedicarse a la venta de alfalfa en aquel entonces para sostener a su hija recién nacida fruto del gran amor que se tienen. Ambos continúan trabajando arduamente ya que ahora su familia y responsabilidades se han incrementado y se encuentran estudiando en un prestigioso centro educativo de su localidad. Todos los días se levantan muy temprano para repartir la alfalfa en cada una de las casas pero antes de ello la cosecharon en cantidad para almacenarla y aminorar el trabajo al día siguiente. Tienen el anhelo de incrementar su producción y por esa razón solicitan un préstamo. Decídete a apoyar a esta familia que tiene como único sostén la venta de forraje y quieren ver a sus hijos en el futuro convertidos en buenos hombres al servicio de la sociedad.

loans.use: Buy seeds for production

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a hardworking and responsible father who has been able to educate and care for his children. He is now able to proudly observe his children as they work in their various fields to take care of families of their own. He shares his joy with his lifelong companion and wife in their now empty nest filled with indelible memories. He has been able to accomplish all of this through the economic benefit that he has received in the last 25 years by getting up early every day to distribute fodder (animal feed) that he has harvested. Though lately his income has decreased as a result of competition from others, he is still able to support himself through this activity. Even so, because of his advanced age and the physical labor that the job requires, he would like to open a small store in his home. He plans to work incessantly to make this a reality. Juan is requesting a loan to grow and consolidate his small business so that he can save enough money to realize his dream of opening a store in his home. Let’s make the dreams of Juan and his wife reality.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Don Juan es una persona muy trabajadora y esforzada que como padre responsable ha cumplido satisfactoriamente con la obligación que tiene todo padre de familia, el de educar y sostener sus hijos.Y ahora puede observar muy contento y orgulloso el desenvolvimiento de cada uno de sus hijos que se desempeñan en diversas labores para procurarles bienestar a sus propias familias. Ahora comparte la dicha de este hecho y su nido vacío lleno de recuerdos imborrables con su compañera de toda la vida, su esposa.Para realizar todo lo que se propuso siempre contó con el apoyo financiero que obtenía de la venta de forraje ya que viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 25 años, levantándose cada día muy temprano para poder distribuir su cosecha.Actualmente aunque sus ingresos han disminuido por la competencia de vendedores que existe aún puede sostenerse con esta ocupación. Sin embargo por su avanzada edad y por el esfuerzo físico que requiere este trabajo piensa abrir una pequeña tienda en su casa y para conseguir este propósito seguirá trabajando incansablemente.Solicita un préstamo para acrecentar y consolidar su pequeño negocio con el objetivo de ahorra lo suficiente para aperturar su pequeño sueño en casa.Hagamos que los deseos de Don Juan y su esposa se hagan realidad.

loans.use:
Purchase of seeds to increase savings and open a small store in his home

Compra de semillas para incrementar sus ahorros y aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
"I used to work as a nurse at a prominent medical center, but my low salary required me to work at other jobs like dispatching legal documents and certificates and others. Unfortunately, due to an accident, I had to quit my job as a nurse without being able to wait for a second job as a paper dispatcher. "

Today, Justa Álvarez is a mother of 4, and her main job consists of making pastries. She learned the skills from her mother, who was a pastrymaking instructor at a culinary institute. Thus, Justa makes her baked goods and sells them as much as she can in the school where she works, and caters for parties, birthdays and other events as well. Justa needs capital to stock up on supplies to increase production, especially for the big festival of Todos Santos (All Saints) in November, in which it is traditional to eat various baked goods and pastries. With the loan, Justa will hopefully be able to profit from this event to set up her own bakery in the comforts of her own home and ensure her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

"Trabajaba como enfermera en un importante centro médico, pero el bajo nivel de su salario la obligó a dedicarse a otras actividades, como la de tramitadora de documentos, certificados y otros. Lastimosamente a causa de un accidente, tuve que dejar de trabajar como enfermera, sin poder atender su segundo oficio de tramitadora. "

Hoy en día Justa Álvarez, es madre de 4 hijos, y su actividad principal es la repostería, este es un oficio que ella aprendió de su madre, quien era maestra técnica en repostería y enseñaba en un instituto. Por tal motivo, Justa prepara sus productos y vende, tanto en el colegio donde trabaja, como también en la atención de contratos para fiestas, cumpleaños y otros. Justa precisa de capital, para poder abastecerse de insumos para incrementar su producción, principalmente para la gran demanda existente en la fiesta de Todos Santos en el mes de Noviembre, fecha en la que es una tradición el consumo de distintos productos de repostería. De esta manera Justa podrá lograr la ganancia esperada para establecer una tienda repostera en su propio domicilio, y así asegurar su bienestar familiar.

loans.use: Justa needs capital to stock up on supplies to increase production especially for the big event of Todos Santos in November, where it is traditional to consume various baked goods

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy M. sells plastic products, such as tubs, cups, and others, which she imports from the town of Desaguadero. She travels there at least two times per month. She sells all this merchandise in the city of Cochabamba, where she owns a small shop located n the Lanza Punata sector of the well-known La Cancha market. Daisy is a widow and the mother of three children, all of whom are school age. For this reason, she lacks the funds to be able to increase her merchandise and stock her shop in the city of Cochabamba, with the goal of preparing for selling at the end of the year. Due to the demand that exists during those dates, she can achieve an income that will allow her to address the costs of materials and her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Daisy M., es comerciante de productos plásticos como ser bañadores, pocillos, tazas, y otros, que importa de la localidad de Desaguadero, lugar al que viaja al menos dos veces al mes. Toda esta mercadería, la vende en la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde es dueña de un puesto de venta ubicado en el sector Lanza Punata, del conocido y popular mercado La Cancha, Daisy es viuda, y madre de 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar, por tal motivo, ella precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería y abastecer su puesto en la ciudad de Cochabamba, con el fin de preparar la venta de fin de año, que por la demanda existente en esas fechas, puede lograr un ingreso que le permita hacer frente a los gastos de materiales y estudio de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock her small store, ahead of the holiday season

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida M., the mother of two children and a widow, belongs to the loan group Joyitas de Oro in Villa Tejada. She is an expert at knitting woolen articles, such as caps, shawls, and others. She has been doing this since she was 15 years old, learning the tradition from her parents and continuing the tradition. Frida takes her products to the city of Cochabamba, where she has a sure market. She also sells them on them on Garcilazo de la Vega Street in the city of La Paz, which is traditionally a commercial street, and also in the 16 de Julio Market. Since she works alone, Frida produces and sells at wholesale, at a minimum of a dozen. Frida lacks the money to increase her production, satisfy existing demand, and increase the variety of her products. She would like to do this to sell at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Frida M., madre de 2 hijos, viuda, pertenece a la asociación Joyitas de Oro en Villa Tejada, es experta en la confección de distintos tejidos en lana, como ser gorros, mantillas, chalinas y otros. Esta es una actividad que ella desarrolla desde sus 15 años de edad, aprendiendo de sus padres y continuando con la tradición. Frida lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde tiene ya un mercado asegurado, así también ofrece sus productos en la calle Garcilazu de la Vega de la ciudad de La Paz, una calle tradicionalmente comercial, y en la ciudad de El Alto vende sus productos en la famosa Feria 16 de Julio. Pese a que trabaja sola, Frida produce y vende al por mayor, minimamente por docena. Por tal motivo, Frida precisa de dinero para aumentar su producción y satisfacer la demanda existente, como también la necesidad de incrementar la variedad de sus productos, principalmente para la venta de fin de año.

loans.use: To increase production, satisfy existing demand, and increase the variety of products

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia M. Yujra is a single mother of two, and she does different jobs. Her main activity is making cloth handicrafts: tapestry, skirts and others. She has done this job since she was 14. At that age Eugenia had her fist baby, she then needed to develop some workmanship to support herself and her child. Eugenia has a second job selling seeds, roasted peanuts and beans, popcorn and sweet noodles. She brings these from Copacabana to sale them in town festivals and folk events were people consume them in large amounts. Now Eugenia needs some money to carry on with her handicrafts making business, because this represents a steady income. Selling seeds is only an occasional job and she needs to support her kids.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenia M. Yujra, soltera pero madre de dos hijos, tiene muchas actividades, entre las cuales y más importantes podemos mencionar la confección de artesanías en tela, como ser mantas, polleras y otros, oficio al que se dedica desde sus 14 años, edad en la que tuvo su primer hijo, que la obligó a desarrollar alguna destreza para salir adelante. Su segunda actividad principal, es la venta de leguminosas, maní tostado, porotos tostados, pasankallas, y fideo dulce, productos que compra de la localidad de Copacabana y vende en las fiestas de pueblo, entradas folklóricas y otros, donde el consumo de estos es masivo y en grandes cantidades. Actualmente Eugenia precisa de capital para poder continuar con su negocio de confección, que a diferencia de su segunda actividad no genera tantos ingresos, pero es el más constante, puesto que la venta de los productos que trae de Copacabana solo se vende de forma eventual y ella precisa generar ingresos para la subsistencia de sus hijos.

loans.use: Eugenia needs this money to carry on with her making of cloth handicraft for a steady income.

loans.name: Elba Francisco

texts.en: Elba says she is a woman who has always struggled for existence and for a better life.   She is 45 years old and has three children.  Her husband is a farmer.  Ten years ago, Elba started a small business, but she had to leave it for a while because of illness.  She used to sell shoes, shirts and pants.  Right now, she is selling ice and alcoholic drinks in her house, but she wants to restart her first business.  She needs a loan which will allow her buy clothing in bulk and shoes in order to start her sales activity.  Restarting the sales activity will help her diversify her sources of income and earn more for the sake of her family.

loans.use: buy bulk clothing so as to restart her first business; she used to sell shoes, shirts and pants

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kartini

texts.id:
Every 6 months, Ni Ketut Kartini profits from sales of her raised pigs. With 1 mother pig, Ni Ketut Kartini received profit of Rp1,500,000 (about US$165) results of 1 mother pig and 10 piglets. All owned piglets are resold, although still very small. This was done because those piglets were already ordered by Ni Ketut Kartini's customer. The expected loan would be used to buy a 2 month old piglet, for future mother pig 2 pieces. Profit would be used to pay daily expenses, and 2 school aged children. Besides raising pigs, Ni Ketut Kartini helps he husband Ketut Budiana to work on the fields, inherited from his parents. Ni Ketut Kartini is enthusiastic in doing this business, because Ketut is convinced that her persistent and hard work could expand her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap enam bulan Ni Ketut Kartini menerima keuntungan dari hasil penjualan babi peliharaannya. Dengan memelihara 1 induk babi, Ketut Kartini menerima keuntungan sebesar Rp.1.500.000,- hasil dari 1 induk dan 10 ekor anak babi. Semua anak babi yang dimiliki dijual kembali, walaupun anak babi ini masih sangat kecil. Hal ini dilakukan karena anak babi itu sudah dipesan oleh pembeli yang menjadi langganan dari Ni Ketut Kartini. Rencana pinjaman yang akan datang akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi yang berumur 2 bulan untuk calon penginduk sebanyak 2 ekor. Keuntungan yang didapat digunakan untuk kebutuhan sehari dengan menanggung 2 orang anak yang masih sekolah. Selain memelihara babi, Ni Ketut Kartini mambantu suaminya, Ketut Budiana, mengolah kebun yang diwarisi oleh orang tuanya.. Ketut Kartini sangat semangat dalam menjalani semua pekerjaannya. Karena Ketut yakin dengan ketekunan dan rajin bekerja akan bisa berkembang dalam usahanya.

loans.use:
To buy 2 piglets and 2 future mother pigs

Membeli bibit babi 2 ekor dan calon induk 2 ekor

loans.name: Ni Wayan Subeg

texts.id:
Although economic condition is difficult, however will power are still high. Together with her husband I Nengah Rabig, they agree to have an extra income by raising pigs. Although their day to day routine work as tenant farmer, income from farming could not cover daily expenses, since they have one child as their responsibility. Making a simple stall behind the home, Ni Wayan Subeg is raising 1 mother pig, and 2 fattening piglets. With persistent they raise and feed their pigs. Every morning, afternoon and evening they take turn to feed them. Profit within 6 months are about Rp1,800,000 (about US$200). Ni Wayan Subeg already have customers who buys their pigs. Ni Wayan Subeg likes to add another 1 mother pig. For future loan, Ni Wayan Subeg hopes to expand the business and to save for their children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun keadaan perekonomian yang sedang sulit tetapi semangat untuk berusaha tetap tinggi. Bersama suaminya, I Nengah Rabig, mereka sepakat mencari tambahan lain dengan cara memlihara babi. Meskipun mereka sudah memiliki pekerjaan rutin sebagai petani, hasil dari bertani ini tidak mencukupi untuk biaya sehari-hari karena ada 1 orang anak yang menjadi tanggungannya. Dengan membuat kandang yang sederhana dibelakang rumahnya, Ni Wayan Subeg memelihara 1 induk babi dan 2 bibit penggemukan. Dengan tekun mereka memelihara dan memberi makan babi peliharaannya. Setiap pagi, siang dan sore, mereka kadang bergantian memberi makan. Keuntungan yang diterima dalam enam bulan sebesar Rp.1.800.000,-. Ni Wayan Subeg sudah memiliki langganan yang akan membeli babinya. Ni Wayan Subeg berkeinginan menambah induk babi lagi 1 ekor. Untuk pinjaman selanjutnya, Ni Wayan Subeg berharap usaha ini akan berkembang dan bisa menabung untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig, so that animal population could increase

Membeli induk babi sehingga populasi ternaknya akan bertambah

loans.name: Ni Nengah Nerti

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Nerti at this time lives with her husband and 2 high school aged children. Ni Nengah Nerti is in the red sugar making business. She is already in this business for several years, since Ni Nengah Nerti saw that her income as a common tenant farmer who only work on the fields the traditional way, would not be enough to meet ever increasing family needs. With a capital of Rp700,000 (about US$77), Ni Nengah Nerti with the help of her husband started to make red sugar from 15 coconut trees in their field. Every day Ni Nengah Nerti could produce 15 kg of red sugar, that she sold for Rp60,000 (about $6.60), sugar price per kg is Rp4000 (about 44cents), and within a month Ni Nengah Nerti could have an income of Rp1,100,000 (about $121) from this business. From this income, Ni Nengah Nerti could meet her household needs, including education of her 2 children, and repair her simple home. Ni Nengah Nerti also sees an opportunity to expand her business, by being a red sugar distributor, buying sugar from others, and resell it to a large vendor. However because of capital limitations, Ni Nengah Nerti could not expand it freely. However with Dinari's laon, Ni Nengah Nerti hopes her business could expand again, and income would also increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Nerti saat ini tinggal bersama suami dan 2 orang anaknya yang masih SMA. Ni Nengah Nerti menjalankan usaha sebagai pembuat gula merah. Usaha ini sudah digelutinya sudah beberapa tahun lamanya karena Ni Nengah Nerti melihat bahwa pendapatannya sebagai petani biasa yang hanya mengelola lahan kebunnya dengan cara tradisional tidak mampu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya yang sudah semakin meningkat. Dengan modal Rp. 700.000,- Ni Nengah Nerti dibantu suaminya memulai usaha pembuatan gula merah dengan memanfaatkan 15 pohon kelapa yang ada di kebunnya. Setiap hari Ni Nengah Nerti mampu memproduksi 15 kg gula merah dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 60.000,- ( harga gula per kilogram = Rp. 4.000.- ) dan dalam sebulan Ni Nengah Nerti mendapat hasil dari usahanya Rp. 1.100.000,-. Dari pendapatannya inilah Ni Nengah Nerti memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya termasuk menyekolahkan ke dua anaknya dan memperbaiki keadaan rumahnya yang masih sangat sederhana. Ni Nengah Nerti juga melihat peluang untuk mengembangkan usahanya dengan menjadi pengepul gula merah yaitu dengan membeli gula dari orang lain dan kemudian dijual lagi kepada pengusaha besar tapi karena keterbatasan modal yang dimiliki Ni Nengah Nerti tidak bisa leluasa mengembangkannya. Tetapi dengan adanya pinjaman dari DINARI Nengah Nerti berharap usahanya bisa berkembang lagi dan hasilannyapun bisa bertambah.

loans.use:
To buy red sugar from other makers, so that it could be sold at higher price to large vendor

Membeli gula merah dari pembuat gula merah lainnya sehingga bisa dijual kembali dengan harga yang lebih tinggi kepada pedagang besar

loans.name: Santa Santos

texts.en:
Santa runs a small beauty salon which she started five years ago. Her joviality, the special treatment she gives to the customers, and her professionalism are some of the characteristics that have helped her establish a very large clientele. She operates the business six days a week, offering services such as hair straightening, hairdo, and other beauty treatments. She also sells beauty products such as shampoo, rinse, hair treatment, skin care products, and so forth.

Santa has requested a loan with which she will purchase more products in order to better attend to her customers. She also is thinking about buying a new showcase to put the products in. With her beauty salon very well supplied (given the loan),and continuing to provide good services to her customers, this 36-year-old woman will be better able to support her three children.

loans.use: buy products to supply her beauty salon and a showcase for the new products

loans.name: Ni Ketut Parti

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Parti is in the business of buying and selling cocoa products for 7 years in her simple home. She is in this business, because daily living needs have increased, and also Ni Ketut Parti saw a great opportunity in this business, since before the people around her sold their cocoa products to an out of town business person who came to their village. However after Ni Ketut Parti started the business, people around her sold the cocoa products to her. Although initial capital was not big, that is Rp600,000 (about US$66), but because of her persistent, Ni Ketut Parti could have a profit of Rp100,000 (about $11) for 3 days. This gave her initiative to run the business, however because of capital limitations, the business could not expand as fast, while her 2 children already need high expenses for their education, and almost all of her work were used to pay for their education expenses. Her self confidence increased after Dinari gave business capital, that would be used to increase sales capital, so that results would increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Parti sudah menjalani usaha jual beli hasil produksi cokelat ( kakao ) selama 7 tahun di rumahnya yang sederhana. Usaha ini digelutinya karena kebutuhan hidup yang semakin meningkat dan juga karena Ni Ketut Parti melihat adanya peluang yang besar dalam usaha ini karena sebelumnya masyarakat di sekitarnya biasanya menjual produk cokelatnya kepada pedagang dari luar yang datang ke desa mereka. Namun setelah Ni Ketut Parti memulai usahanya, masyarakat di sekitarnya mulai menjual produk cokelat mereka kepadanya. Walaupun modal awal usahanya tidak besar yaitu hanya Rp. 600.000,- namun karena keuletannya Ni Ketut Parti bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 100.000,- dari usahanya ini dalam waktu 3 hari. Hal ini membuatnya semakin bersemangat menjalankan usahanya, namun karena keterbatasan modal, usahanya tidak bisa berkembang dengan cepat, sedangkan 2 orang anaknya sudah mulai membutuhkan biaya yang besar untuk pendidikan mereka dan hampir semua hasil dari usahanya dipakai untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya. Kepercayaan dirinya semakin bertambah setelah DINARI memberinya pinjaman modal usaha yang selanjutnya akan dipakainya untuk menambah modal penjualan sehingga hasilnya juga semakin bertambah.

loans.use:
To add business capital to buy more cocoa from farmers

Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli lebih banyak kakao dari petani

loans.name: At

texts.en: Mrs. At  P., age 55, works with her husband growing rice crops in their rice paddy, earning together about $5 per day. They have six children: three who are working in undisclosed jobs, two who are students, and one who is married and lives separately. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to repair her house after the rainy season and reinforce the walls. In the background of the photo is part of a wall that she has started to reinforce.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Chao

texts.en: Mrs. Chao P., age 38, works with her husband selling vegetable at a busy market, earning around $9 each day in revenue. They have three children: two who are students and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a stand at the market so they do not have to spend a great portion of their income each month to rent a stall. This will increase their income and help them finance their children’s education. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a stall in the market to sell vegetables so they no longer have to rent.

loans.name: Chao

texts.en: Mrs. Chao P., age 38, works with her husband selling vegetables  at a busy market, earning around $9 each day in revenue. They have three children: two who are students and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a stand at the market so they do not have to spend a great portion of their income each month to rent a stall. This will increase their income and help them finance their children’s education. Her husband is pictured in the photos as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a stall in the market to sell vegetables so they no longer have to rent.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Mrs. Huy I., age 21, is a housewife. Her husband sells sand and stone for construction, earning about $10 per day in revenue. They have one child, who is very young. In order to expand her husband's business and increase the volume of materials sold, she would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a truck to transport the construction materials. This will allow hI. to fulfill larger orders and increase sales volume. They plan to use the additional income to reinvest in his business and save money for their child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a truck to deliver construction materials.

loans.name: Nyoman Gabris

texts.id:
Nyoman Gabris, although living with her child and in law, does not want to depend on them. Her husband passed away in 1995. She started this vegetable sales business with her husband. She continues to do this business. This shows her will of not depending on their 2 married children, although she is 52 years old. Every day she prepared the vegetables that she brought to the Baturiti traditional market. Every week she could earn about Rp200,000.00 (US$22). Per day she spent about Rp20,000.00 (about $2.20), and she could save some. The loan helps her to offer more vegetables. With a loan on hand she could tactically prospects her vegetable sales, since in the market she is not the only one who sells vegetables.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Nyoman Gabris walaupun tinggal bersama anak dan menantunya, tidak ingin menggantungkan kehidupannya kepada mereka. Suaminya meninggal pada tahun 1995 yang lalu. Usaha jual sayur ini ditekuninya bersama suaminya. Sampai sekarang dia masih meneruskan usaha ini. Hal ini menunjukkan semangatnya yang tidak ingin bergantung kepada kedua anaknya yang sudah menikah walaupun sudah berumur 52 tahun. Setiap harinya dia menyiapkan sayuran yang dibawanya ke pasar tradisional Baturiti. Setiap minggu penghasilan yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 200.000,00. Dengan biaya hidup per harinya yang Rp 20.000,00, dia masih bisa menyisihkan sebagian untuk ditabung. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh membantunya untuk menyediakan lebih banyak sayuran untuk dijual. Dengan modal yang ada di tangan dia berusaha mensiasati prospek penjualan sayurnya, karena di pasar bukan hanya dia yang menjual sayur.

loans.use:
To buy vegetables for resell

Membeli sayuran yang akan dijual.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en: Mrs. Chy H., age 50, works with her husband on their farmland to grow and sell rice, crops, beans, and vegetables, earning about $2 each day. They have seven children: some who are farmers and some who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase rice, seeds, beans, and fertilizer to expand their crops yields and therefore increase their revenue. They plan to use the resulting income to reinvest in their farm and help finance their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase rice, seeds, beans, and fertilizer

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Mrs. Soam S., age 44, is a farmer earning less than $1 per day. Her husband is both a motor-taxi driver and a farmer, earning about $3 per day. They do not have children. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer to improve their crop yield and increase their revenue. Her husband is pictured in the photo, as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yous

texts.en: Mrs. Yous C., age 70, sells snacks, biscuits, and candy to people in her area, earning about $1 per day in income. Her husband works selling lottery tickets, earning about $2 per day. They have one child who works in a garment factory, making about $2 per day. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs to raise on their plot of land to generate another source of income. Her daughter is pictured in the photograph.

loans.use: To purcase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Mrs. Kol T., age 25, works with her husband, age 30, selling dessert in Phnom Penh City, where a number of people pass by, earning up to $35/day in revenue. They have two children: one who is a student and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a stand to sell the dessert in instead of paying rent  every month. This will lower their expenses in the long term, increase their margins, and raise income for the family. They plan to use the additional income to educate their children and raise their standard of living. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a market stall in order to stop renting

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Mrs. Phen T., age 48, is a housewife. Her husband works as a farmer earning about $1 per day. They have five children: one who is a garment factory worker earning about $50 per month, one who is a student, and three who are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to repair her house after the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair her home.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo E., age 48, is a widow who works selling vegetables and grocery products from her home, earning up to $25 per day in revenue. She has two children: one who is a vendor at the market and one who is employed in a private company and earns $50 per month. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to expand her inventory by adding a greater variety of products to meet her growing customer demand. She predicts that this will increase her revenue, leading to a higher income to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of grocery products.

loans.name: Hudoyberdi

texts.ru:
Hudoyberdi D., 53, married and has 4 children. He lives in the village Khaety-Nav in the Yavanskiy region. Hudoyberdi has been farming animals for 20 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 heads of cattle and the food feed them. Hudoyberdi will then use the extra profit to buy animal food, pay off the loan, and sustain his family. Hudoyberdi plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Жампулатов Худойберди, возраст – 53 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент живет в Яванском районе, в кишлаке Хаети Нав. Худойберди занимается животноводством в течение 20 лет. На полученный кредит клиент хочет приобрести 3 головы крупного-рогатого скота и корма для его содержания. Клиент будет продавать купленный скот каждые 40-45 дней после его откормки. На вырученные деньги клиент будет приобретать новый скот, а полученную прибыль будет использовать для погашения кредита и содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase 3 animals and food to feed them

loans.name: Orizamoh

texts.ru:
Orizamoh B. is 39 years old and has a secondary technical education, by profession she is an accountant. Orizamoh is married and has 6 children. She has a sales stall in the central market of Yavan called “Mehrgon.” She has been working in this field for 7 years. The client plans to use the loan to purchase a new selection of goods for sale, specifically autumn clothing for children. This loan will give the residents of her region the opportunity to purchase necessary children’s clothing at reasonable prices without them having to leave their city and thereby saving them money and time.

Orizamoh plans to pay back the $600 loan o during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобохонова Оризмох, возраст – 39 лет, образование среднее техническое, по специальности бухгалтер, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Оризмох имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке в городе Яване под названием «Мехргон» Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 7 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирутет приобрести новый ассортимент продаваемого товара, а именно закуп осеннего товара детской одежды. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям данного района приобретать необходимые детские вещи по умеренным ценам не выезжая за пределы своего города, экономя свои денежные средства и время. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase autumn children's clothing

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean S., age 51, works selling clothes at a market, earning around $5 each day. Her husband is retired and too old to work. They have nine children: two who work at a restaurant, four who are students, and three who are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase more fashionable clothes to meet her clients’ demands. She believes a greater variety of clothing will attract additional clients and increase revenue.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothing to meet clients' demands.

loans.name: Kurbonoy

texts.ru:
Kurbonoy H. is 37 years old, has a secondary education and 4 children. She sells clothing and fabrics for making women’s clothing. She rents a sales stall in the central market of Yavan, called “Mehrgon.” She has been working in this business for 5 years.

Kurbonoy plans to use her loan to purchase new inventory – seasonal autumn items and to pay back the loan over a 12 month period. The loan will assist local residents in purchasing necessary autumn clothing as the closest clothing market is in Dushanbe, 80KM away from Yavan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Халимова Курбоной, возраст – 37 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Занимается торговлей одеждой и материала для пошива женской одежды. Для этого она арендует торговую точку на центарльном рынке города Явана под названием «Мехргон». Этим бизнесом она занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит Курбоной планирует приобрести новый ассортимент продаваемого товара – сезонный осенний товар. Данный кредит поможет жителям данного района приобрести необходимую осенную одежду, так как ближайщий рынок по продаже одежды находится в городе Душанбе, на расстояние 80 км от города Явана. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increasing Inventory

loans.name: Shahrinisso

texts.ru:
Shahrinisso S. is 27 years old, has a higher education, is a linguist by profession and is not married. Her primary place of work is High School #2 in the Yavan region where she works as a teacher.

Shahrinisso plans to use her loan to purchase 2 bulls and feed for their support. She plans on selling them every 40-45 days. She will use her revenues to purchase new bulls which she will feed and then sell. She uses the profits from the bulls as supplementary income as her salary is not enough to support a family. Shahrinisso’s earnings are the main source of income for her family. She plans on paying back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Шахриниссо, возраст – 27 лет, образование высшее, по специальности филолог, не замужем. Основным местом работы клиента является средняя школа №2 Яванского района, где она работает учителем. На полученный кредит планирует 2 голов крупного рогатого скота и корма для их содержания. Она будет продавать их через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги она будет приобретать молодняк, который будет откармливать и опять продавать. От продажи бычков она получает дополнительный доход, так как получаемая заработная плата не хватает на содержание семьи. Основным источником дохода в семье является доход получаеиый Шахриниссо в качестве зарабтной платы, а также доход получаемый от откормки и продажи бычков. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 bulls and feed

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass owns a clothing and flower shop. This 44 years old father always wears a smile on his face. It must be one of the many reasons why neighboring clients visit his store so often.  He needs to purchase a new inventory of clothes as the winter season comes around. He lives in the surroundings of Nabatieh, which is south of Lebanon, with his family. Abbass has a solid honest history with Al Majmoua and has always been striving to enhance his business. The uncommon idea of joining clothing and flowers proves his determination for a winning formula.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his clothing and flower shop

loans.name: Gulchar

texts.en: G. Gulchar is a 42-year-old married has two children. She is a farmer from Gubadli region and right now lives with her family in Sumgayit, situated in the East of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 1997, when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. In 2005 Gulchar borrowed $500 to add to her own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and Gulchar applied for a loan of $600 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production and expanded her business. She now earns considerably more income. Gulchar would now like to receive $800 loan in order to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them. She will repay the loan within 16 months. She eventually hopes to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves for meat production and business expansion

loans.name: Elnare

texts.en: M. Elnare is an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Gubadli Region in the Azerbaijan - Armenian conflict territory, situated in the West of Azerbaijan. She settled with her family in Sumgait city. She is 29 years old, married with 1 child. Elnare is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she now rents a shop. The second time she borrowed $800 and built the grocery store, expanded the area of shop and increased the food assortments. She paid the loans back on time. Now, she needs $1000 to expand her business by opening a vegetable section and buying digital scales. She eventually hopes to expand her business even further.

loans.use: to expand her business, open vegetable section and to buy digital scales

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 22208

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali F. is a 23 year old man living in the outskirts of the city of Nabatieh in the South of Lebanon. Ali sells perfumes and various items. He is planning to buy a van so as to be able to distribute his products and make more sales. Ali has an entrepreneur's mind. He wants to maximize his options and to have a sustainable and successful business. This transport vehicle will increase his geographical outreach and therefore his revenues which will help him invest even more in his project. He believes that his early twenties is the best time for him to be productive and take initiatives, and so is taking this venture upon him while he is well suited for it and full of energy.

loans.use: Buy a van for his products distribution

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suandi

texts.id:
Nyoman Suardana, husband of Ni Ketut Suandi, is very supportive of her pig farming business. Especially after working with Dinari Foundation, and assistance in animal business was done by a veterinarian. Since she already have a mother pig and 6 piglets, loan would be used to buy wheat shell clippings for several months pig's feed, and repairs of the stalls. Cleaning the stall and feeding are done 2X/day, with objectives that mother pig and her 6 piglets are always healthy. Like always the case, Ni Ketut Suandi sells her 6 piglets for barbecue piglets at the age of 3 months. Feed expenses could reach Rp300,000 (about US$33). Total sales over 3 months could reach Rp1,000,000 (about $110), with a nett profit of Rp700,000 (about $77). This profit is useful to pay for family daily expense, and a teenage child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Nyoman Suardana, suami dari Ni Ketut Suandi, sangat mendukung usaha ternak babi yang ditekuninya. Apalagi setelah bergabung dengan Yayasan DINARI dan mendapat pembinaan - pembinaan mengenai usaha ternaknya yang dilakukan oleh Dokter hewan. Karena sudah mempunyai Induk babi dan anaknya 6 ekor, dana bantuan dipergunakan untuk membeli dedak gandum untuk persediaan pakan babinya beberapa bulan dan untuk perbaikan kandangnya . Pembersihan kandang dan pemberian pakan dilakukan sehari dua kali dengan tujuan induk dan ke enam bibitnya selalu sehat. Seperti biasa Ni Ketut Suandi menjual ke enam bibit babinya untuk babi guling yaitu pada umur tiga bulan. Pengeluaran untuk biaya pakan mencapai Rp. 300.000,-. Total penjualan yang didapat selama tiga bulan mencapai Rp.1.000.000,- dengan kuntungan bersih Rp.700.000,-.Keuntungan ini sangat bermanfaat untuk mencukupi keperluan hidup sehari-hari dalam keluarganya dan seorang anaknya yang masih balita.

loans.use:
To buy pig's feed and repair stall

Membeli pakan ternak dan memperbaiki kandang

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima lives in the Bekaa with her husband and 4 children. There is nothing Fatima cannot do. She is a mother, a wife, a tailor and a business woman. She contacted Al Majmoua because she needs a loan to buy material for her tailoring work.  Fatima doesn't limit herself to this business. She also sells various items like soft drinks, juices etc. Maybe Fatima doesn't realize it yet, but she is a great example illustrating women's active participation in the social and economic lives of their communities.

loans.use: To buy material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a car mechanic living in the Bekaa with his wife and their 3 children.  Mohamad works in a workshop where he fixes vehicles.  He needs to buy auto parts to replace the defective ones he finds in his clients' cars.  Being an honest and skilled mechanic, the car owner knows he will be picking up his vehicle as if it were brand new. Mohamad is very pleased that his hard work and honesty are being appreciated.

loans.use: To buy the necessary auto parts for his car mechanic workshop

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: H. Vagif is 54 years old. He is a refugee from the Gubadi region, which is in the Azerbaijan - Armenia conflict territory in the West of Azerbaijan. He is a farmer who started his business in 1992, when he purchased 5 sheep with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. In 2005 Vagif borrowed $500 to add to his own savings of $3000 and purchased another six sheep. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and Vagif has applied for a loan of $600 from Normicro to purchase five sheep for meat production and expanded his business, increasing his income considerably. Vagif would like to receive $800 loan in order to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 16 months. In the future he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them

loans.name: Cahangir

texts.en: C. Cahangir was born in the Gubadli region, situated in the West of Azarbaijan. He is 54 years old and the father of five children. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east of Azerbaijan. He is homeless and staying in a worker’s hostel in Sumgayit city. Cahangir opened his business 1998. He started selling a variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet family’s food and important consumption needs. In 2004 Cahangir borrowed $300 from Normicro, expanded his business and bought necessary fruits. Next time he borrowed $600 and increased his business. Now, he wants to borrow an $800 loan to open a larger vegetable section of his business and he hopes to further improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to open a large vegetable section of his counter and to improve the living conditions of his family

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim A. is a 52-year-old man who owns his animal breeding business in the small southern, Azerbaijani region of Bilasuvar.  Rahim is an internally displaced person who fled from the Jabrail region to Bilasuvar during the  Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He has thirteen years of experience in animal breeding. He raises livestock and sells it for meat production to the local and Baku (capital f Azerbaijan) bazaar traders. Rahim is married and has three sons. They are high school students. 
Veal is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat meat at homes and cafes. Most of traditional Azeri meals contain meat. As the result, there is much competition in this business. Rahim has worked very hard to expand his business, however covering basic family needs getting harder and harder . Currently Rahim uses his old truck to bring fodder to the local people for selling. Rahim is going to expand his business and for this purpose he has applied for a 1000 USD loan.

loans.use: Going to expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Mrs. Anna I. is 45 years old, married with six children, and lives in Benin City. She learned her business from her mother and started her own in 2001. She is looking for a loan of $400 to enable her buy more food supplies. She is an LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, especially rice and beans

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine I. is 56 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She sells bush meat to people living in her community. She learned this business from her sister, and started her own business in 1979. Mrs. I. has been in LAPO for 3 years now. She would like a loan of $400 to enable her to increase her supply of meat.

loans.use: To buy more bush meat for sale

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero A. is a 52 -year-old widow with eight children, and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs at a local market. She learned her business from her sister as a child and started hers in 2003. She is an LAPO member and would like a loan of $400 to increase her store's inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Blessed Restaurant is owned and operated by Mrs. Helen A.. Helen apprenticed in operating a restaurant for 3 months and opened hers in 1988. She is 50 years old, married with five children, and lives in Benin City , Nigeria. Helen is an LAPO client and would like a loan of $400 to buy more foodstuffs for the preparation of local dishes. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia Eziekel is 45 years old. She plats and weaves hair in her salon. She studied this business for 6 months and opened her store in 1977 after she was married to Mr. Eziekel. They have five children and live in Benin City. Mrs. E. . would like a loan of $400 loan to buy more weavon and hair cream for resale. She has been an LAPO member for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more Weavon for plating hair

loans.name: James

texts.en: Mr. James A. is 39 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City. He sells home provisions and different types of soap to people in his community at the market. James would like a loan of $400 to buy more inventory. He apprenticed in this business for a year and started his own in 2005. He is an LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and soap for resale at the market

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam H. is a 38-year-old businessman who owns a car-wash in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Sabirabad region. Islam is married and has three children. He has eight years of experience. He opened his car-wash on the money he borrowed from his friends. He does  very good work and during these years he attracted many clients among local people.  Sometimes he has more than 20 cars for washing, but he is not able to wash all of them  because he is only one employee. As the result he loses the opportunity to earn money. From the money he did earn he purchased a modern car-washer.  For the last two years living in the region is  getting harder and covering three growing up children's needs is impossible. Islam has found a way of solving his problem and improving the conditions of his life. He is going to expand his car-wash business and purchase one more car-washer and hire an assistant. The estimated cost for new car-washer is approximately 700-800 AZN.

loans.use: Going to purchase new car-washer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Giang

texts.en: Giang's family has seven members. The parents are farmers who plant rice and raise two cows, the two older daughters work as day labourers and the other children are in school. The average income is $12 per month/person. Giang is requesting a loan for $75 to aid her pig-raising business, which will increase her income and aid in the family support. The loan will be repaid in five months.

loans.use: To help pig-raising business

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc's husband left home, and her business is selling rice and spaghetti. Her two sons work as day labourers, and her youngest child is in the 6th class. Their average income is $12,5 per month/person. Cuc is requesting a loan of $50 to raise ducks which will provide school fees for her son. The loan will be repaid in four months.

loans.use: To buy and raise ducks

loans.name: Abdulghafar

texts.en:
Abdulghafar lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two sons and lives with his own family. He has a shoe shop and he was in this business for more than 6 years in Pakistan. When he returned two years ago to Afghanistan he started this business in Kabul.

Now he wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new kinds of shoes to enlarge the stock in his shop and attract more clients so that he can make a good income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of shoes

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam's parents died over ten years ago. Her grandmother (68-years-old) supported this family of four children. Three of them now work as day labourers, and the youngest is in the 9th class. Their average income is $14 per month/person. Nam is requesting a loan of $75 to raise pigs, which will increase her family's income. The loan will be repaid in five months.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue and her husband have planted 200 pillards of green dragon, but the plants are still too young to realize a profit from them. Hue, her husband, and one of children support  the family by work as day laborers.Their other children are in the 12th, 5th and 2nd class.Their average income is $13 per month/person. Hue is requesting a loan of $75 to invest to their green dragon planting and will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: Tham's family moved here from North ViệtNam. Tham and her husband work as day labourers and also plant 100 pillards of green dragon. Their two children are in school (10th and 8th class), and the youngest daughter (11years old) is deaf-and-dumb and stays home. Their average income is $9 per month/person. TTham is requesting a loan of  $75 to invest their green dragon planting. The loan will be repaid during six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang and her husband have two children. The parents plant the green dragon and other cultivated crops, and sometimes work as day labourers . Their children. ages 8 and 5, are in school. Their average income is $14 per month/person. Trang is requesting a loan of $75 to invest their green dragon planting which will increase her family's income. The loan will be repaid during six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en: Kieu and her husband plant 200 pillards of green dragon and work as day labourers to take care their two sons who are ages seven and two. Their average income is $9 per month/person. Kieu is requesting a loan of $75 to invest their green dragon planting and to develop their income. The loan will be repaid during six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: I am Yasmeen A. from Lahore,a big metropolis in Pakistan. I live in a semi-constructed house with my husband and five children. My husband buys second hand i.e. used clothes and supplies them to various cities where it is transformed into a variety of articles such as bags, jackets etc. All of my children completed their studies to the primary grade and then they had to quit their studies because we had no money to pay for their school dues. My youngest daughter is very enthusiastic to study. In view of her passion for studies, I started a part time job  in a local clinic as a helper. I am now able to earn $40 a month. This income has enabled me to send my daughter to school and help provide with the daily household expenses. To better keep up with the needs of our family, we have planned to expand our used clothing business, for which I request a loan .

loans.use: Expand second hand clothes business

loans.name: Mirsaddin

texts.en:
Mirsaddin S. is a 43-year old trader who sells fruits and vegetables in the local bazaar. Mirsaddin lives with his wife and four children in Imishili in the southern region of Azerbaijan, .  He started his business in 2002. Mirsaddin has a diverse assortment of vegetables he sells. It is potatoes, onion, tomatoes, peppers and etc.. He and her wife are unemployed and selling vegetables is the only source of income in his family. It very hard to cover financial needs in family of 5 members and Mirsaddin decided to expand his area of business and diversify products he sells to add fruits like apples and pears . For this purpose he has applied for a 1200 USD.
loan.

loans.use: Going to diversify the number of products

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang's husband died three years ago, and she works as a day labourer to earn money to care for her children. Her two oldest daughters (15 and 12 years old) are in the 10th and 7th class, and her youngest is too young for school. Their average income is $8.5 per month/person. Hang is requesting a loan of $75 to raise chickens to improve her income pay for her childrens' schooling. She will repay the loan during four months.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau's family has five members. The parents and their two oldest children work as day labourers. Sau has kidney problems and often needs medicine. Their youngest daughter is in the 8th class. Their average income is $12.50 per month/person. Sau is requesting a loan of $75 to raise chickens and increase the family's income. The loan will be repaid during four months.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: I am Samina K.. I am the mother of four children all of whom study. My husband is a lawyer and currently he operates from one of his friend’s office. My husband is able to get a suitable number of cases and he now feels a need forhis own office. However, he does not have the required start up finances to set up his own office. We therefore require a loan  that we will add to our savings and will arrange for an office.

loans.use: Get an office to rent

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: My name is Zubaida A. and I was born in Faisalabad, a mid sized industrial city. However, I had to move to Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan, after my marriage. I have seven children, four sons and three daughters. I am a textile designer and I embroider clothes. My husband buys used and old furniture, machine spare parts etc from various factories and car workshops. He then sells these used items to different shops in the city. Earlier we took loans for this business, which yielded us better profits and we were able to repay the loan and marry two of our daughters. Now we again require a loan  which we will use to buy a large quantity of used items for the business. Buying in bulk is relatively cheaper and we will be able to secure higher profits.

loans.use: Buy used spare parts and tools in bulk

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
I am Sabina B. and the mother of four children. Two of my children are enrolled in school whereas the other two are too young to attend school. My husband runs a grocery store. A couple of years ago we took loans and increased the range of items in the store, which in return improved our income. With this raise in earnings, we were able to enroll our children to school and put three meals a day on our table.   
Now we we request a loan to purchase a variety of cosmetics for our store. I am sure this added segment will do well because our customers keep requesting us to add cosmetics to the store and so that they do not have to go to far away stores.

loans.use: Add new segment to the existing store

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid S.  is a 47-year-old farmer who owns a fruit garden and sells the fruit to the local bazaar traders.  He started his business in 1992 when he first planted  fruit trees and in the next two years he start selling fruits to the local bazaar traders. Vahid is married and has two daughters and two sons.They live in the southern village of Azerbaijan, near Saatli. During this period, selling fruits bought him good income and Vahid always covered his family's needs. Bu the  last two years the situation in the country changed: prices for products and clothes increased. Also unemployment complicates a hard situation. Currently his small business does not bring him the benefit he wishes and he has applied for a 1200 USD loan to expand his business and to improve the life of his family.

loans.use: Going to expand his business

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: I am Bilqees B. and a mother of nine children. A few years back my husband died due to an undiagnosed disease. We did not have enough money to arrange an excellent and expensive doctor for him. My children consequently had to quit their studies and they started menial jobs to makeup with the household expenses and gather money for their father’s treatment. A couple of years ago I took a loan and started a business of making small bags out of the used clothing. My eldest son buys the used clothes from a local used cloth market. I then make over these clothes into the bags that he sells to various auto spare parts dealers (these bags are used to keep various spare parts). If we are able to buy used clothes in bulk it will reduce our operating costs to half because buying in large amounts is quite cheaper. With the increase in my profits, I plan to marry two of my sons next year.

loans.use: Buy used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I am Nasreen A. from Lahore, a fast growing metropolis. I am married with six children. I make jewelry tassels and my husband operates a ‘rent a car’ business. My eldest son also helps him in his business. Earlier my husband used to sell fruits and vegetables in the local food market but then he had to give up this business due to the very small profit ratio. His current business is doing well. Now he needs to add on a new car to his store so that he can promptly respond to a large number of clients and generate more profits. Please lend him the required money which he will add to his savings so that he can buy a new car.

loans.use: Buy a new car for the "rent a car" business

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: I am Shumaila B.. I was born in Gujarat, a mid-sized city, but moved to another city Lahore, after my marriage. My husband is a textile designer and embroiders clothes. He started this business two years ago with a loan that we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Our business is growing over the years. Now we plan to further expand and take on bigger orders. We will therefore buy a large quantity of raw materials and save on the cost per item.  I will save the extra profits to buy a house of my own. Please lend us US$500.

loans.use: Expand embroidered clothing business

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en: A. Hargiz is 57-years old, married and the mother of nine children. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Lachin region, situated in the West of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Right now she lives in Sumqayit city.
