She is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. Nargiz has a small flock of sheep. She buys lambs and raises them for sale 6 months later. She sells the sheep in the local market, buys other lambs, and spends the rest of her profits on the necessities of life for her family. The business is very interesting but sometimes demands more funding than she has available. Her husband helps her in this work. In 2004 Hargiz borrowed $500 from Normicro and expanded her business. She would like to receive $1,000 loan in order to acquire 5 small sheep and feed for them. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She eventually hopes to expand this business. She hopes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 small sheep and feed for them

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 22242

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en: My name is Jannat B. and I am a widow and a mother of five children. My eldest son designs and makes furniture. His business yields just enough for us to manage our living and send the children to school. He wants to expand his business so that it will be possible to buy timber in large volume and thus produce more furniture. The increased production will double his income and we will be able to eat better at home. He will especially make more in the wedding season, which is around the corner.

loans.use: Buy timber in bulk

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: I am Naheed Butt from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am the mother of two children and a housewife. Both of my children study in a local college. My husband buys auto spare parts from a nearby wholesale market and sells them in his store. My husband wishes to enlarge his business and buy these spare parts in bulk. The extra profits will help us marry our daughter next year.

loans.use: Buy auto spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: I am Nazeeran B.. I was born in Gujarat, a mid size city but moved to Lahore in my early teens. I am the mother of two sons and one daughter. My husband is a scrap dealer and he purchases various second-hand machine tools and sells them in different factories. This business leaves us with decent profits and we were able to buy a fridge and marry one of my daughters. We need to expand the business and buy a large quantity of second hand machinery spare parts.

loans.use: Buy various machine spare parts in large quantity

loans.name: Junu Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Junu Maiya S., 33, lives in Kalimati. Kalimati is located in Kathmandu Valley. Kalimati is a very popular market for selling vegetables and fruits. Mrs. S. lives in a home with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Prem Bahadur S., is a taxi driver. He drives a taxi around Kathmandu Valley. Her daughter has completed an SLC (School Leaving Certificate) this year and her son is in grade 6. Now she needs a $175 loan to help her husband with the maintenance of his taxi.

loans.use: To repair a taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: My name is Khalida B.. I have one daughter who studies in the first grade. My husband and I operate a food stall in a nearby market. We started this business a few years ago with the loan I took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The income from the business was just enough to pay back the installments and put food on our table. With every passing day, we feel the need for an extra income. Therefore, we wish to have a loan to expand food variety in our stall.

loans.use: Expand food variety in the food stall

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: A. Sevda was born in the Gubadli region of the Azerbaijan - Armenian conflict territor. She is 47 years old and the mother of three children. Right now she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, in the East of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2002. She sells creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, and other toiletries. In 2004 Sevda borrowed $500 from Normicro, and bought perfume goods and expanded her business. With this business expansion she earned some extra money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs such as medication, clothes, and school. Next time she borrowed $700 to buy merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and to be able to offer her clients a bigger variety and quality. Now, she needs $900 for expanding her business and for improving her family's living conditions.  She wants to increase her client base and improve her income.

loans.use: expanding her business and improving her family's living conditions

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22248

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Aged 37, Mr. Kossi S. was born in Zafi. Married and the father of nine children, he is also responsible for three other people. Having abandoned school at a very young age, he learned to be joiner. He does not have the means to open a workshop but carries out his trade in a small hardware store that his wife manages. Often faced with stock shortages, he is asking for a loan of $400 to buy hardware supplies (iron, nails, sheet-metal…) in order to increase his purchasing power and help his wife with her work, so that she can help out from time to time. This would allow him to increase his income and send his children to school.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 37 ans, Monsieur S. Kossi est né à Zafi. Marié et père de neuf (09) enfants, il a à sa charge trois (03) autres personnes. Abandonné très tôt les bancs, il apprend la menuiserie. Manquant de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier, il essaie d’exercer son métier et a une petite boutique de quincaillerie que sa femme gère. Souvent confronté à la rupture de stock, il sollicite un crédit de $400 pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat en faisant le stock des produits de la quincaillerie (fer, clou, tôles…) et aider sa femme à faire quelque chose pour pouvoir l’aider de temps à autre. Cette réalisation lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et assurer la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: To stock up on hardware supplies

loans.name: Axolussi

texts.fr:
Born in 1952 in Bè, Mrs. Axolussi G. is married and has four children. She comes from a poor family and was unable to attend school. Her main business is growing and selling vegetables. Greatly upset and affected by the floods that deplete her harvest, she is asking for a loan of $300 to buy machines that will draw water from her land and increase the area she can cultivate. This sum will enable her to increase her income and help her husband send their children to school.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1952 à Bè, Madame G. Axolussi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle n’a pas pu fréquenter. Son activité principale est la culture et la vente des légumes. Très gênée et dérangée par l’inondation qui fait que ses récoltes sont très insuffisantes, elle sollicite un crédit de $300 pour acheter des machines pour aspirer l’eau et agrandir son espace cultivable. Cette somme lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et aider son mari à pouvoir assurer la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: To buy a machine and increase cultivable land

loans.name: Gulab

texts.en: Gulab A. is a 24-year-old married woman who raises livestock for meat production. She started her business recently, in 2006. Gulab purchased one calf and is going to raise it for meat purpose in the near future. She already sold two calves and it brought her good income. She lives with her husband and two children in the small village near to the Saatli region. Selling livestock is the only  financial source in her family, since she and her husband are unemployed. Raising children is expensive and it is very hard to live a normal life without additional sources of income.  Gulab has applied for a 1000 USD loan to expand her business and purchase three calves and fodder. The estimated cost for one calf is 200-300 USD and with the rest of loan she will purchase fodder.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Meherrem

texts.en: N. Meherrem is 51 years old and the father of 4 children. He is from the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan Armenian conflict territory  in West Azerbaijan. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city. He supports his family through his taxi driving business, which he started 14 years ago. Meherrem has had a lot of experience and is good driver, but this job is very hard because he does not own a car himself, and must rent one to run his business. Mehrrem has some money saved to invest in a car but he does not yet have enough. For this reason he would like to take out the $500 loan to purchase the car and to build a garage. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business further and providing well for his family.

loans.use: to buy a car, to build garage for his car and to buy necessary tools and equipment

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 22252

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodjo A. was born in 1963 in Tchamba. He is married and the father of four children. He lives in Akoin and trained as a refrigerator electrician after high school. His wife, who runs a small general grocery store, cannot buy enough goods to increase her income. Mr. A. has an entrepreneurial spirit and has a small store selling electrical equipment. As he cannot afford to buy supplies for his store, he is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build up his stock and give him greater purchasing power. This sum will help him realize his goal of raising his income and ensure the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kodjo est né en 1963 à Tchamba. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfant. Il réside à Akoin et est électricien frigoriste de formation. Après ses études secondaires, il entre en formation. Sa femme faisant un petit commerce d’alimentation générale n’arrive pas à faire des achats pour augmenter le revenu. Monsieur A. Kodjo a l’esprit d’entreprise et a une petite boutique de vente des matériels électrique. N’ayant pas de moyens pour approvisionner sa boutique, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat en faisant de stockage d’article. Ce montant l’aidera à faire ces réalisation pour hausser ses revenus et assurer le bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Roberta M’Bambé

texts.fr:
Roberta M’Bambé M. was born on April 30, 1974 in Lomé. She is single and has no children, but is responsible for two other people. After high school she became a hairdresser, but with few customers, she turned her hairdressing salon into a cafeteria, restaurant and bar, which was a great success. However, given that she has no funds to put into her business, she cannot meet the needs of her customers. She is therefore asking for a loan of $1,000 to enable her to buy drinks directly from the Brasserie, which will cost her less and increase her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

M. Roberta M’Bambé est née le 30 avril 2007 1974 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire sans enfants, mais a deux (02) autres personnes en charge. Après ces études secondaires, elle a fait la coiffure mais faute de clientèle, elle a transformé son salon de coiffure en cafétéria, bar restaurant ce qui lui réussit bien. Mais devant le manque de fonds de commerce elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle. Pour cela elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 qui lui permettrait d'acheter les boissons directement à la Brasserie ce qui lui couterait moins cher et augmenterait ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mrs. Eya K. was born in Tchékpo. Married and the mother of four children, she began selling rice and cooked beans in Akoin (Alinka) after about four years of high school. Her husband, a soldier, is unable to meet the needs of the household because of his low salary. With no means of buying supplies of rice and beans, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan of $200. She would then be able to increase her sales and help her husband, all for the well-being of the family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame K. Eya est née à Tchékpo. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle a commencé la vente du riz et du haricot cuit à Akoin, (Alinka). Après ses études secondaires, environ 4 ans. Son mari soldat, n’arrive pas à satisfaire le foyer à cause de son maigre salaire. Faute de moyens pour faire un stockage du riz et haricot, elle sollicite un crédit de $200. Cette réalisation lui procurera une augmentation de ses revenus et aider son mari pour le bien-être de la famille.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and beans

loans.name: Pauline Yilignan

texts.fr:
Pauline Yilignan M., an office secretary by profession, was born on June 29, 1964 in Lomé. She is the single mother of one daughter and has four other people in her care. She lives in the Tokoin Gbonvié district. With no fixed employment, she does word processing at home, which is not ideal. She is very ambitious and wants to open a cyber facility, but her small savings are insufficient, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy computers and equipment for her facility. This will increase her revenue.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

M. Pauline Yilignan secrétaire bureautique de profession est née le 29 juin 1964 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec une fille et quatre (04) autres personnes en charge. Elle réside dans le quartier Tokoin Gbonvié. Ne trouvant pas d'emploi fixe elle fait des traitement de texte à domicile ce qui ne l'avantage pas. Très ambitieuse, elle veut ouvrir un cyber mais devant ses maigres économies qui sont insuffisant, elle sollicite un montant de $1000 pour l’achat des ordinateurs et des équipements pour son cyber. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d'affaire

loans.use: To buy computers for a cyber facility

loans.name: K,ernest

texts.fr:
Aged 60, Mr. Ernest K. K. was born in Djagblé. Married with seven children, he is a house painter in Alinka. He has been doing this for 20 years. As this was not giving him enough income, he opened a small store selling wood, which has done very well. With no financial means, Mr. K. is unable to meet market demand. He is therefore asking for a loan of $1,200 to stock up on wood and buy paint supplies. This would enable him to increase his income and provide for the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 60 ans, Monsieur K. K. Ernest est né à Djagblé. Marié et père de sept (07) enfants. Il est peintre bâtiment à Alinka. Cela fait 20 ans qu’il est dans ce domaine. Ses revenus n’étant pas suffisant, il a ouvert une petite boutique de vente de bois qui lui réussit bien. Faute de moyens financiers, Monsieur K. n’arrive pas à satisfaire la demande du marché. Pour cela il sollicite un apport financier de $1200 pour faire un stockage de bois et acheter des matériels de peinture (colle, chaud etc.). Cette réalisation lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et assurer le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wood and building materials

loans.name: Eulalie

texts.fr:
Miss Eulalie D. Z. was born on February 12, 1964 in Kpalimé. She is married with four children and also looks after her grandson. She sells firewood and charcoal. Her husband, who works as a driver at the port, is unable to meet the needs of the family, so his wife takes on most of the expenses. However, she runs into difficulties in her business because of lack of funds. Miss D. Z. is therefore asking for a loan of $600 to stock up on merchandise.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle D. Eulalie épse Z. est née le 12 février 1964 à Kpalimé. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et à charge son petit fils. Elle est commerçante de bois de chauffage, de charbon de bois et d’orange. Son mari étant chauffeur de profession au port, n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille donc sa femme prend part à la plus grande partie des charges. Mais, elle rencontre des difficultés dans ses activités, problème de fonds de commerce. Pour cela mademoiselle D. Eulalie épse Z. sollicite un montant de $600 pour le stockage des marchandises.

loans.use: To buy stock of wood and charcoal

loans.name: Ayelinko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayelinko Awanago was born in 1961 in Tsévié, Togo. Married and mother of two children she is also responsible for two other persons. She had to leave off schooling at an early age and took up an apprenticeship in bicycle/motorbike repair. For more than 10 years she has been a certified mechanic and also has a little business selling gas and kerosene to augment their income. Her husband is a surveyor and is not able to support the family due to insufficient business. In order to better aid her husband in bearing the financial burden for their family, Mrs. Awanago is asking for a loan of US$ 800. This will allow her to keep a stable quantity of kerosene on hand and buy some spare parts. Having this loan will increase the income she brings in and thus improve life for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame AWANAGO Ayelinko est née en 1961 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, et à sa charge deux (02) autres personnes. Elle a très tôt abandonné les études et a opté pour l’apprentissage de la mécanique à 2 roues. Devenue chef mécanicienne, depuis plus de 10 ans, elle fait aussi un petit commerce d’essence et de pétrole à cause des insuffisances des revenus. Son mari géomètre n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille à cause de la baisse de son activité. Afin de mieux pouvoir aider son mari, Madame AWANAGO sollicite un crédit de $800. Ceci lui permettre de faire un stock permanent de pétrole et acheter des matériels (les pièces détachées). Cette somme lui procurera une augmentation de ses revenus et une amélioration de son niveau de vie.

loans.use:
Buying kerosene and spare parts

Stock de petrole et achat des materiels

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Born on Dec. 12, 1975 in Lomé, Gulf Prefecture, Togo, Mr. Jean A. stopped after primary school and began an apprenticeship. Married and father of two children, he is a trained carpenter and now has his own shop. He has acquired considerable experience which brings in lots of customers. However, Mr. A. has difficulty exercising his trade because he does not have enough modern tools. The tools he has are old and worn, which makes his work slow and difficult. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase better tools. Mr. A. is currently living in Lomé in the Tokoin Ramco district where his workshop is located; he works together with Mr. Michel Balo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 12 décembre 1975 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, monsieur A. Jean a arrêté ses études au cours primaire et s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il est menuisier de formation et aujourd’hui il détient son propre atelier. Il a acquis une expérience redoutable dans son métier, ce qui fait augmenter sa clientèle. Mais monsieur A. Jean rencontre certaines difficultés, il ne dispose pas assez d’outils d’importance capitale. Ceux qui sont actuellement à sa disposition sont vétustes, ce qui rend le travail lent et pénible. Pour cela, il sollicite un financement de $ 400 pour renforcer son équipement de travail. Mr A. Jean réside actuellement à Lomé dans le quartier Tokoin Ramco où se trouve également son atelier dans lequel il travaille en association avec Mr BALO Michel.

loans.use:
Purchase of updated carpentry tools

achat d'équipement moderne de travail

loans.name: Ablakpi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablakpi L. is 55 years old, married, and mother of three children. She lives in Togblé, Togo where she also has a business selling palm oil (for culinary purposes) and firewood. Because of her lack of capital and other difficulties of running a business, she is asking for a loan of US$ 200 so that she can maintain a constant supply of palm oil and firewood, so that she can get her business going again.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame L. Ablakpi âgée de 55 ans, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle réside à Togblé où elle exerce comme activité la vente d’huile de palme et de bois de chauffage. Par manque de fond de commerce, et certaines difficultés qu’elle rencontre dans ses activités, elle sollicite un crédit de $200 pour faire le stockage permanent d’huile et de bois afin de relancer ses activités.

loans.use:
purchase of palm oil for resale

Stockage d'huile

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Born August 10, 1974 in Lomé, in the Gulf Prefecture, Togo, Mr. Michel B. stopped school after the primary grades and began an apprenticeship. Married and father of two children, he is a trained carpenter and now has his own workshop but because of lack of capital, he is not able to cope well with his financial needs, especially since his wife does not work outside the home. For these reasons, Mr. B. is not able to do well by his family. He is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to improve his business and better the lives of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 10 Août 1974 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe monsieur Michel B. a arrêté ses études au cours primaire. Il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Il est menuisier de formation et aujourd’hui il tient son propre atelier mais faute de moyen financier, il n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts avec sa famille, puisque sa femme n’exerce aucun métier. Ainsi monsieur Michel B. avec son petit revenu n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite donc un montant de $300 pour renforcer ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use:
improving his business

renforcement de ses activités

loans.name: Soussou

texts.fr:
Mr. Soussou B. was born on June 13, 1980 in Tsékpo, Togo. Single and without children, Mr. B. is a very dynamic and hard-working young man. After secondary school, he decided to learn to be a carpenter because he has a creative urge and no money to further pursue his studies. He has some plans that he would like to find financing for: he needs wood to build furniture for sale and also tools. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of US$ 600.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Soussou B. est né le 13 juin 1980 à Tsékpo. Célibataire sans enfant, monsieur Soussou B. est un jeune très dynamique et dévoué. Après ses études secondaires il a préféré faire la menuiserie parce qu’il a un esprit créative mais faute de financement, il a des projets qu’il voudrait réaliser : acheter du bois pour faire des meubles et revendre et aussi acheter des outils de travail. Pour cela il sollicite auprès de vous un montant de $600.

loans.use:
purchase of wood and tools for his work

achat de bois et des outils de travail

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi A. was born on March 18, 1984 in Lomé and lives in Agoè, Togo. He is married and father of one child. His wife is a seamstress and he is an auto welder by trade. He learned this trade after he left primary school and started up a workshop in Adéwui.

Mr. A. works in this garage with his friends but he would like to have his own workshop. His present financial resources only allow him to support his little family not open a workshop of his own, however. For this reason, he is requesting from you a loan of US$ 600 so that he can open his own garage and purchase his own tools. In that way he can improve the standard of living for his family. He plans to repay this loan over the period of 12 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kossi est né le 18 Mars 1984 à Lomé, il réside à Agoè. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Sa femme est couturière et lui-même soudeur auto de profession. Il apprit ce métier après ses études primaires et a installé son atelier à Adéwui.

Monsieur A. Kossi travaille dans ce garage avec ses amis mais il veut avoir lui-même son propre atelier mais les moyens financiers dont il dispose ne suffit qu’aux besoins de sa petite famille. A cet effet il sollicite auprès de vous un montant de $600 pour l’ouverture de son propre garage et de disposer de ses propres outils et ainsi accroître son niveau de vie et de sa famille. Ce montant sera remboursé en douze (12) mois.

loans.use:
opening up a welding workshop

ouverture d'un atelier de soudure

loans.name: Afi Adjobi

texts.fr:
Born on March 31, 1944 in Atakpamé, Togo, Widow Afi Adjobi R. sells lengths of African print cloth in Lomé. She is the sole breadwinner for 6 people. After the death of her husband, she began this business with her small savings. The business income does not allow her to cover all the needs of her family because she lacks business capital. She always has to have new and different cloth for sale so that her customers can find what they want. In order to grow her business, she is asking for a loan of US$ 600.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 31 mars 1944 à Atakpamé, Veuve R. Afi Adjobi revendeuse de pagne à Lomé a à sa charge six (06) personnes. Après la mort de son mari, elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce avec sa petite économie. Ce commerce ne lui permet pas à couvrir tous les besoins de sa famille car son commerce nécessite plus de moyens. Il faut chaque fois avoir de nouveautés de pagnes pour permettre aux clients de mieux faire leur choix. Afin d’agrandir la taille de son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $600.

loans.use:
Sale of lengths of African print cloth

Vente de pagne

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr:
Mr. Tété A. was born on October 12, 1978 in Lomé, Togo and lives in the district of N’kafu.He is a very gifted and hard-working young bachelor. After secondary school, he took up an apprenticeship and became a qualified electrician. Mr. A. has some difficulty, however, with his business. He needs to do some remodeling in his shop which is located in the district of Adéwui in order to attract more customers. He would also like to add the sale of video and CD players and for these reasons he is asking for a loan of US$ 1000. He is counting on your help in growing his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Tété A. est né le 12 Octobre 1978 à Lomé et réside au quartier N’kafu. Il est jeune célibataire très doué et dynamique. Après ces études secondaires, il a fait l’apprentissage et est devenu électronicien de profession. Monsieur Tété A. rencontre certaines difficultés pour le perfectionnement de son travail. Il a besoin d’aménager son lieu de travail qui se trouve au quartier Adéwui pour attirer la clientèle. Il veut aussi ajouter le commerce de CD vidéo et pour résoudre ces manquements il sollicite le montant de $1000. Il compte sur vous pour rehausser ses activités.

loans.use:
sale of DVD and CD players

Achat et vente d'appareil DVD et CD

loans.name: Gahithan

texts.fr:
Mr. Gahithan B. was born on August 7, 1972 in Sotouboua and is single. After his primary studies, he began work as a shoemaker; he lives in the district of Adéwui. He does not have his own workshop due to lack of capital, so he teamed up to work with a friend, which caused him a lot of difficulties. He is therefore asking for a loan of US$ 300 to buy hides to make shoes to sell himself. He plans to display them in front of his workshop so as to attract customers and hopes to be able to fill their orders in a timely fashion. He is counting on your goodwill.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Gahithan B. est né le 07 Août 1972 à Sotouboua et est célibataire. Après ses études primaires il s’est lancé dans la cordonnerie et réside au quartier Adéwui. Il ne dispose pas d’atelier, faute de moyens financiers et s’est associé à un ami pour travailler, rencontrant ainsi beaucoup de difficultés. Il sollicite alors un montant de $300 pour acheter les peaux de bête et fabriquer des chaussures à son propre compte et les exposer devant son atelier en l'espoir d’attirer la clientèle et de la satisfaire à temps. Il compte sur votre bonne volonté.

loans.use:
purchase of hides (leather) to use to make shoes

Achat de peaux de bêtes pour fabrication de chaussures

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim is 32 year old hard working resident of Vituka. He has got multi businesses in the area ranging from shops, kiosks and a grocery. At of the shop where this photo was taken, he has employed two assistants and it sells cosmetics, art crafts, and other house hold items. Joachim has received business management and entrepreneurship skills training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. All his three business are working out well for him and now needs another loan to expand his art and crafts shop. He is now in need of USD 1075 to help expand his business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Frédéric

texts.fr:
Frédéric H. was born on July 4, 1978 in Porto-Novo in the Republic of Benin and is single. He completed an apprenticeship in carpentry after he left primary school and acquired a good deal of experience in this trade. He lacks the capital necessary to purchase wood and tools, so as to be able to translate this experience into a flourishing carpentry business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 600. His carpentry shop is in Adéwui, Togo, where he also lives.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Frédéric H. est né le 04 juillet 1978 au Porto-Novo en République du BENIN et est célibataire. Il a fait l’apprentissage en menuiserie, après ses études primaires et a acquis beaucoup d’expérience. Pour mettre en œuvre cette expérience, il est confronté à des difficultés financières pour acquérir les matières premières et les outils de travail. Pou cela il sollicite un montant de $600 pour pallier à ces difficultés. Il a son atelier à Adéwui où il réside.

loans.use:
purchase of raw materials and tools

achat de matière première et des outils de travail

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi A. was born on February 17, 1967, in Lomé. She was not fortunate enough to go to school due to the pitiful financial situation of her parents. Selling beignets (a kind of doughnut) is her main business. Single with two persons care for, she needs financial support in the amount of $400 to strengthen and grow her business. The loan will be used as capital to buy sacks of flour for making beignets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Afi est née le 17 février 1967 à Lomé. Elle n’a pas eut la chance d’aller à l’école à cause de la situation financière misérable de ses parents. Elle exerce comme activité principale la vente de beignet. Célibataire, avec deux (02) personnes à charge ; elle a besoin d’un appui financier de $400 pour renforcer et accroître la taille de son commerce. Ceci lui servira de fond de commerce pour l’achat de sacs de farine de blé pour la préparation de son beignet.

loans.use: A supply of flour

loans.name: Batoura

texts.fr:
Batoura B. was born on August 25, 1970, in Baguida (Golfe Prefecture). He is married and the father of one. After finishing middle school, he learned the trade of upholstery and mattress-making. But he is encountering problems getting his business going, so he is requesting a loan of $600. This amount is for acquiring quality tools, so that he can do better work. He is counting on your support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Batoura B. est né le 25 Août 1970 à Baguida dans la préfecture de Golfe, s’est marié et est père d’un enfant. Après ces études secondaires il a appris un métier en tapisserie et en matelasserie mais il rencontre des difficultés dans l’exécution de son travail et sollicite à cet effet un montant de $600.Ce montant qui va servir à acheter les outils de qualité pour mieux exercer son métier. Il compte sur votre soutient.

loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: Lusekelo

texts.en: Lusekelo is 43 year old mother of six. She has been doing business for the past ten years, and this has helped her sustain her family together with relatives. She has got a kiosk at Mwalimu Julius Nyerere International Airport, Tanzania’s biggest and busiest Airport. It keeps her busy all day and sometimes night because the airport operates 24 hours. She is in need of USD 1200, to help boost her business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a 50-year-old mother of six and an energetic and dynamic resident of the Vituka area. She has been doing petty business for the past 20 years and has been able to support her family. She sells Kanga, vitenge (traditional attire) and used clothes. She is in need of USD 550 to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Bariatou

texts.fr:
Bariatou A. is married and without children. She was born on March 22, 1987, in Lomé. Currently she does not work, and her spouse, an upholsterer, has not been able to provide for all the needs of the family. Ms. A. would like a loan of $300 to start an onion business in order to help her husband with household expenses. She resides in Adéwui and often helps him in his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Femme mariée sans enfant, madame Bariatou A. est née le 22 mars 1987 à Lomé. Actuellement, elle n’exerce aucun métier et son conjoint étant tapissier n’arrive pas à subvenir à tous les besoins de la famille. Madame Bariatou A. souhaiterait avoir un financement de $300 pour se lancer dans le commerce d’oignons afin aider son mari dans les charges de la maison. Elle réside à Adéwui et aide souvent le mari dans son atelier.

loans.use: Commerce in onions

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 34-year-old mother of two and a resident of the Airport Zone in Dar es Salaam city. She prepares  simple bites and cakes, including wedding cakes. She bakes them at her home and supplies them to the nearby shops and kiosks. She is in need of USD 400 to help her buy a stronger oven and expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr:
Ayao A. was born on January 27, 1977, in Lomé. He is married and the father of two. Trained as an electronics technician, he does well enough, though he works out of his home due to a lack of funds to open a shop. In addition to his two children, he has two other persons as dependents. He has proven himself at his work, and his services are more and more in demand. The lack of tools and supplies keeps him from meeting customer expectations. To satisfy them, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy supplies, which would enable him to meet these expectations quickly. Then his income will increase, and his family's living conditions will improve.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Ayao, né le 27 janvier 1977 à Lomé, est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Electronicien de formation, il se débrouille à la maison faute de fonds pour ouvrir un atelier. Il a en plus de ses 2 enfants 2 autres personnes à charge. Il fait preuve d’une maîtrise de son travail et est de plus en plus sollicité. Le manque de matériels le limite pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter des matériaux de travail. Cette acquisition lui permettra de satisfaire rapidement sa clientèle. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus et améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy  supplies

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 44-year-old father of four and a resident of Vituka. He has a hardware shop where he sells electrical goods. He has been doing business for the past ten years and now wants to open up another shop in the nearby trading center to reach more customers. He is in need of USD 1,075 to help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Abalo

texts.fr:
Abalo K. was born on March 14, 1978 in Kara (Kozah Prefecture) in the north of Togo. He is single with two children and has five other people as dependents. As a moped mechanic in Lomé, he provides for his children. Unfortunately this work does not bring in the necessary income, since he lacks an appropriate workshop and tools of the trade. His goal now is to open his own actual shop worthy of being called a workshop and to acquire tools and replacement parts to sell to his customers. This is why he is requesting a loan of $1,000. His business is a good one in this country having a multitude of zémidjan (moped taxis).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Abalo K. est le 14 Mars 1978 à Kara dans la préfecture de la Kozah au Nord du Togo. Célibataire avec deux (02) enfants et cinq (05) autres personnes à charge, il s'exerce comme mécanicien à 2 roues à Lomé pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Malheureusement, ce métier ne lui procure pas le revenu nécessaire et indispensable à ses besoins, étant donné qu’il ne dispose pas d’un lieu de travail approprié et manque d’outils de travail. Son objectif aujourd’hui est d’ouvrir son propre et véritable atelier de travail digne de nom et acquérir les outils de travail et les pièces de rechange qu’il pourra revendre à ses clients. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un financement de $1000. C’est une activité qui marche très bien dans le pays avec la multiplication de taxi moto ou zémidjan.

loans.use: To open a shop and to buy tools of the trade

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 42-year-old mother of three and a resident of Vituka. She has been doing business for the past ten years. She sells vitenge and Kanga (traditional attire) which she supplies upcountry. She also has a shop in the Vituka area where she sells some of her stock before supplying the clothing to the nearby regions. She is in need of USD 550 to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Shakiratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Shakiratou L. was born on December 22, 1980 in Lomé in the county of the Golfe, she is married to a house painter and is the mother of four (04) children. After her elementary schooling she became an apprentice in hairdressing. She then opened a small salon that does not run very well. For this reason she decided to supplement her hairdressing business with the retail of traditional wrap around fabric and jewelry. It is through this small business that she will be able to help her husband with the household expenses and the children's schooling. To allow her to increase her business she is requesting a loan of $600. This financial contribution will enhance her commercial activity and improve her socio economic condition.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 22 Décembre 1980 à Lomé dans la préfecture de Golfe, madame Shakiratou L. est mariée à un peintre décorateur et est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Après ses études primaires, elle entra en apprentissage de la coiffure. Elle ouvrit par la suite un petit atelier qui ne marche pas très bien. C’est pour cela qu’elle décida, en plus de son métier de coiffeuse, de faire le commerce de pagnes et bijoux. C’est à travers ce petit commerce qu’elle arrivera à aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et dans l’éducation des enfants. Pour lui permettre de relever le niveau de son commerce, elle sollicite un apport financier de $600. Cet apport financier va apporter un plus à ses activités commerciales et améliorer ses conditions socio-économiques.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of traditional wrap around fabric (pagnes) and jewelry

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 35-year-old business woman in the Vituka area. For 4 years, she has had a shop and sells soft drinks and processed water wholesale. She also sells children's clothing.

Amina requests a loan of $S950 to purchase more supplies to sell to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 34-year-old mother of three who lives in the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam. For the past 3 years, she has been selling groceries, mainly cereals, maize and wheat flours, rice, beans, and many other items. She gets the items from the suppliers upcountry, and sells wholesale and retail.

She requests a loan of $400 to purchase more supplies to sell during the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 45-year-old mother of four who lives in Vituka in Dar es Salaam. Lillian owns a shop and sells groceries as a wholesaler and a retailer. She sells maize flour, rice, wheat ,and beans.

She requests a loan of $750 to purchase more supplies to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena, 49, is a resident of Yombo Vituka. She has been in business for the past ten years. She sells used and new clothes in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam.

Her business always increases during the holiday seasons. She requests a loan of $325 to purchase clothing to sell to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr:
Mrs. Véronique R. was born in Accra on April 27, 1971, she is a seamstress and also does a bit of retail in the storefront of her workshop. She is married to an electrician whose income is insufficient. Mrs. Véronique R. cares for 5 persons that she can barely feed. Sewing does not bring in an income anymore because her clients cannot retrieve the clothing she fashioned. She is requesting a loan of $400 to broaden her retailing because this is an activity she succeeds in.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Accra le 27 avril 1971, Madame R. Véronique est couturière et fait aussi de petit commerce à la devanture de son atelier. Mariée à un électricien qui a de faibles revenus, Madame R. Véronique à 5 personnes à sa charge qu’elle arrive difficilement à nourrir. La couture ne rapportant plus puisque les clients n’arrivent à retire leurs habits confectionnés. Elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour élargir son commerce car ce domaine lui réussit bien.

loans.use: Seamstress and small retail

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, a 35-year-old mother of three, lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam. She sells both used and new clothes in the Vituka trading center. She also operates a restaurant alongside the shop. She received training in business and entrepreneurship from the Youth Self Employment Foundation, which has helped her expand her business.

Hawa requests a loan of $750 to purchase new and used clothing to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Alifredina

texts.en:
Alifredina is a 52-year-old energetic and dynamic mother of six. She has been in business for the past 25 years. She has run a restaurant for a long time, as well as a kiosk and a charcoal store. The profits from her businesses have helped the pay school fees for all of her children.

Alifredina requests a loan of $950 to purchase supplies for her restaurant and other businesses.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Karimatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Karimatou Y. was born in 1952 in Acra, Ghana, she is the mother of three (03) children. Since her childhood she has enjoyed the trade business and thrust herself in the retailing of dry goods. Being a widow she has no one else to help her support her family aside from her small retail store. Thus to get the supplies and attract more clients and to pull her family out of poverty, she is requesting a loan of $600.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1952 à Accra au Ghana, madame Karimatou Y. est mère de trois (03) enfants. Depuis son enfance, elle a pris goût au commerce et se lance des la vente des produits de mercerie et autres mais étant veuve elle n’a personne pour l’aider à supporter sa famille à part son petit commerce. Ainsi pour s’approvisionner et attirer beaucoup de clientèle et sortir sa famille de son état de pauvreté, elle sollicite un montant de $600.

loans.use: Supplying dry goods and notions

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zani is a 35-year-old mother of seven, and lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam. She has been in business for the past eight years. The profits from her business helps support her family. She sells new and used clothes, retail and sometimes wholesale.

Zani requests a loan of $550 to purchase more new and used clothing to sell.

loans.use: Purchase new and used clothing to sell

loans.name: Maimounatou

texts.fr:
Born in Mango and aged 45, Mrs. Maïmounatou A. is married and is the breadwinner for 5 other persons. Her husband, who is a driver, is not able to contribute to supporting the family because his earnings are meager. The whole financial responsibility rests on Mrs. A., who manages to support her family on income from retailing charcoal, maize (corn) etc. Since this is not sufficient income, she has decided to expand her business and sell wholesale. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 400. Being able to expand her business will permit her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Mango et âgée de 45 ans, Madame A. Maïmounatou est mariée avec à sa charge 5 personnes. Son mari chauffeur n’arrive pas à contribuer aux besoins de la famille à cause de son maigre revenu. Toutes les charges reposent sur Madame A. et elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins grâce aux revenus de la vente de charbon, maïs, d’igname. Ceci étant insuffisant elle décida d’agrandir son commerce, en devenant grossiste. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Le fait d’agrandir son commerce lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of foodstuffs and charcoal

Stockage et vente de vivres et charbon

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is a 56-year-old hard-working mother of three, who lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam. She has been in business for 20 years, and now operates a small food market. She received training in business and entrepreneurship skills from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

Lukia requests a loan of $550 to purchase food to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya has requested a loan of $1000 to expand her small family business where she sells pet supplies and rodent control products. She and her husband, Georgiy, work together in the business, and their three college-age sons help when they can. Nelya and Georgiy would like to open a new vending location in a village near Kamenka-Dneprovskaya where they currently operate. 

Their business has been a family venture ever since they started 15 years ago. They considered several different business possibilities before settling on this one. It has been a good business to be in as there is always demand for both pet food and supplies as well as rodent and pest control. Over the years they have developed a good reputation and gained many loyal customers and acquaintances which further helps the success of their business. 

Eventually Nelya and Georgiy would like to open a regular store facility. HOPE Intl- Nadiya Ukraine and kiva.org are happy to be able to assist theses dedicated entrepreneurs meet their needs and pursue their goals.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
At 57 years of age, Widow Ablavi K. has to struggle to support herself and her children. After the death of her husband in Accra, Ghana, she was obliged to come back to live in Togo near her extended family since she had no one to help her. To deal with the situation, she began a little business selling foodstuffs. Her very limited financial resources do not allow her to satisfy all her customers' needs, however, and she risks losing her clientele if she is not able to remedy this situation. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 700. This will allow her to expand her inventory of foodstuffs and retain her customers. She is counting on your aid in ameliorating her little business and thus her standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 57 ans, Veuve Ablavi K. se bat pour subvenir à ses besoins et celui de ses enfants. Après la mort de son mari à Accra au Ghana, elle a été obligée de revenir vivre au Togo auprès de sa famille car elle n’a personne pour l’aider. Pour sortir de cette situation elle a commencé un petit commerce de denrées alimentaires. Ses moyens si maigres ne lui permet d'être à la hauteur de sa clientèle et risque de les perdre s'il ne fait rien. Pour remédier à cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $700. Ceci lui permettra de s'approvisionner en denrées et mieux satisfaire les clients. Elle compte sur votre financement pour améliorer son commerce et son niveau de vie.

loans.use:
purchasing foodstuffs for resale

Approvisionnement en denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 36-year-old mother of six, who lives in the Yombo area in the city of Dar es Salaam. She received business and entrepreneurship training from the Youth Self Employment Foundation. The training she received helped her improve her business.

For 8 years, Salome has run a grocery store, and she sells mainly cereal products, maize and wheat flour, rice, and beans. She requests a loan of $400 to purchase more supplies to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is a friendly entrepreneur who offers customers a great selection of teas and coffees from her colorful kiosk at one of the busy outdoor markets in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. Svetlana’s husband, Valeriy, originally started the business eight years ago. It has now become a family venture with both Svetlana and Valeriy and their daughters helping out with operations. They typically make an annual income of around 40,000 Ukrainian Ghrivna from their business, which works out to about $8,000. In the near future, Svetlana and Valeriy hope to be able to open a grocery store which will expand their business and hopefully increase their income. Svetlana has requested a loan of $1000 that will add to their available working capital and allow them to continue developing and improving their business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Esta is a 24-year-old mother with 2 children. In the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, she has run a nursery school for the past five years. The school now has 120 pupils. She received business and entrepreneurship training from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

Esta requests a loan of $400 to construct more buildings to expand the size of the school.

loans.use: Construct school buildings

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a sharp, young entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. She started her own clothing business five years ago and has been building a successful enterprise. Her business is located at the busy central market in Melitopol. She has a good location in the market for her sales kiosk and creates an attractive display of clothing for passing customers. Elena is single and lives with her parents. The income she is able to make is a help to her entire family.

Elena has requested a loan of $600 from Nadiya Ukraine so that she can purchase new fall and winter clothing inventory. This loan will allow her to increase her income by having the right clothing available to meet seasonal demand. Over the last five years, Elena has proven to be a great loan client with Nadiya Ukraine. We are glad to have this new opportunity to continue assisting her with her business.

loans.use: To purchase fall/winter inventory

loans.name: Godliver

texts.en:
Godliver is a 33-year-old mother, who lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar Es Salaam. She received training in business and entrepreneurship skills from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

For the last three years, she has run a grocery store. She requests a loan of $400 to increase her business.

loans.use: Increase business

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Miss Amivi G., who was born on Nov. 29, 1976 in Lomé, Togo, sells medicines and is responsible for three persons. The income from her business is quite meager because she is not always able to make sales through lack of inventory. Miss Amivi has great difficulty fulfilling her financial responsibilities. She is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to pay for a motorcycle taxi which will be available for errands for her every day. This will allow her to pay back the loan in the usual fashion and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mlle G. Amivi née le 20 novembre 1976 à Lomé est une revendeuse de médicament et a trois personnes à charge. Le revenu de ce commerce étant très faible, parce que la vente n’est pas régulière faute de manque de stock. Mlle Amivi arrive difficilement à assurer sa responsabilité. Elle sollicite un prêt de $800 pour payer une moto taxi qui lui fera les comptes tous les jours. Ce qui lui permettra de rembourser le crédit normalement et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of a motorcycle for use as a taxi

Achat d'une moto taxi

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a 61-year-old father of four, is a retired civil servant. He has been running a grocery store and restaurant from his home for the past seven years. He also received training in business and entrepreneurship skills from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

William requests a loan of $550 to purchase supplies to expand his grocery store and restaurant.

loans.use: Expand store and restaurant

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a married mother of three sons, ages ten to twenty-five. Raising three boys can be quite a financial challenge. Her women’s clothing business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past eleven years that she’s been in business. In a typical month Tatyana makes about $700 in profit from the business.

Tatyana is hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. Tatyana has requested a short-term loan of $1000 to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Born on July 12, 1974 in Naimey, Niger, Mrs. Afi O. is married to a tailor who is out of work and they have five children to raise. She left school to learn to be a seamstress. After she completed her apprenticeship, she also learned to dye lengths of African print cloth. Now, lacking the necessary funds, she is doing nothing. Her business amounts to selling penny candies and such, which does not bring in any real income. The fact that her husband is also not presently working as a tailor makes it extremely hard for them to support their family. In order to get back into business and manage to support their children, Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 12 juillet 1974 à Niamey au Niger, madame Afi O. est marié à un couturier sans travail avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Elle a quitté l’école au collègue pour apprendre la couture. Après son attestation de fin d’apprentissage, elle appris également la teinture des pagnes. Mais faute de moyens, elle ne fait actuellement rien. Ses activités se résument à un petit commerce de bombons et autres qui ne lui procure aucun revenu substantiel. Son mari également n’exerce pas son métier de couturier, ce qui rend très difficile l’économie très précaire de la famille. Pour relancer ses activités commerciales et pourvoir aux besoins de sa famille, elle sollicite un prêt de $1000.

loans.use:
purchase of a sewing machine and opening of a tailor shop

achat de machine et ouverture d'atelier de couture

loans.name: Genadiy

texts.en:
Genadiy is a doctor who had a desire to be self-employed and decided to open his own office rather that work in an old, Soviet-style medical clinic. He has been on his own now for three years and is working hard to expand his practice. Genadiy’s goal is to be able hire and train assistants to work with him and expand his small office into a private medical clinic. This expansion would allow his wife, Zinaida, who is also a doctor, to be able to work together with him.

Genadiy has requested a loan of $500 to give him extra capital so that he can complete some remodeling in his office and purchase new equipment. Genadiy’s medical practice has benefited in the past from the financial support of Nadiya Ukraine. Initially he was reluctant to take his first loan, but he needed money for his business. After experiencing first-hand the benefits of micro-lending, Genadiy has not only become a repeat customer, but he has also brought along other business owners to obtain necessary financing.

loans.use: To complete office remodeling and purchase equipment

loans.name: Yambi

texts.fr:
Born in Atakpamé in 1959, Yambi A. is married and the mother of five. She lives in the N'Kafu district of Lomé. Because her parents no longer had the money, she dropped out of middle school, entered an apprenticeship, and as much, ran up against enormous difficulties. Little by little, she had developed her display of boutique items for sale on the roadside where she established herself. Next, she rented a shop for her business and is today requesting working capital of $1,000. This will serve to increase her stock of merchandise and to acquire an embroidering machine. She manages her business perfectly and has the ability to manage this loan well, which will certainly have a positive impact on profits and will improve her family's living conditions considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Atakpamé en 1959, madame Yambi A. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants et habite le quartier N’Kafu à Lomé. Madame Yambi A. a arrêté ses études secondaires car ses parents n’avaient plus les moyens de la soutenir. Elle entre en apprentissage et se heurta également à d’énormes difficultés. A petit coup, elle évolua et installa au bord de la route et sur étalage des articles de mercerie par la suite, elle loue une boutique pour ses activités et sollicite un fonds de roulement de $1000 qui servira à augmenter sa mercerie et à acquérir une machine à surfiler. C’est une femme qui maîtrise parfaitement la gestion de son commerce et a la capacité de bien gérer ce prêt qui aura à coup sûr un impact très positif sur la rentabilité de son activité et améliorera considérablement les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy an embroidering machine and boutique items to sell

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, shortly after Ukraine gained it’s independence from the Soviet Union, Oksana started her own small business, taking advantage of new, free market opportunities. Over the years, she has gained much valuable experience as an entrepreneur and has been able to help provide necessary income for herself, her husband and daughter.

Oksana presently sells an assortment of women’s outerwear. She is evaluating the competition and would like to bring in products that other vendors don’t have. Oksana operates from a little kiosk at an outdoor market, but soon hopes to obtain a self-standing store facility that will be a big improvement to her business.

As it gets closer to the winter season, demand for Oksana’s products will grow. She has requested a short term loan of $500 to help purchase new clothing inventory and be better prepared for this busy time of year.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A. was born in 1976 in Lomé (Golfe Prefecture). He is married and the father of two. Not having been fortunate enough to continue his schooling, he very early on entered an apprenticeship. Lacking the financial support, he dropped out to be a moto taxi (zémidjan) driver in order to support his family. His plan is to have the funds to acquire his own moto, so that he can avoid excessive exploitation and to have the peace of mind to support his family in a positive way. He is requesting a loan of $900 to buy a moto and also to cover the licensing costs. This will then bring in added income and enable this gentleman to provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Kossi A., né en 1976 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études, il s’est lancé très tôt dans l’apprentissage et par manque de support, il s’en va conduire taxi-moto (zémidjan) afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Son projet est d’avoir un fonds pour acquérir lui-même une moto propre afin d’éviter la surexploitation et avoir un esprit tranquille pour supporter favorablement sa famille. Monsieur Kossi A. sollicite $900, un fonds qui servira à l’achat de moto et également faire les formalités pour l’immatriculation. Ce qui apportera un revenu supplémentaire et permettra à ce monsieur de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a moto taxi for transportation

loans.name: Sibi

texts.fr:
Sibi A., age 55, is a widow and was born in Lomé. She is a dressmaker and has five dependents to care for. She opened her shop in her home and proves by her fine work that she has mastered her business. She is more and more in demand, but financial means are very limited for meeting customer expectations on a priority basis. Thus, she is requesting financial support in the amount of $600 to buy a sewing machine. This will enable her to increase her production capacity in order to better server her customers. Her income will increase and therefore improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Veuve A. Sibi, âgée de 55 ans, est née à Lomé. Elle est couturière et à sa charge 5 personnes. Elle a ouvert son atelier dans la maison et fait preuve d’une parfaite maîtrise de son activité à travers son travail bien fait. Elle est de plus en plus sollicitée mais les moyens financiers sont très limités pour répondre impérativement à sa clientèle. Pour se faire, elle sollicite un appui financier de $600 pour acheter une machine. L’acquisition de cette machine lui permettra d’accroître sa capacité de production afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus et facto améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ahiadéké

texts.fr:
Ahiadéké S. was born in 1947 in Noèpé and is a widow and the mother of six. Being from a large and very poor family, she was not fortunate enough to have much schooling. And so she very early on began working in a modest grocery business going from market to market. Her mother got her started in this, which currently involves going to different inland markets to get different produce (grains, cassava flour, vegetables, tubers, and so forth) that she would then sell back in Lomé, the capitol city. Because of business needs and the persistent demands of her customers, she decided to request a loan of $600. The success of this project will significantly increase her returns, and thus her economic and financial potential, and will scoff triumphantly in the face of her surroundings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1947 à Noèpé, madame Ahiadéké S. est veuve et mère de six (06) enfants. Issue d’une famille très pauvre et nombreuse, elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter et très tôt a commencé à faire de petit commerce de denrées alimentaires de marché en marché. Initiée par sa mère, elle se rend actuellement sur différents marchés intérieurs et se procure de différentes denrées alimentaires (céréales, farine de manioc, légumes, tubercules et autres) qu’elle vienne vendre sur place à Lomé. Pour les besoins de ses activités et à la demande persistante de ses clients, elle décide de solliciter un crédit de $600. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera sensiblement son rendement et par conséquent son potentiel économique et financier qui raillerons sur son environnement.

loans.use: Commerce in grains, vegetables, and tubers

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma is 39 years old and has 4 children. Her husband’s profession as a mason leads to periods during which he is unemployed. This situation led Norma to decide to open a small grocery store in her home, thanks to a small loan from Manuela Ramos. Given that the nearest market is 5 km. away, Norma also sells vegetables and other basic foodstuffs.

Her loan (which will be canceled in four months) will help her purchase supplies such as cooking oil, milk, rice, sugar, potatoes, onions and beverages.

Norma is very proud that her business is helping her to meet living expenses, as well as to be able to provide her products to other housewives in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al BC Santa Rosa, del A.H. San Juan Bautista Mz A Lt 20 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es albañil, a veces tiene trabajo y otras veces no, dada esta situación Norma decidió poner una bodega en su casa gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos. Dado que el mercado mas cercano esta a 5 km. también vende verduras y productos de pan llevar (primera necesidad). Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 667.00 aprox.), que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 caja de aceite, 2 cajas de leche, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 1 saco de papa, medio saco de cebolla, y 3 cajas de gaseosa. Ella esta muy contenta contar con negocio que le permite cubrir las necesidades de su casa así como brindar este servicio a amas de casa de la zona.

loans.use: Purchase basic food necessities for small grocery store.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
Emilda is 58 years old and has nine children. Her husband’s occupation driving a fishing boat does not alone generate enough income to support the family. Therefore Emilda, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, decided to open a small stand from which to sell cookies and sweets. She now has a small store, which she runs with the help of her children. They rise at 4:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast, and then tend to the store. Her older children are now financially independent, but never forget the sacrifices their mother made for them. With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos (approx. $833USD), which will be repaid in four months, she would like to expand her business and purchase goods such as milk, rice, sugar, soda and cooking oil. Emilda is very happy to have nine healthy children and to have been able to help them with their studies. The older ones already have their own families, but the younger ones are still in need of educations.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Emilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa, A. H. San Juan Bautista Mz A Lt 14 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 9 hijos, su esposo es motorista de lanchas de pescar, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Emilda, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño puesto para la venta de galletas y golosinas. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega, la misma que atiende junto a sus hijos, se levantan a las 4.00 am. para hacer el desayuno y después poder atender la bodega, sus hijos mayores ya se independizaron económicamente pero nunca olvidan el gran sacrificio que hace su madre por ellos. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500 (US$ 833.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 1 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa y 1 bidón de aceite. Emilda esta muy contenta de tener a sus 9 hijos sanos y haber logrado que terminen sus estudios. Los mayores ya tienen familia pero aun falta educar a los más pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase products/goods for grocery store.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
Salamatou T. (née Y.) was born in 1964 in Atakpamé. She is married and has five people to look after. Overburdened with household expenses, which she alone bears, she would like to acquire on credit some supplies (flour, oil, charcoal, etc.) for her business selling beignets (a kind of doughnut). Since she does not have the operating capital, she cannot pay her debts at day's end nor replenish her supplies for production the next day. A courageous and energetic business woman, she worries that, due to a lack of funds, her children may have to abandon their schooling and become delinquents. To strengthen her production capacity and to avoid buying on credit anymore, she is requesting financial support in the amount of $700, which would enable her to improve her income, her family's living conditions, and the means for her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1964 à Atakpamé, madame Salamatou Y. épse T. est mariée et a à sa charge cinq (05) personnes. Se trouvant écrasée par les charges de son ménage, qu’elle supporte seule ; se procure à crédit des intrants pour son activité de vente de beignets (farine de blé, huile, charbon de bois et autres) puisqu’elle ne dispose pas assez d’un fonds de roulement et enfin de journée paie ses dettes et reprend en retour d’autres intrants pour le lendemain. Courageuse et dynamique dans ces activités, elle craint que ses enfants abandonnent l’école faute de moyens et devenir des délinquants. Pour renforcer sa capacité et ne plus acheter à crédit, madame Salamatou Y. épse T. sollicite un appui financier de $700. Cela lui permettrait d’améliorer son revenu, les conditions de vie de toute la famille et surtout assurer l’éducation des enfants.

loans.use: To buy flour and oil for making beignets

loans.name: Evéwonou

texts.fr:
Ms. Evéwonou A. was born in 1962 in Tsévié, in the Zio prefecture, and is a widowed mother of seven (07) children. Growing up in a big family, she was not able to go to school and thus began to sell foodstuffs to earn a living. To meet the financial needs of her family, she set up a small African roadside stand (“Cuisine Africaine”) to sell foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of $1000 that will serve as working capital to buy a large stock of corn, root vegetables and other cooking ingredients in order to make a consistent profit. This new loan will generate additional income and will allow her to meet her family’s needs with dignity.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Evéwonou A. née en 1962 à Tsévié dans la préfecture de Zio est veuve et mère de sept (07) enfants. Issue d’une famille nombreuse, elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études et a commencé à petit coup la vente des denrées alimentaires. Voyant la charge financière de sa famille, elle a su installer au bord de la route un petit bar Africain pour la vente des denrées alimentaires consommables (Cuisine Africaine). Elle sollicite $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de roulement pour un stock important de maïs, de tubercules et d’autres intrants pour la cuisine pour en tirer une marge bénéficiaire consistante. Ce nouveau crédit apportera également un revenu supplémentaire et subvenir dignement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and fish for her restaurant

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ms. Ana Patricia, single mother of three, had a job that didn’t bring her much income in order to care for her children, so she began selling food among her neighbors in order to better provide for her children and in this way, little by little, she began her own food business and increased her income. She also took advantage of this opportunity to sell seasonal clothing to her clients. Thanks to this activity she has been able to pay for her children to attend school.

However, Ana Patricia continues to struggle in order to move her children ahead and it is for this reason that she is asking for a loan of $300 dollars to be reimbursed in a 6 month period. With this money Ana will be able to buy a stove and other items in order to offer items sold during a local holiday called “The Day of the Dead” for her clients. With your help, Ana Patricia will be able to have materials to sell and in turn pay for her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana Patricia madre soltera de tres hijos, tenía un trabajo que no le dejaba muchos ingresos como para poder mantener a sus hijos así que empezó vendiendo comida entre sus vecinas para poder mantenerlos y así se estableció poco a poco como un negocio de comidas, e incrementando sus ventas y además aprovechó para ofrecer entre sus clientes ropa de temporada. Gracias a esta actividad a podido costearles hasta hoy los estudios a sus hijos.

Sin embargo Ana Patricia sigue luchando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y por lo tanto hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, Y con este dinero Ana podrá comprar una estufa y enseres para poder ofrecer el día de muertos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ana Patricia podrá tener material para vender y así poder pagar los gastos de su hijo.

loans.use: Buy a stove in order to sell more varieties of food

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr:
Ms. Akouwa A. was born February 19, 1975 in Lomé. She is single and a secretary in a cyber café. She also takes care of two (02) other people. With her small salary, she is not able to honor her responsibilities. To meet all of her family’s needs, she would like to sell telephone cards, in addition to her job as a secretary. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $400. This business will allow her to earn a profit that she will add to her secretary’s salary in order to meet her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 19 février 1975 à Lomé et célibataire, Mlle Akouwa A. est secrétaire dans un cyber et a deux (02) personnes à sa charge. Avec son salaire dérisoire, elle n’arrive pas à honorer ses responsabilités. Pour pouvoir subvenir à ces besoins, elle compte en plus de son poste de secrétariat vendre des crédits de communication. A cet effet, elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Cette activité lui permettrait de dégager d’autres bénéfices qu’elle ajoutera à son salaire afin de pourvoir à ses besoins.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of pre-paid telephone cards

loans.name: Victorious

texts.en: Mrs. Victorious A. is 38 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, Delta State. She sells cloth and ceramic plates. She started her business in 2005 and is applying for a loan of $1175 to enable her buy more cloth and plates for sale. She is a dedicated member of LAPO and is grateful for your help.

loans.use: To buy more cloth, ceramic plates for sale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born June 24, 1959 in Tsévié. He is a carpenter who takes care of four (04) other people. Having suffered a great deal from his parents’poverty, he has worked hard to face life’s challenges. To do so, he opened a carpenter’s workshop in his house. He works with limited means, but he is very talented and his furniture is greatly admired. He needs financial assistance in order to pay for the wood and other tools needed to make and display his furniture. He is thus requesting a loan of $1000 to achieve his goals.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Tsévié le 24 juin 1959, monsieur Kokou A. est menuisier et a quatre (04) personnes à sa charge. Ayant beaucoup souffert à cause de la pauvreté de ses parents, il travaille dure pour lutter contre les difficultés de la vie. C’est pour cela même qu’il a ouvert son atelier à la maison faute de moyens financiers mais ses meubles sont fortement appréciés grâce à son talent. Il a besoin d’un appui financier pour payer les bois et d’autres outils en vue de fabriquer des meubles pour exposition. Alors, il désire un crédit de $1000 pour arriver à ses fins.

loans.use: Purchase of wood to make and sell furniture

loans.name: Nwankego

texts.en: Miss Nwankego O. is 27 years old, single, and lives in Asaba, in the Delta State of Nigeria. She is a professional hairdresser who studied the hairdressing business for a year and then opened her own salon in 2006. Miss O. would like a loan of $400 to buy more weavon, relaxers, and hair cream for sale. She is an  LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell in her hair salon

loans.name: Kouma

texts.fr:
Mr. Kouma A. is 22, single, and a carpenter by training. He does not have his own workshop and thus has to go to those of his carpenter colleagues in order to fulfill his customers’ orders. This is very difficult for him, and he is slowly losing customers. To stop this from happening, he is requesting financial assistance in the form of a loan of $1000 to satisfy his customers by opening his own workshop before they start turning elsewhere.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 22ans et célibataire, monsieur Kouma A. est menuisier de formation. Sans atelier, il est obligé d’aller auprès de ses collègues menuisiers avant d’exécuter certaines demande de sa clientèle ; ce qui lui est très gênant. Ainsi il est en train de perdre sa clientèle à petit coup et pour mettre fin à cela, il exprime un appui financier sous de crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps en ouvrant son propre atelier.

loans.use: Building of a carpentry workshop

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary O. operates a bar where she sells different types of drinks. She has been in this business since 2000. Mrs. O. is 27 years old with one child and they live in Asaba, in the Delta State of Nigeria. She is looking for a loan of $1175 to increase her inventory. A larger selection, she believes, will help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To increase the supply of drinks for her bar

loans.name: Ayaba Déla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayaba Déla D. is married and takes care of four (04) people. She was born March 10, 1977 in Lomé and is a pharmaceutical retailer. She brilliantly manages all aspects of her business and is now requesting a loan in order to build up her inventory and buy essential products. To help the local population and meet its needs, Mrs. Ayaba Déla D. is requesting a loan of $1000.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée avec quatre (04) personnes à charge, la revendeuse de produit pharmaceutique madame Ayaba Déla D. est née le 10 mars 1977 à Lomé. Maîtrisant tous les contours de son commerce, elle désire un appui financier pour faire des stocks de marchandises en achetant surtout les produits de première nécessité. Pour arriver à sauver et à satisfaire la population, madame Ayaba Déla D. sollicite un crédit de $1000.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Tina
