texts.en: Mrs. Tina O. is 40 years old, married with five children, and lives in Asaba Delta State. Her business is selling provisions and foodstuffs. She would like a loan of $800 to increase her store's inventory. She has been in LAPO for 3 years and started her business in the year 1996.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nono

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on February 27th, 1973, Mrs Nono A. has four (4) people in her charge and is married to a mechanic. She is a dressmaker who carries out her business in a bamboo box. This exposes her loincloths and fabrics to the cockroaches and mice, who destroy them and add to her supplimentary expenses. To fix the situation, she is asking for a loan of $500 to rent a real shop, buy other machines and improve the confidence her clients have in her.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Lomé le 27 février 1973, madame Nono A. a quatre (04) personnes à charge et s’est mariée à un mécanicien. C’est une couturière qui mène son activité dans une case en bambou, faute de moyens financiers exposant ainsi les pagnes et tissus de sa clientèle aux cafards et souris qui les détruisent lui créant des charges supplémentaires. Pour remédier à cette situation, elle sollicite alors un crédit de $500 pour louer un véritable atelier, acheter d’autres machines et mettre sa clientèle en confiance.

loans.use: rent for a dressmaker shop

loans.name: Elvia Patricia

texts.es:
Since she got married, Elvia Patricia, along with her husband, decided to start a business that she could run while he was at work. However, the children and expenses affiliated with the house don’t allow for them to save any extra money in order to start a business. So it was with much effort that three months ago, Elvia began selling car oil and lamp coverings out of her house and little by little their products have expanded.

Elvia turns to you for help in getting a loan for $925 in order to remodel her business and in order to purchase more articles to sell. Elvia is available to pay back the loan in 6 months so that she can establish her business and grow little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvia Patricia, desde que se casó planeó con su esposo poner un negocio que ella atendería mientras su esposo trabajara. Sin embargo los hijos y los gastos de su casa, no les permitían ahorrar para poder establecer un negocio. Así fue que hace tres meses comenzaron con mucho esfuerzo a vender aceites para motor y plafonería en su casa y poco a poco han ido metiendo más producto.

Elvia acude a ustedes para pedir un préstamo de US $925 para poder remodelar el negocio y para comprar más artículos para vender. Elvia está dispuesta a pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses para que así ella pueda estabilizarse como una empresa que puede crecer poco a poco.

loans.use: Remodel business and purchase materials to sell

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Married and father of six (6) children, Mr Ayaovi A. was born December 31st, 1960 in Lomé. He left school in the 5th grade, because of a lack of money. He then began an apprenticeship as a mechanic. Today, he is an auto mechanic and has his own shop on State owned land. He is always being bothered by the authorities and by rain, which slows down his work. He wants a loan of $1000 to rent a shop and buy and sell auto parts. He also wants to use the money to build a tent that he can work under when the rains come.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié et père de six (06) enfants, monsieur Ayaovi A. est né le 31 décembre 1960 à Lomé. Il a arrêté ses études en classe de cinquième faute de moyens financiers et s’est lancé alors dans l’apprentissage de la mécanique. Aujourd’hui il est mécanicien auto et dispose de son propre atelier sur une parcelle appartenant à l’Etat. Il est tout le temps dérangé par les autorités et aussi par la pluie entraînant un ralentissement dans son travail. Il désire alors un crédit de $1000 pour louer un atelier, faire l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées et construire des tentes sous lesquelles se réfugier lors des pluies.

loans.use: Rental of shop and buying and selling parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary I. is 32 years old, has nine children, and lives in Asaba main town in Delta State. She learned her business from her mother and started her own business in 1987. Mrs. I. is asking for a loan of $400 to buy more provision and foodstuffs for sale. She has been with LAPO for 7 years and thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food for sale

loans.name: Afi  Finè

texts.fr:
Mrs Afi Finè A. was born on December 31st, 1966 in Lomé, in the prefecture of Golfe. Illiterate, because her parents didn't understand the importance of education, she today has a small business selling condiments and fish. Married and mother of five (5) children, the responsiblities of the household are too heavy for her meager revenue. Life is difficult. Her husband can't contribute enough to the household, and she finds herself crushed by her responsibilities and doesn't know where to turn. Despite her courage and will, her household is prey to daily difficulties. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to expand her business and insure her children get to go to school.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Afi Finè A. est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Analphabète, car ses parents n’ayant pas vite compris la nécessité de la scolarisation de la jeune fille, elle mène aujourd’hui comme activité le petit commerce de vente de condiments et des poissons. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, les charges du ménage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes que le maigre revenu de Madame Afi Finè A., la misère s’est installée dans la famille. Son mari ne contribue pas efficacement aux charges du ménage, elle se trouve écrasée par les charges et ne sait plus à quel saint se vouer. Malgré son courage et sa volonté, son ménage est en proie à des difficultés quotidiennes. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour élargir son champ d’activité commerciales et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: buying and selling fish

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Mrs. Ngozi O. is 29 years old, married with three children, and lives in the town of Asaba in Delta State. She needs a loan of $800 to buy drinks, meat for cooking, and a refrigerator for cooling her drinks for sale. She started this business 1996 and has been with LAPO for 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, meat, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Martha Isabell

texts.es:
Martha Isabel M. and her husband, who works as an assistant at a rehab center, had fixed stable income from with both of their salaries. However, one day, Martha was laid off from her job. She was left with payments to make for her living costs and rent. Little by little, with her husband's help, she started to buy some material to make floral arrangements and sold them amongst her neighbors. Slowly, she was soon able to make a business to help make payments.

Martha needs a loan of $375 to buy material to make her products so she can sell them on "Día de Muertos" holiday (Day of the Dead), when many people buy arranged flowers. With your help, Martha will be able to advance and bring up her family as desired.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Isabel M. y su esposo, quien trabaja como asistente en un centro de rehabilitación, tenían un ingreso asegurado con los sueldos de los dos, sin embargo u día sin esperarlo, hubo un recorte de personal en su empresa y Martha se quedó desempleada, con unos gastos en el hogar que tenía que pagar. Así fue como poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo que comenzó a comprar material para elaborar arreglos florales y venderlos entre sus vecinos. Y así poco a poco se fue haciendo se un negocio para poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar.

Martha necesita un préstamo de US $375 para poder comprar material para elaborar sus productos y sí poder tener qué vender este día de muertos que es cuándo más compra la gente arreglos florales. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá salir adelante, y así poder formar la familia que tanto a deseado.

loans.use: to buy material to make crafts

loans.name: Elohor

texts.en: Mrs. Elohor A. sells frozen meat, chickens, and other provisions. She learned her trade for 6 months from her mother and started her own business in 2000. She would like a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more frozen meat, chickens, provisions, and drinks for resale. She is 32 years old, married, and has been with LAPO as a leader of her union; she is a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
I work at night in a “maquiladora” (factory/assembly plant) and am worried about the safety of my family. I would like to add protection to my windows to prevent someone from entering. I am asking for $500USD to add such protection to my home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Add protection to windows of home.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Mrs. Marian R. learned the business of selling clothes from her mother and started her own business in 2004. She is 26 years old, married with two children, and lives in Delta State, Nigeria. Marian will be glad if you can assist her with a loan of $325 to enable her buy more clothes for resale. She is a faithful LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
After working a long time as a taxi driver, Alejandro became seriously ill with spine problems, disabling him from returning to work. His wife, who worked selling secondhand clothing in small quantities, got him interested. Alejandro decided to help wife develop this business and both poured in their efforts, initially working weekends only. Today they have a store that is opened everyday of the week.

They need to buy more clothes that they can sell during the winter season and electrical apparatus so they can increase profits. They are seeking a loan of $1125, which they will pay in installments over 6 months. Your support will help the H. Family make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de dedicar largo tiempo como chofer de camiones, se enfermó gravemente de la columna dejándolo inhabilitado para regresar a este trabajo. Su esposa como parte de ayuda en el hogar se dedicaba a vender en pocas cantidades, ropa de segunda, lo que le interesó a Alejandro y decidió ayudarle a su esposa para crecer el negocio y así con mucho esfuerzo comenzaron con los fines de semana y hoy tienen un local que está abierto toda la semana.

Por la temporada invernal, necesitan comprar más ropa que puedan vender en esta temporada y aparatos electrónicos para poder obtener mayores ganancias en el negocio. Están solicitando un crédito por US $1125 para poder pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda la familia H. podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Senam

texts.fr:
Mrs Senam G. was born in 1978 in Lomé in the prefecture of Golfe and today, has a small business selling rice. She is married and mother of three (3) children. The demands of the household are heavier than her meager income and things are difficult. Her husband, a minister, doesn't contribute enough to the household and despite courage and willingness, her household is prey to daily difficulties. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of $1000 that she will use to increase her business capital and expand her business.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Senam G. est née en 1978 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe et a aujourd’hui un petit commerce de vente de riz. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et les charges du ménage devenant plus lourdes que le maigre revenu de Madame Senam G., la misère s’est installée dans la famille. Son mari, pasteur, ne contribue pas efficacement aux charges du ménage et malgré son courage et sa volonté son ménage est en proie à des difficultés quotidiennes. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qu’elle utilisera pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et étendre ainsi son activité.

loans.use: buying and selling of bags of rice

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana O. is asking for a loan amount of $400 to buy more provisions to sell in her food store, which she keeps obsessively organized. Mrs. O. started her business in 2004 and has been running it for 3 years. She is 40 years old, married with seven children, and lives in Asaba in Delta State. She is a good client of LAPO.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her food store

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr:
Born June 1st, 1977 in Lomé in the prefecture of Golfe, Miss Irène D. is a young, dynamic and dedicated hairdresser. She wants to enlarge her shop and add the sale of beauty products and highlights, something that her clients are asking for. Faced with financial difficulties, she has been unable to realize her dream. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to satisfy her clients and attract new ones. It will also to improve her standard of living. :

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 1er juin 1977 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Mlle Irène D. est une jeune coiffeuse très dynamique et dévouée. Elle veut agrandir son atelier et ajouter à la coiffure la vente de mèches et de produits de beauté qui lui ait tant demander par sa clientèle. Mais confronter à des difficultés financières, elle n’arrive pas à les réaliser. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 pour satisfaire la clientèle et attirer d’autres dans un premier temps et aussi améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Buying and selling beauty products and highlights

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
My house is small and I would like to build a room in the back so as to provide more space for my children. Generally those homes that receive a social interest are quite small and we are a family of four. I ask for $500 dollars in order to build another room onto my home.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi casa es muy pequeña y me gustaría construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás y asi darles más espacio a mis hijos, generalmente las casas de interés social son muy chicas y nosotros somos 4 de familia”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para constuir un cuarto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. is 40 years old and lives in Asaba in Delta State. She is married and has one child. Grace started her business in 2005 and now would like a loan of $1175 to enable her buy more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for resale

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana S., recently widowed, comments that her late husband passed away from a heart failure without any previous signs of illness. After the terrible loss, she worked to support herself and make payments. San Juana makes tamales (Mexican dish that is like a burrito or wrap with various types of fillings) and sells them amongst acquaintances and neighbors, but her profits from tamales are enough to only sustain herself, not to grow her business. She is seeking a loan of $150, which she will pay back in installments over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy raw ingredients so she can make more tamales to sell. San Juana is grateful for your help in her struggle to progress and endure the pain that she is undergoing.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

San Juana S., enviudó recientemente, comenta que su esposo falleció de un paro cardiaco sin antecedentes de malestar, después de la terrible pérdida, se apoyó en el trabajo para salir adelante, y para pagar sus gastos, San Juana elabora tamales para vender entre sus familiares y vecinos, pero las ganancias de los tamales sólo le alcanzan para mantenerse y no le da oportunidad para crecer su negocio. Ella está pidiendo ayuda con un crédito de US $150 en un plazo de cuatro meses para poder comprar más mercancía y así hacer más tamales para vender. San Juana te agradece que le ayudes en su lucha por salir adelante y sobrellevar esta terrible pérdida que está sufriendo.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
A retailer of grocery products, Mrs. Amivi H. was born in Lome in the Gulf prefecture on November 12th, 1977. Married and the mother of three children, she has many responsibilities that she is unable to meet because her business is so small. She is also in charge of most of the household expenses because her husband's income as an accountant is insufficient. She is thus seeking a $1000 loan to build a stand and to expand her business; additional profit will allow her to improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse de produits alimentaires, Madame Amivi H. est née à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe le 12 novembre 1977. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a beaucoup de charges qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son commerce et aussi des charges du ménage dont elle règle la grande partie car les revenus de son mari comptable dans une société privée, ne suffisent pas. Elle sollicite ainsi un appui financier de $1000 pour construire un kiosque et agrandir son commerce et tirer de un bénéfice pouvant lui permettre d’améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Construction of a retail stand and stocking of grocery products

loans.name: Alougba

texts.fr:
A 70-year old widow, Mrs. Alougba A. was born in Kbéta Koda. Very early she began selling cakes and juice that she produced herself mixed with cold water in order to meet the needs of her five children. She buys the basic ingredients for these items on credit which she reimburses after her sales. She is now seeking a $1000 loan to stock enough wheat flour and oil to meet the ever-growing demand of her customers on time. This will significantly increase her income for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve et âgée de 70 ans, madame Alougba A. est née à Kéta Koda. Elle s’est lancée très tôt dans la vente de gâteau, du jus qu’elle prépare elle-même ajouté à l’eau glacée pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq enfants. Elle achète à crédit les matières premières dont elle a besoin pour la fabrication de ces produits qu’elle rembourse après la vente. Elle sollicite alors un prêt de $1000 pour pouvoir faire un stock suffisant de farine de blé et d'huile, et satisfaire à temps les demandes sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle. Ceci augmentera considérablement ses revenus pour un bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour and oil

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr:
Born May 6th, 1973 in Lome in the Gulf prefecture, Mrs. Koko L. is a seamstress and the married mother of two children. She didn't have the opportunity to pursue her studies and instead learned to sew to survive. With only one machine that isn't in good condition, she isn't able to quickly make clothing for her customers. She is therefore seeking a $1000 loan to acquire new sewing machines and other equipment that will facilitate her work.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 06 mai 1973 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe et couturière de profession, madame Koko L. est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle n’a pas eu l’opportunité de poursuivre ses études et apprit la couture pour pouvoir survivre. Avec sa seule machine qui n’est pas aussi en bon état, elle n’arrive pas à confectionner rapidement les habits pour ses clients. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt de $1000 pour acquérir de nouvelles machines à coudre et d’autres outils de travail qui lui faciliterait le travail.

loans.use: Purchase of new sewing machines

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Married to a retailer, Mr. Kokou ABBOSSOU-SESSOU is a driver and is responsible for the care of four children. He was born in 1972 in Lome in the Gulf prefecture. Unable to continue his studies, he began learning how to drive and his late father bought him a van which allows him to partly support his family with help from his wife. The car, which isn't in good condition, creates many expenses for him and for this reason he would like a loan of $1000 to buy another van.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié à une revendeuse, monsieur Kokou A. est chauffeur et à quatre personnes à charge. Il est né en 1972 à Lomé dans la préfecture du golfe. Ne pouvant pas continuer ses études, il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage de la conduite et son feu père lui a acheté un bus qui lui permet de subvenir partiellement au besoin de sa famille avec l’aide de sa femme. Cette voiture qui n’est pas aussi en bon état aujourd’hui lui crée trop de dépenses et pour cela il désire avoir un prêt de $1000 pour acheter un autre bus.

loans.use: Purchase of a van for transport

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Retailer married to a refrigerator repairman, Mrs. Jeanne G. was born in Lomé in the Gulf prefecture on November 23rd, 1964. She is responsible for three children who she cares for through her sale of groceries which she lays out in the sun along the roadside. In order to build a shed and to increase her business, she is seeking a loan of $1000. This loan will allow her to draw benefits to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse et mariée à un frigoriste, madame Jeanne G. est née à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe le 23 novembre 1964. Elle a trois (03) enfants à charge qu’elle nourrit à partir de son commerce de divers qu’elle étale sous le soleil au bord de la route. Ainsi pour arriver à faire un hangar et à augmenter son commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de $1000. Ce prêt va permettre de dégager beaucoup d’intérêt pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Construction of a shed and supplying various products

loans.name: Michelle

texts.fr:
Mrs. Michelle d'Almeida was born in 1970 in Aného in the Lake prefecture of southern Togo. She stopped her secondary studies to learn sewing. Unfortunately she doesn't practice this skill, and has instead begun a small grocery business. She lost her husband very early and was left responsible for their three children. This has been very difficult for her, but with her grocery business she's done her best to cope. Her objective today is to increase her product stock, increase her sales and her income, and especially to make her business profitable. In order to do this she is seeking a $1000 loan.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Michelle D. est née en 1970 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs au sud du Togo. Elle arrêta ses études aux secondaires pour apprendre la couture. Malheureusement elle n’exerça pas ce métier mais s’adonne aux petits commerces. Elle perdit très tôt son mari l’obligeant à prendre seule en charge leurs trois (03) enfants. Ce fût très difficile pour elle, mais avec son commerce d’alimentation générale elle est arrivée tant bien que mal à s’en sortir. Son objectif aujourd’hui est d’augmenter son stock de marchandises, augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu et surtout rentabiliser son commerce. Pour cela, elle sollicite un financement de $ 1000.

loans.use: Product stocking

loans.name: Amevi-Margueritte

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Amévi-Margueritte was born June 11th, 1966 in Kolokopé. Married and the mother of three children, she has been selling eggs in Gbadago for the last six years knowing that the income of her retired husband isn't enough for the needs of their household. Even though she has a good command of her trade, she sometimes has difficulties making purchases. She would therefore like to have a 600 dollar loan to stock eggs to better satisfy her clients. Financial support of this project will increase her income in order to contribute to her household's needs.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme A. Amévi Margueritte est née le 11 juin 1966 à Kolokopé. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle exerce le commerce des œufs depuis 06 ans à Gbadago sachant que les revenus de son mari retraité ne suffisaient pas pour les besoins du foyer. Bien qu’elle ait une bonne maîtrise de son activité, elle a des difficultés pour faire les achats. Pour cela elle désire avoir un crédit de 600 dollars pour faire les stocks d’œufs pour bien satisfaire les clients.. L’appui financier apporté à ce projet augmentera ses revenus afin de contribuer aux besoins de son foyer.

loans.use: Stocking and sale of eggs

loans.name: Daría

texts.es:
Daria, 39 years old, is from the province of Huaraz and is a member of the Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso. She has two children, a 16 year-old who is a student and a second child with Downs Syndrome. Daria dedicates herself to the sale of flowers and melocotones (fruit). She sells her flowers in a market located in the District of Caraz, and her clients take them as far as Trujillo. Her fruit sales take place at a stand she has in a market located in the District of Carhuaz. With a recent loan of 500.00 soles (approx. $167USD) from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in four monthly installments, she hopes to purchase fertilizer and other treatments for her flower and fruit crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Daría tiene 39 años de edad, es del Centro Poblado de Paltay, del Distrito Taricá, Provincia de Huaraz. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso, tiene 2 hijos, el primero tiene 16 años y estudia en la academia y el segundo tiene síndrome de Down. La señora Daría se dedica a la venta de Flores y a la venta de melocotones (fruta), la venta de flores lo realiza en el mercado del Distrito de Caraz, cuenta con clientes que las llevan hasta Trujillo, y la venta de Melocotones lo hace en el puesto que tiene en un mercado en el Distrito de Carhuaz. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 soles ($ 167.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará abono y remedios, fertilizantes para flores y Melocotones.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for fruit and flower crops.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, 39 years old, lives in the Province of Huaraz with a partner and two children. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso. For 20 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of groceries using her earnings to help support her family.

With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 2,300.00 soles (approx. $767 USD), which will be repaid in six months, she hopes to purchase additional goods/products (such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, milk, etc.) to offer for sale in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el Centro Poblado de Paltay, Distrito Tarica, Provincia de Huaraz. Es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes y Golosinas, con estos ingresos ella apoya a sus hijos y su hogar. Con el reciente préstamos recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300.00 soles ($767.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería como Abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, leche, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities (sugar, rice, milk, etc.) for grocery store.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Head carpenter in Gbadago, Mr. Kodjo L. was born January 12th, 1968 in Tsévié village in Zio prefecture. He is married, father of four children, and responsible for two more. He knows his work well and possesses good business and management sense. Although his wife makes some money selling toothpicks, their income isn't enough to meet the needs of their family. Despite his talent, Mr. Kodjo has problems finding capital to expand his workshop by buying wood to build furniture and equipment. He is seeking a loan of 500 dollars which will help him accomplish this and which he will be able to repay in 12 months. This will bring in substantially greater income which will allow him to improve the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Chef menuisier à Gbadago, Mr Kodjo L. est né le 12 janvier 1968 à Tsévié (préfecture du Zio). Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, et deux autres personnes en charge, il maîtrise bien son travail et a un bon esprit d’entreprise et de gestion. Sa femme faisant un petit commerce de cuir dent, les revenus ne suffisent pas pour satisfaire les besoins de famille. Malgré son talent, il a des problèmes de moyens financiers pour élargir son atelier en achetant des bois pour fabriquer plus de meubles et des matériaux. Pour cela il sollicite un crédit de 500 dollars qui peut l’aider à faire cette réalisation et qui pourra se rembourser normalement en 12 mois. Cela lui procurera un revenu substantiel lui permettant d’améliorer le bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of boards and wood

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Gregoria is 64 years old, has 6 children and lives in the province of Recuay, district of Catac-Ancash. She is a member of the Communal Town Bank of Tourism of Catac. She currently lives alone and owns a grocery store which she has created thanks to loans from the Manuela Ramos Movement. At her age she is very pleased to see that the revenues of her business are sufficient to cover the expenses of her home. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of $350 (which she will repay in 6 installments) she will buy wholesale sugar, rice, oil, noodles, and flour to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gregoria tiene 64 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el Provincia de Recuay, Distrito de Catac – Ancash. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac, actualmente vive sola, tiene una tienda de Abarrotes la cual ha ido creciendo gracias a los prestamos del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a su edad se siente bien al ver que los ingresos de su negocio son suficientes para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 soles ($ 333.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará Azúcar, Arroz, Aceite, Fideos, harina, al por mayor para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery items.

loans.name: François Djiwonou

texts.en:
Mr. Francois Djiwonou Kotkpa was born in Vogan, in the South of Togo, January 7, 1976. He is a young man, who after his secondary schooling, sanctioned by the BEPC, launched himself into business alongside his mother. In very little time, he became very apt in this domain, however, he lacks funds to follow through his plans for his business. With as much good as bad and with all of the difficulties of life, he was able to set up a small business selling traditional style skirts(pagnes) in a small market in Lome. This activity is exposed to the elements, which makes it victim to sun and rain. To resolve his problems with his space in the market, he requests a loan of $1,000 to rent a storefront and to expand the stock of his merchandise. At this time of year, the sales of traditional style skirts is very high.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur François Djiwonou K. est né à Vogan au sud du Togo le 07 janvier 1976. C'est un jeune homme, qui après ses études secondaires sanctionnées par le BEPC s'est lancé dans le commerce aus côtés de sa maman. Très tôt, il s'est révélé très doué dans ce domaine, mais faute de moyens financiers, il n'a pas pu atteindre ses objectifs. Tant bien que mal et avec toutes les difficultés du monde, il est arrivé à assoire une petit commerce de vente de pagnes dans un petit marche de Lomé. Son activité se déroula en plein air, ce qui l'expose à tout moment aux pluies et au soleil. Pour palier à tous ses problèmes, il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour la location d'un magasin et l'augmentation de son stock de marchandises en cette période de fin d'année où le commerce de pagnes est très florissant.

loans.use: Rental of a store.

loans.name: Ida Martina

texts.es:
Mrs. Ida is 35 years old and lives with her two daughters. She lives in the province of Recuay in the district of Catac-Ancash. She has been a member of the Communal Town Bank of Tourism of Catac for more than a year and a half. She works selling knitted items (sweaters, hats, and gloves) and at the same time sells cosmetics (brands such as Unique, Ebel, and Avon). Thanks to the previous loans from Manuela Ramos she has built her business and currently has a large stock of cosmetics. The revenues from her business help her to pay the expenses of her home. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of $450 (which will be paid in 6 monthly installments) Mrs. Ida will purchase wholesale threads and more cosmetic supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ida tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijas , vive en el Provincia de Recuay , Distrito de Catac – Ancash. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac desde hace mas de año y medio. Su actividad es la venta de Tejidos (Chompas, Gorros y Guantes), paralelamente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (Unique, Ebel y Avon), gracias a los prestamos de Manuela Ramos ha crecido su negocio, ahora tiene en Stock muchos productos de belleza y con los ingresos ayuda con los gastos de su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela ramos de S/.1,300.00 soles ($ 433.00) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará hilos al por mayor, además productos de belleza.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale thread and cosmetics.

loans.name: Judith Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Judith tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el Centro Poblado de Paltay, Distrito Taricá, Provincia de Huaraz, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que todavía asisten al colegio.  

Pertenece al Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de Abarrotes, paralelamente se dedica a la agricultura.

Con  el reciente préstamo  recibido de Manuela  Ramos de  S/. 500.00  soles ($ 167.00 aprox.), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará artículos variados (abarrotes) como azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, entre otros.  Además comprará remedios para sus cultivos (fertilizantes).

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery items for store and fertilizer.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. K. Koffi was born December 12, 1975 in Vogan. He is married and father of 2 children, with 5 other people under his care. After leaving his internship early, today he has turned himself into Master furniture maker with 8 years of experience in Gbadago. He has en entrepreneurial spirit and a good sense for administration matters. His wife has a small business selling traditional style skirts (pagnes). However, all the earnings from their work is not always enough to support their family. Mr. Koffi lacks the funds to purchase the wood required to create his various kinds of furniture. And so, he would like to request a loan of $1,200 dollars which will help him to see this dream become a reality and satisfy the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mr K. Koffi est né le 12 décembre 1975 à Vogan. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants et cinq (05) autres personnes à sa charge. Sorti très tôt de son apprentissage, il est aujourd’hui maître menuisier depuis 08 ans à Gbadago. Il a un bon talent d’entreprenariat et de gestion. Sa femme exerçant un petit commerce de pagne, les revenus ne suffisent toujours pas pour le foyer. Il a des problèmes financiers pour acheter du bois pour la fabrication des meubles de toutes sortes. Sur ce, il voulait un crédit de 1200 dollars qui l’aidera à réaliser ce rêve et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase planks and wood for furniture.

loans.name: Maine Santa

texts.es:
Maine is 35 years old and lives with her two children. She lives in the province of Recuay in the district of Catac-Ancash. She is a member of the Communal Town Bank of Tourism of Catac. Maine sells food and gives room and board to the employees of the National University of Santiago Antunes of Mayol in Catac. Maine earns a substantial amount, but it comes in spurts each month. She uses the loans of Manuela Ramos in order to pay for her grocery expenses. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of $500 (which will be paid in 6 monthly installments) Maine will buy wholesale rice, sugar, noodles, milk, vegetables and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maine tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, vive en la Provincia de Recuay, Distrito de Catac – Ancash. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac, se dedica a la venta de comida, dá pensión a los trabajadores de la UNASAM (Universidad Nacional de Santiago Antunes de Mayol) en Catac, sus ingresos son muy buenos pero el pago es en forma tardía (a un mes) y los prestamos de Manuela Ramos le sirven para que pueda cubrir los gastos de la compra de los productos. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500.00 soles ($ 500.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará Arroz, Azúcar, Fideo, Leche al por mayor, además de Verduras y Papas.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries.

loans.name: Biova

texts.en:
Born August 8, 1983 in Lome, A. Biova is a single father of one child. A hard-worker and tactful, he has a natural talent for administration and has worked for 3 years in his trade as a mechanic. His parents were poor and he endured a lot to be able to purchase the materials for his workshop (keys, hammers...) This is what prompts him to request a loan of $800 dollars, which he will be able to pay back without difficulties. This sum of money would allow him to complete his project for his workshop and would also allow him to improve his quality of life and to profit from his earnings.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né le 08 août 1983 à Lomé, A. Biova est célibataire et a un (1) enfant à sa charge. Travailleur et discret, il a un talent en matière de gestion et exerce le métier de mécanicien depuis 03 ans. Ses parents étant pauvre, il souffre beaucoup pour acheter les matériaux d’atelier (clés, marteaux---). Ce qui l’amène à demander un crédit de 800 dollars qu’il pourra bien rembourser sans difficultés. Cette somme lui permettra de réaliser son projet et lui procurera un changement dans son niveau de vie et une rentabilité de ses revenus.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his workshop

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Thanks to God I have my home. Still, the area is very small. I would like to build another room so that we can be more comfortable now that my parents, three siblings and I share the space. I ask for a loan of $1,200 to build another rooms and expand my home.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Gracias a dios tengo mi casa pero el espacio es muy reducido, así es que me gustaría hacer un cuarto más para estas más comodos ya que vivimos mis papas, mis 3 hermanos y yo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para constuir un cuarto y ampliar más mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of an additional room

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 22356
Correction due to overpayment for business 22356

loans.name: Juan Cruz

texts.es:
"I have a stationery store in my home. My customers ask me about copy services. I'd like to invest in a copy machine so I can better service my customers and thus, have better business. I seek a loan of $950 to buy a copy machine for my business. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una papelería en mi casa, mis clientes me piden mucho las copias asi es que me gustaría invertir en la compra de una copiadora y poder dar un mejor servicio y por lo tanto obtener más ganancias. Solicito $ 950.00 dlls para comprar una copiadora para mi negocio."

loans.use: to buy a copy machine

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Mrs. Bernardita O. is 48 years old and married with three children. All her children are fully-grown and have jobs. The two younger children and their own children live with Bernardita. Seeing her grandchildren growing up brings her a great deal of happiness.

Bernardita, or Sra. Berna, as her friends and clients know her, has owned a small grocery store for the past 18 years. She has established a regular client base and also receives good business from the School of Mother Theresa of Calcutta that is located across the street from her store. She has worked since she was a child, primarily as a maid. When she was able to, she saved and used her earnings to pay for cooking and baking classes. Later she formed a partnership with the father of her children and rented a small dwelling where they began making clothes. After a few years the two of them divorced, and Bernardita began a new phase of her life.

She and a good friend opened a small restaurant serving typical foods in the city of Loma Pyta. With a great deal of hard work she obtained a small piece of land and began the construction of her own house. Within two years of starting construction, she was able to open her grocery and eatery in her house. This house is the source of her success. Her three children always came first for her and she priorotised giving them their education as well as creating a home filled with love.

Bernardita has asked for a loan to buy merchandise for her store such as drinks of all kinds, chicken, beef, flour and oil.

loans.use: To buy  the following merchandise for her store: drinks of all kinds, chicken, beef, flour and oil.

loans.name: Eligia

texts.en:
Miss Eligia Rajoy is a 23-year-old shopkeeper in Limpio, Paraguay. She lives with her husband, Mario Pavón, who helps support the family, though they do not yet have any children. Mario runs his own telephone salon, where customers can make calls to wherever they need.

Eligia currently sells clothing; she has been doing this activity for the past three years. She decided to continue with the work her Mother had been doing for many years. Her shop can be found in the local market of the city of Limpio. Her store is always busy and she has been able to acquire a wide variety of good quality merchandise.

This is not Eligia’s only job. She also works in a supermarket. Though her second job helps her support her store and her family it has also taken a lot from her in order to work so many hours a day. For her to be able to give her best, both as an employee in the supermarket and in her own shop, she has had to make sacrifices. This has prevented her from building her business and reaching her goals.

With the loan Eligia will receive she will be able to buy new merchandise including: printed shirts, soccer jerseys, shorts and more. She wishes to replenish her stock so she can continue to grow her business. Eligia’s dream is that someday she will be able to purchase her own house. In order to reach this goal, Eligia continues to work day by day, despite sacrifices. In this way she hopes to give her children a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise including: printed shirts, soccer jerseys, shorts and more.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Felipa M. is 62 years old and lives in Limpio, Paraguay with her husband and two of her children. One of her children, Rolo, who is younger than 20, has a developmental disorder. He has been the inspiration for Felipa and her husband to fight hard and put their family first. All of the family contributes some time to the family store.

For 16 years Felipa worked selling fruits and vegetables door-to-door, and little by little her business grew. However, later she needed to stay at home and care for her disabled son and as a result was no longer able to continue with this work. Today, she has her own small convenience store. She is well known throughout the neighborhood for the careful attention she gives to each of her clients. Through the money, time, and dedication Felipa has put into her store she is a fighter and a hard worker.

Felipa travels once a week to the City of Clorinda to buy merchandise for her store. These things include: wine, mineral water, beer and more. It is to this end that Felipa has asked for a loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store such as wine, mineral water, beer and more.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria A. is 71 years old with six children, all fully grown and independent, living in Mariano Roque Alonso, Paraguay. Two of her children live nearby and visit daily. Gregoria has run a despensa, or small convenience store, for the past 18 years. She has a regular clientele and many friends in the neighborhood.

Gregoria began working in the world of sales when she was just 12 years old. She inherited this profession from her mother. When Gregoria was very young they worked together making and selling hats made from Karanda’y (the local Guarani word for a material made from palm leaves). After this she worked selling common household necessities from a mobile stand. Her husband grew up working in a similar way. Before they met and were married, he worked as a cook for construction workers in the capital city of Asunción. He did this for five years. With the money that he saved from this endeavor and much dedication, Gregoria and her husband were able to open their store. Since that time they have been successful and are a well-liked establishment in their neighborhood.

Today they are very proud that they have been able to realize many of their goals, including the education of their children. They are especially thankful that they are in good health and can continue to be active and serve their clients.

The credit she has obtained from the foundation will be used to buy more merchandise for the store.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Isabelina

texts.en:
Ms. Isabelina A. is 29 years old, married and has two children. Her husband sells a variety of merchandise to other vendors in neighborhoods near Limpio, Paraguay, where they live. Both Isabelina and her husband work hard to ensure the success of their store. Their two children also help in the store when they are not studying.

Isabelina has had her despensa, or convenience store, for five years. It is located in a new neighborhood of the city of Limpio. The store has been very well received. As of right now, Isabelina wishes to improve her store and expand business, which will therefore improve her own life and the lives of her children. She has used the help that she has received from the Foundation to purchase merchandise, especially meat and cleaning products, which are unavailable in other establishments in this part of the city.

Isabelina’s dream is that she will continue to improve her store and be able to provide a good education for her children. She wants to ensure that her children have the opportunities that she never had.

loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba mate (tea), noodles, sodas and other common products.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío G. D. lives in a domestic partnership with the father of her young son who works as a plasterer on an independent contract basis. There are long time periods when he has no work,which makes life very difficult for them, especially since costs for their son are exigent. Despite these shortcomings, Rocío struggles to bring her family forward for a more prosperous future so she can have the wedding that she always dreamed of. With this idea, she started to look for a business to make money and together with her sister, they started to sell shoes via catalog amongst her neighbors. However, she decided later to work independently to make larger profits and soon developed a client base for herself.

Currently, she cannot supply her clients who have placed in orders for shoes because she has no money to buy the merchandise. Thus, she seeks a loan of $250 which she will repay in 6 months. With your help, Rocío will be able to achieve the much needed self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocío G. D., vive en union libre con el padre de su pequeño hijo, que tiene trabajo como yesero por cuenta propia y tiene largas temporadas sin trabajo y por la vida se les complica demaciado, puesto que los gastos de su pequeño hijo no pueden esperar. Apesar de todas estas carencias Rocío lucha por sacar adelante esta familia para que en un furuto más próspero pueda tener la boda que tanto a soñado, y con esta idea comenzó a buscar un negocio para sacar dinero, y así junto con su hermana comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogos entre sus vecinas, sin embargo ella decidió independizarse para obtener ganancias y así ella ir formando su grupo de clientas.

Actualmente las clientas que tienen le hicieron un pedido de zapatos que ella no puede surtir con el poco dinero que tenía guardad por eso está solicitando un crédito de US $250 para pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, para poder comprar los pedidos de zapatos y comprar más mercancía. Con tu ayuda Rocío podrá conseguir la superación que necesita

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
My name is Maria Socorro L.. I work in the production of tortillas. With this business I have been able to help my family and recently the demand for tortillas has risen. For this reason I need some working capital in order to buy primary goods and produce more tortillas. Tortillas are an indispensable form of sustenance in our community.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

mi nombre es Maria del Socorro L. me dedico a la fabricacion de tortillas, con este negocio he podido ayudar a mi familia, ahora la demanda de tortilla ha crecido por lo que necesito capital de trabajo para comprar materia prima y fabricar mas tortillas ya que las tortillas son un alimento insdispensable en nuestra comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of corn meal, salt, lime, firewood and matches.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria M.. I have a small business where I sell popular consumption items. I have worked in this business for 3 years and my clients are my neighbors. The revenues from my general store help me to purchase medicines and also to take some of the burden off my husband with other family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maria M. tengo este pequeño negocio en donde vendo productos de consumo popular. hace 3 años que me dedico en esta actividad, mis clientes son mis vecinos. Con los ingresos que recibo de esta pulperia me ayuda para mis medicinas y tambien ayudo a mi esposo con otros gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase of churros, toilet paper, balls, candies, juices, pills, tooth paste, instant soup, salsas, chiles, salt, sugar, butter, and beans.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
My name is Isabel M.. I'm a business woman and I count on my used clothing business, which I run in my community's center. This business generates income for me to contribute to my home's expenses, and which has helped me stabilize my home. Recently, the demand for used clothing has increased, since new clothing is so expensive, and it is for this reason that I wish to supplement my clothing supply in order to offer better variety and prices to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Isabel M. y soy comerciante cuento con negocio de venta de ropa usada, que esta ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de esa forma mejorar nuestro nivel de vida. actualmente la demanda a crecido en vista que el costo de la ropa nueva es mayor la mayoria de las personas optan por comprar ropa usada, actualmente necesito sutir mas mi negocio y asi ofrecer mayor varedad y mejores precios a mis cliente.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing (children's, men's and women's) for sale

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe is a mother of 3 boys and a wife who desires to contribute to her family's income, since her husband's salary is low. She was convinced that she needed to work to keep her family going; she started to look for a type of business that would still allow her to fulfill her duties at home and earn extra money. An acquaintance selling lingerie approached María so she could refer her to her neighbors. This is how María came to sell lingerie and gain some customers, little by little.

Today, she has a number of customers but María has no money to stock up. Thus, she is requesting a loan of $375, which will be repaid in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy more lingerie to sell to her new customers who are asking for different types. With your help, María will be able to offer more and have better products to sell so she can advance in life. Many thanks!

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

María Guadalupe, una madre de tres hijos y esposa que desea ayudar a los ingresos familiares, puesto que en el trabajo de su esposo no le pagan bien. Convencida de que ella necesita trabajar para poder sacar adelante su hogar, comenzó a buscar qué tipo de negocio le podría ayudar para no descuidar su casa y obtener ingresos extras. Un familiar se acercó a ella ofreciendole lencería para que ella la ofrezca a sus vecinas, y fue así como comenzó a vender y a hacerce poco a poco de clientas.

Hoy tiene una cantidad moderada de clientas que le piden mercancía pero no tiene dinero para surtirla por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito por US $375 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero María podrá comprar más lencería para ofrecerle a sus nuevas clientas que le están pidiendo variedad. Con tu ayuda María podrá ofrecer más y mejores productos para vender, y así ella podrá salr adelante. ¡Muchas Gracias!

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Pedro León

texts.es:
Pedro León left his town 8 years ago. The reason for this was that he was in an accident in which he lost his arm and the time he needed for recuperation was very long, and there were no possibilities for getting ahead in his town. He moved to Reynosa (a border town) and began to sell craft items. However, this business was not enough to sustain him and his family. So, after thinking about what type of business would be best, he brought his family and they began a new business, which was a small grocery store, which has been an important help to the family.

However, they feel it is time to renovate the store in order to help their 3 children get head, since they have many expenses for school supplies and health needs. Therefore, Pedro León is requesting a loan of $575.00, which he will repay over a period of 6 months. With this money he will expand his business. With your help, Pedro will be able to achieve his dream, in spite of his physical limitations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro León salio de su pueblo hace 8 años, los motivos de su salida fueron por que tuvo un accidente en el cual perdió su brazo en un accidente, y el tiempo de recuperación fue muy largo y ya no había posibilidades de salir adelante en su pueblo. Cambió de residencia a Reynosa (una ciudad fronteriza) y comenzó a vender artesanías, sin embargo el negocio no daba para mantenerlo a él y a su familia así que después de pensar bien qué negocio les convendría se trajo a su familia, y comenzaron un nuevo negocio el cual fue la tienda de abarrotes, misma que ha sido un apoyo importante en el porvenir familiar.

Sin embargo consideran que es tiempo de renovar su tienda para poder sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos quienes tienen muchos gastos en su es sus útiles escolares y en sus necesidades de salud. Así que hoy Pedro León, está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos a un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dinero poder ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Pedro podrá cumplir su sueño a pesar de sus limitaciones físicas.

loans.use: To renovate the store and buy merchandise

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.es:
After her father´s death, Claudia Elizabeth and her mom opened a clothing store so they could support themselves. After his demise they decided to join forces to pull themselves through this terrible loss.

Claudia Elizabeth wishes to expand their business by purchasing a stall in the local market to provide for her and her mother as this is their only source of income. This business gives them the confidence to overcome the daily difficulties they face.

They are requesting a credit of US $475 to be paid back in 6 months. Through your help, Claudia and her mom will make it through and will be able to value the lessons that Mr.B. left behind.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Después de que falleció el papá de Claudia Elizabeth ella y su mamá iniciaron con un negocio de venta de ropa para ayudarse en los gastos familiares, puesto que él era el que las mantenía a ellas y al hogar, después de esta terrible pérdida decidieron unirse para salir adelante.

Hoy en día ella desea ampliar el negocio y adquirir un puesto en un mercado de la localidad y seguir saliendo adelante, ya que este negocio es la única fuente de sus ingresos, y la fuerza que les da día a día para superar la dura prueba que recibieron. Claudia está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Claudia y su mamá podrán salir adelante y valorar las enseñanzas que el señor B. les dejó.

loans.use: Clothing and store purchase

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
After struggling for a long time in Veracruz, Reyna H. and her husband decided to move to Reynosa for a better future for themselves and their four children. With all of their hearts, they wanted to bring up their children to be good people. In the outskirts of the city, Reyna bought used clothing from the USA to resell in Reynosa. She initially bought few articles of clothing by pounds, but after seeing the business was profitable, she started to buy merchandise in bulk. However, she had to attend to her children, which threw her business off-balance.

Currently, she needs more capital to stock up on clothing. She is seeking a loan of $750, which she will repay in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy clothing for the upcoming cold season, which is when she has the most sales. With your help, Reyna will be able to buy the necessary merchandise to stock up and celebrate the Christmas festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de luchar largo tiempo en Veracruz, Reyna H. y su esposo decidieron mudarse a Reynosa para buscar un mejor futuro para ellos y sus cuatro hijos que desean de todo corazón se conviertan en unos hombres de bien. Por la cercanía de la frontera de Reyna comenzó a comprar ropa usada en USA para revenderla en Reynosa, comprando por libras, después en la medida en que el negocio le estaba dando ganancias empezaron a comprar su mercancía en pacas de ropa, sin embargo las necesidades de sus hijos han desequilibrado el negocio.

Hoy en día necesitan más capital para surtir su mercancía que les hace falta por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $750 para pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dinero poder comprar mercancía de temporada ya que muy pronto se acerca el frió y es cuando tienen más venta. Con tu ayuda Reyna podrá comprar lo necesario para surtirse y con ese dinero celebrar unas fiestas navideñas felices.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
L. S. went through a critical period of illness. Since he was unable to work at a job which required his daily presence, he also had no dependable means of resources. His friend suggested taco-making as a suitable occupation for him. So that is how L. started selling tacos, initially only during the weekends. Today, he opens his store daily. However, his medication costs are still expensive.

Thus, he seeks a loan of $925 to enlarge his business, buy more chairs and tables and raw ingredients used in tacos. The loan will be paid back in installments over 6 months. L. is grateful for your support that helps him to move forward in life and provide a positive future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

L. S., pasaba por una etapa muy crítica en su vida puesto que se encontraba muy enfermo y por lo tanto no podía trabajar en una empresa que le requiriera todo el día, y por lo tanto no contaba con recursos para sobrevivir. Así fue como un amigo de él se le acercó para comentarle que un puesto de tacos sería el comercio idóneo para que él se pudiera superar, y fue así como comenzó por vender los fines de semana, y hoy abre su local diariamente. Pero el gasto de sus medicinas no lo a podido ayudar a superarse.

Por eso hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $ 925 para poder ampliar el negocio, comprar más sillas y mesas, y material para elaborar los tacos. El préstamo lo está pidiendo a un plazo de 6 meses. L. te agradece la ayuda para que él pueda salir adelante en la vida y poder brindarle un futuro próspero a su familia.

loans.use: To enlarge his business and buy more chairs and tables

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Sra. Justina C., 47, is the single mother of two daughters living in Mariano Roque Alonso, Paraguay. One of her daughters works and the other is still in school.

Justina works as a clothing designer and embroiderer. She learned this profession from her mother when she was very young. However, when business ceased to be prosperous, Justina decided to work in a small restaurant serving drinks and lunch for one of the schools in her neighborhood. Unfortunately this work did not earn her much more than her previous work in sewing. The space being rented for the Cantina was very expensive. For this reason Justina decided to quit the cantina and start a more affordable business in her neighborhood. At that time there was a great demand for a place of this kind, as few other existed. Thus, Justina came to open her copetin, a small shop that sells basic groceries as well as serves some food. Her primary clients are mechanics in the various auto-repair shops near her store.

When she began her business, Justina didn’t have the necessary equipment. She only had enough to buy them little by little. With the loan she has obtained from the Foundation, Justina will be able to purchase a freezer and refrigerator. With these items she will be able to improve the quality of service she offers. Justina is an active hard working person and the money she earns through her copetin supports her family.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and refrigerator

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
In spite her very ripe old age, this very brave woman wants to continue working. She says that her business makes her feel as if her energy is renewed every time. Leoncia is 75 years old and has fifteen children. Her husband is getting old and can no longer work. Actually, he is retired and is receiving monthly a bonus pension check which is just enough to cover the expenses of the couple. Her children are all grown up and are working in Santo Domingo, the capital.

For the last ten years, Leoncia has been running a small cafeteria within her house. In the morning, she prepares sandwiches, hamburgers and cheeseburgers, and spaghetti, and serves coffee for free to her customers. She also prepares what people call ‘The Dominican Flag’, that’s to say rice and beans. Sometimes, the rice and beans are prepared or mixed; then the food is known as ‘moro’. The moro is usually served with chicken.

This entrepreneur would like to renovate the room where she operates the business and make it more comfortable to her customers. She also wants to hire a young girl to help her prepare the lunch. The loan she has requested will help her reach these goals and keep her feeling useful to her community and continue contributing to the well-being of the couple.

loans.use: To invest in the renovation of the room where she runs her cafeteria.  She'll also hire a girl to help in the cooking, and will buy raw materials for the food preparation.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Sra. Nelida B., 31 years old, is married with 5 children living in Mariano Roque Alonso, Paraguay, near the capital city of Asunción. All of her children are currently in primary school.

Nelida owns a small grocery that she runs with her partner. They have had their grocery for the past 8 years. In that time they have established a regular clientele and the store is growing.

Nelida and her family are living together in a community created and donated for persons of limited resources so that they may obtain their own house. Since the beginning of this project, until the building was complete, Nelida was able to care for her family and begin her grocery store with her own money. During this time, her partner was employed by a private security company. The money he saved while working at this job also went toward opening and running the store. He now works in the store with Nelida and ensures its continued growth.

Nelida wishes to expand her business by also including a section of party supplies and notions. Many of her clients have already requested such items and she is confident in the continued demand for these products.

The credit Nelida is now soliciting will go toward buying stock for her grocery, including: sugar, yerba mate (tea), pasta, breads, drinks, meat and clothing items.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, yerba mate (tea), pasta, breads, drinks, meat and clothing items.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela S.'s mother began her own business of catering food for parties and large gatherings and upon her death, Marianela inherited the business.

Marianela is married and has two daughters. With her business, she helps sustain her family. Her husband works with her, making the food and delivering the orders, thus they have been able to slowly expand the business. At this point in their endeavors, they would like to provide their customers with a more complete service. As a result, Marianela would like to use this loan to purchase tables and chairs in order to rent them out to her customers.

Marianela is looking to rent out the tables and chairs she is able to buy because she must now compete with other businesses in order to regain some of her customers which she has lost as a result of not offering a complete package to her customers. Marianela would like to borrow US $925 and pay them in 6 month installments. With your help, Marianela's family will be able to succeed in their business and thus help their daughters in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Wendy Wise

La mamá de Marianela S. comenzó con un negocio de banquetes para fiestas, y al morir su mamá, ella se quedó con el negocio, Ahora está casada y con dos hijas y de ese negocio es de dónde sacan para vivir. El esposo le ayuda en la elaboración y distribución de los banquetes. Por lo tanto han podido crecer poco a poco este negocio. Ahora están viendo la posibilidad de dar un paso más en este giro. Al querer comprar sillas y mesas para dar un servicio más completo.

Marianela está solicitando un crédito por US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así poder comprar sillas y mesas para rentarlas y atraer a más clientes, puesto que la competencia está brindando un servicio completo y ella está perdiendo clientes por no rentar sillas y mesas. Con tu ayuda la Familia de Marianela podrá superar esta racha que le marcó la competencia y poder sacar adelante a sus hijas.

loans.use: Comprar mesas y Sillas para rentar

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga Dure, 46 years old, is married with two children, ages 18 and 20. She lives with her husband in Mariano Roque Alonso. One of her daughters is studying to be a kindergarten teacher and the other is still in high school. In the past, Olga worked as a secretary for a local high school called “Fe y Alegria” (Faith and Happiness). After many years, the school was forced to let her go. However, Olga was lucky enough to receive some severance pay. With this money Olga decided to open her “librería”, a shop selling school supplies, notebooks, pens, pencils and other office necessities. She began by selling these items out of her house, but after one year of business felt she was able to build a shop across from her house.

Her dream is that people will regard her store as the best of its kind, always well-stocked with whatever they need, so they can get what they want when they want. She has already established many clients in her community, mostly from the three high schools in her zone. The loan she has requested would allow her to keep her business healthy and growing.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies, notebooks, pens, pencils and other office necessities.

loans.name: Fatima Yesenia

texts.es:
Fatima is married and has three children. Her husband travels constantly due to his job as a truck driver. As a result of his job, and the long periods of time in which he was absent from the home, Fatima found it difficlut to receive the money he would send while he was away, and which they used to survive. Three years ago, Fatima decided she would sell shoes, in order to avoid the troubles of not having money during her husband's absence. Like most businesses, some times she has work and others she does not.

Currently, Fatima is low on inventory due to her lack of money to invest in her business. Because of this, Fatima would like to borrow US $525 to re-pay in 6 month installments, in order to have a better selection for her clients and to place orders some clients have made. With your help, Fatima will be able to help her family with their expenses and help her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Wendy Wise

Fátima está casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo viaja constantemente puesto que trabaja como trailero. Y el hecho de que el señor se encuentra fuera de la ciudad por días semanas y en ocasiones por meses, a Fátima se le complica mucho estar recibiendo el dinero que a él le pagan y con el que normalmente sobrevivían. Pero un día con las necesidades que pasaban al no estar su esposo, decidió vender zapatos por catálogo, lo que viene haciendo los últimos 3 años sin embargo y como todos los negocios en unas ocasiones hay mucho trabajo y en otras no.

Actualmente Fátima se encuentra en una baja en su comercio, puesto que no cuenta con dinero para invertir en el negocio y en visitar clientes, por lo que hoy está solicitando un crédito de US $ 525 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses para poder surtir de mercancía y comprar algunos pedidos que le han hecho con tu ayuda Fátima podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudará a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of shoes for the coming season

loans.name: Bertha Yannet

texts.es:
Bertha's husband works in transportation as a truck driver, and so he's travelling constantly. The income that he earns is divided among various expenses. Upon seeing the need from her household, since that at times they don't meet all the requests of their children, she decided to begin selling shoes through a catalog and forming a clientel.

Presently, one of her acquaintances is offering to sell her a small local grocery shop, which excites Bertha, since she needs to have stability in her business and not make expenses for transportation. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $575 US dollars to pay back over a period of six months. With this loan Bertha will be able to take advantage of this great opportunity that has been presented to her. Bertha greatly appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El esposo de Bertha trabaja en el transporte como camionero, así que él viaja constantemente, por lo tanto los ingresos que adquiere el esposo se ven divididos con los gastos que tiene cada uno. Y al ver la necesidad que tienen en su casa, puesto que a veces no les alcanzaba para los materiales de uno de sus hijos, decidió ponerse a vender zapatos por catálogo y así fue haciendo clientela.

Actualmente entre una de las conocidas le ofrecieron el traspaso de un local de abarrotes, lo que entusiasmó a Bertha, ya que ella necesita tener estabilidad en su negocio y no gastar en el transporte, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $ 575 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con esto Bertha podrá aprovechar la gran oportunidad que se le está presentando. Bertha agradece mucho por tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy business space at a local grocery store

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Sr. Simon D. is a married, 68 year old with three sons. Mr. D. remains active and is thankful that he was able to open his store and that he can put his youngest son through school. His store is well-stocked and well-managed. He also charters a truck so that he can bring in a little extra money each month. This extra income allows Mr. D. to better his own well-being as well as that of his family.

It is Mr. D.’s dream to one day be able to expand his shop further, making it the largest in the area with any kind of grocery or household item desired. He wishes to include clothing and shoes in addition to typical grocery items.

The loan that Mr. D. has requested will allow him to buy the items most heavily demanded in his store, including: milk, yerba mate (tea), breads, rice and pasta.

loans.use: To purchase milk, yerba mate (tea), breads, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Elvia Lorena

texts.es:
Elvia Lorena is married and has one daughter and one son who are still young students. Her husband works as a maintenance technician. Since his salary is just enough to live on, Elvia started a business selling clothes and toys in the open markets of their community. She has made a little money to help her family move forward.

Currently, she is seeking a loan of $375, which she will repay in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy inventory like winter apparel for children and holiday gifts and toys, as Christmas is her busiest season. With your help, Elvira will be able to buy these products to sell and use her income to buy toys for her own children, who believe that Santa Claus will deliver their presents this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvia Lorena está casada y tiene una niña y un niño estudiando, su esposo trabaja como técnico en mantenimiento, y le sueldo que gana lo les alcanza para parar todos los gastos de la casa, así que Elvia comenzó a vender ropa y juguetes en mercados rodantes que hay en su municipio, y así ha ido sacando un poco de dinero para sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito por US $375 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero poder comprar conjuntos de invierno para niños y arreglos y juguetes de navidad, para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecer, puesto que Navidad es la época en que más productos puede vender. Con tu ayuda Elvia podrá comprar algo para vender y con las ganancias poder comprarle el juguete que sus hijos le pidieron para que santa Claus se los traiga esta navidad.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula, 39, is a very wise, practical and positive woman. She is known in her village for her sympathy and her smile that shines light on everyone who approaches her. She lives with her husband (currently unemployed) and her well-loved 10 year-old daughter.

Paula has always had a truly responsible attitude with regard to her family. Immediately after her husband lost his job, she got her act together and tried to find a way to financially support the family. First, she started a small cafeteria which she operates early in the morning, and at night. She serves bananas with boiled or fried eggs, boiled manioc, mangú (a purée of boiled plantains) which is a much appreciated dish by people. She also prepares natural fruit juices and at night, she sells empanadas and some typical Dominican hamburgers.

Recently, eager to increase her income, Paula received from our organization a loan which she repaid in the due time. She invested the loan in the purchase of bulk clothing which she sold in her community. She could make a profit from that activity. Now, this entrepreneur has requested a loan to buy a larger amount of clothes so that she can considerably increase her sales volume. Profits made from her business will help her handily repay the loan and keep doing her exceptional best for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of clothing in bulk to increase her sales volume and make more profit from her business.

loans.name: Ligia Margarita

texts.es:
Ligia Margarita is one of the many widows who lose their way in life when they are faced with the sudden loss of their husband. She has no children for whom to keep pulling forward and is now dealing with a severe depression. With the help of her family, and more specifically of a cousin of hers, Ligia started selling clothes to give herself an occupation and a source of income.

Ligia is requesting a loan of $425 and is committed to returning the loan within 5 months. The money will allow her to purchase clothing for the fall-winter season. With your help, Ligia will be able to overcome her loss through hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Ligia Margarita, es una de tantas mujeres que al enviudar, se les pierde el camino de la vida, desgraciadamente al perder a su esposo no tuvo alguien por quién salir adelante, puesto que no tiene hijos, y entró en una gran depresión, pero con la ayuda de sus familiares y en especial de una prima, Ligia, comenzó a vender ropa para poder tener algo en qué ocuparse, y actualmente a eso se dedica.

Ligia está pidiendo un préstamo de US $425 y se está comprometiendo a pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. El dinero lo utilizará para poder comprar mercancía de temporada de otoño-invierno. Con tu ayuda Ligia podrá superar con trabajo esa gran pérdida.

loans.use: Clothing purchase

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
After her husband passed away, Doña Concepción C. started to do laundry and ironing and on the week-ends prepared tamales and sold food in order to provide prosperity to her nine young children who are all now individuals seeking independence. Nevertheless, Doña Concepción is planning to establish a business in front of her house to be able to satisfy her personal needs as she never was covered by social security, today she has to pay the cost of her check-ups.

Therefore she is asking for a loan of $925, which she plans to repay in 6 months, so she can build and furnish a small food business and that way she will not have to leave her house. Doña Concepción wants to go on feeling useful not having to depend on any of her children and she feels she has the strength and will to start a new business. With your support Doña Concepción can make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.
