Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $300 qui servira à acquérir des pièces détachées pour revendre aux clients.

loans.use:
buying spare parts for his repair business

Achat et vente de pièces déttachées

loans.name: Tchabouwe

texts.fr:
Mr. Tchabouwè S. was born in Sokodé, Togo on May 15, 1978 and is presently living in Agoè. Married and father of one child, he is responsible for two other dependents as well. After his secondary schooling, he took classes in electronics since he could not go to university because of his parents' poverty. His wife does not work outside the home and so is scarcely able to help him provide for their family. Although he has been working as an electronics technician for about 4 years, he has a hard time satisfying his customers' demands because he lacks technical apparatus and his workshop is very small. To remedy this situation, he is asking for a loan of US$ 1200. Mr. S. is good at running his business and also at networking; being able to better equip his workshop will allow him to increase his income and thus better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mr S. Tchabouwè est né à Sokodé le 15 Mai 1978 et réside à Agoè. Marié et père d’un (01) enfant, il a deux (02) autres personnes à sa charge. Après ses études secondaires, il s’est retrouvé en formation de l’électronique ne pouvant pas continuer ses études à cause de la situation misérable des parents. Sa femme, une ménagère arrive difficilement à aider le mari dans le foyer. Environ quatre (04) ans qu’il exerce le métier de technicien en électronique, il a de la peine à satisfaire les clients faute des problèmes des appareils techniques et le petitesse de l’atelier, raison pour laquelle il désire un montant de $1200 pour cette réalisation. Mr S. a un bon esprit d’entreprise et de gestion et aussi de se lancer dans d’autres activités sociales. Cette réalisation lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et assurer les besoins de la famille.

loans.use:
outfit his workshop

Equipper son atelier

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is planning to get engaged with a very sweet girl. Even though he owns a barber shop, he still needs a loan to help him pay for the fees of his engagement. Mohamad is 23 years old and would do anything to be able to marry this woman of his dreams and is certain that his work would guarantee his repayments. Mohamad is driven by a great amount of love which clearly makes him more confident that, in his future, he will continue to be happy both personally and in business. We wish him all the best.

loans.use: For his engagement expenses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Madama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Madama K. was born in 1980 in Lomé and is married and mother of two children. Her husband is a civil servant. After she finished primary school, she began running a little convenience store to help support their family. Her clientele has become more and more demanding but her means do not permit her to fulfill all their needs. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to diversify her inventory and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Madama est née en 1980 à Lomé, mariée et mère de (02) enfants. Son mari est fonctionnaire. Après ses études primaires elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits de premières nécessités pour contribuer aux charges du ménage. Sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante mais ses moyens ne lui permettent pas de répondre à leur désir. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s'approvisionner en marchandises et satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use:
stocking her little grocery store

Approvisionnement en marchandises

loans.name: Siradji

texts.fr:
Mr. Siradji S. was born in 1965 in Bassar, Togo, and is now living in Lomé, or more precisely in the Agoè Houmbi district. He is married and has two children. His wife is a retailer. After his secondary schooling, he went into an apprenticeship and he is now a master carpenter in the business where he works (E2M). He is excellent at his work and his charges are fair. This brings in a great many customers. He would like to be able to have enough wood on hand to make furniture for resale, and for that purpose he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur S. Siradji est né en 1965 à Bassar, résident à Lomé plus précisément dans de quartier de Agoè Houmbi. Il est marié avec (02) enfants. Sa femme est commerçante. Après les études secondaires il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage, il est aujourd’hui maître menuisier de son entreprise (E2M). Il a une parfaite maîtrise de ses activités et sa prestation est sans reproche. Ce qui fait augmenter sa clientèle. Il cherche les Moyens pour faire des stocks de bois pour fabriquer les meubles et revendre. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1000.

loans.use:
purchase of wood to use in making furniture for sale

Achat de bois pour confection de meubles à vendre

loans.name: Rachide

texts.fr:
Mr. Rachide A. was born on November 19, 1981 in Lomé, Togo and presently resides in Agoè. He is a bachelor and has no children. He went to primary school in Sokodé. Then he went into an apprenticeship which terminated with his becoming a master mechanic. He now has his own workshop that he manages rigorously. He is looking for funding to better equip his workshop, and it is for that purpose that he is asking for a loan of US$ 400.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Rachide, est né le 19 Novembre 1981 à Lomé, réside à Agoè. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il a fait ses études primaires à Sokodé. Après, il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage au bout duquel il devient maître mécanicien. Il tient aujourd’hui son propre atelier qu’il gère avec rigueur. Il recherche les moyens pour équiper son atelier. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $400.

loans.use:
outfit his workshop

Equiper son atelier

loans.name: Koffitsè

texts.fr:
Mr. D. Koffitsè was born on July 27, 1981 in Lomé (Agoè), Togo and is a bachelor without children. After his primary schooling, he went into an apprenticeship at the end of which he was certified as a master crafter of pots and pans. His business is picking up with a growing number of orders. His financial resources are, however, very limited and don't always permit him to satisfy his customers' needs. For this reason, this young man is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that he can buy more modern tools.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur D. Koffitsè est né le 27 Juillet 1981 à Lomé (Agoè) est célibataire sans enfant. Après ses études primaires il est allé en apprentissage au bout duquel il devient maître chaudronnier. L’activité du jeune homme se développe avec le nombre croissant des demandes. Mais ses moyens financiers sont très limités pour répondre aux impératifs de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, cet homme sollicite un montant de $1000 pour acheter les outils de travail.

loans.use:
purchase of modern tools for his work

Achat d'outils modernes de travail

loans.name: Abdel Amir

texts.en: Abdel Amir lives with his wife and 3 children in Nabatieh, in south Lebanon. He is a 40 year old man striving to provide for his family. He has two jobs. Mohamad is the driver of a pick up truck. He transports construction material and is also an itinerant coffee salesman; he wanders around selling hot coffee to the people he crosses on the road. Abdel Amir is doing his best to support and take care of his family. He needs a loan to help him pay his children's tuition fees since he wants to offer them the best possible education.

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Abbass Al Hajj

texts.en: Abbass owns a grocery store and all the neighboring clients visit him. Abbass lives in Nabatieh, south of Lebanon with his wife and 3 children. He needs to purchase enough merchandise for his business in order to get enough income to support his family, especially since he was the victim of a work accident while working on his second job in the construction sector. He therefore needs to compensate the loss of income from his construction job, which he is no longer able to hold.

loans.use: To buy products for his grocery store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fruit business

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina, 47 years old, is a woman who is striving for a better life in spite of a very adverse situation.  Her husband died seven years ago, and since then, she has had to support her six children on her own.  Her children are undereducated like their mother.

To earn a living and work on her family´s issues, Cristina has been, in turn, cook, housewife and babysitter.  However, she thinks she would earn more if she could have her own business.  In conjunction with three other women of her village, Cristina plans to start selling clothes and shoes. They will purchase clothing in bulk in Dajabón and Elías Piña, two different border provinces with Haiti where garments can be bought at very low prices. They will get the shoes from Caribe Shoes, a multilevel company that wholesale sells shoes.

The other members of the group are Isabel Céspedes L., 21 years old with one daughter; Victoria Colasa A., 47 years old and a mother of nine children; and Natividad Sirita N., 37, and a mother of two children.

With the requested loan, it will be easier for these four women, headed by Cristina, to reach their goal and improve their families' living conditions. Each of the entrepreneurs will sell their portion of the purchased products within their respective houses.

loans.use: These four women will use the loan to wholesale purchase bulk clothing and shoes.  They will resell the products in their community, each one within her house.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Safarali N. is 42 years old, has a secondary technical education and is married with 4 children. He lives in the Shahrinav region, in the village of Bogiston. Safarali has a sales kiosk that sells food. He has been in this business for 3 years. He plans to use the loan to increase his product selection. His store is located 10KM away from the center of the region and is one of only two stores in the village that sell food products to local residents. Because the stores in the center of the region close early, residents returning from work cannot always purchase necessary food items. Safarali’s store takes into account the needs of the clients and is open until late evening giving residents the opportunity to purchase necessary products.

Safarali plans to pay back the loan during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нозимов Сафарали, возраст – 42 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, имеет 4 детей. Живет в Шахринавском районе, в джамоате Богистон. Сафарали имеет торговую точку по продаже продуктов питания. Этим бизнесом занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На сумму кредита клиент планирует увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Магазин клиента находится в 10 км от центра района и является одним из двух магазинов в этом кишлаке, которые продают местному населению продукты питания. Так как в ценре районов большинство магазинов закрываются рано, жители возращаясь с работы не всегда могут приобрести необходимые им продукты питания. Магазин Сафарали учитывая потребности клиента не закрывает свой магазин до позднего вечера и поэтому население кишлака имеет возможность приобрести необходимый им товар. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product selection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her rice-selling business

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Mrs. Nkechi E. is 30 years old and lives in Asaba, Delta State. She sells frozen meat to people, and is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more meat (beef) for sale. She is married with 2 children, and learned her business from her husband. She has 3 years of experience in this business and is a LAPO client .

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Cordilia

texts.en: Mrs. Cordilia O. is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and soup supplies, by first going to the village to buy and then selling to people in the city. She lives in Asaba, Delta State. She has been with LAPO for 8 years and has run her business since 1991. She needs $800 to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs & soup supplies

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Mr. Anthony O. is 35 years old, single, and lives in the town of Asaba, Delta State. He learned to be a butcher from his father, and started his own butcher business in 1996. He is requesting a loan of $1,175 to enable him to buy cows for meat sales. He is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more maize and fruits for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Due to the fact that her husband was not earning sufficient amount of money to support her and their children, in August 1992, Rosa M. started selling ceramics for a lady where she was paid on commission. When she realized that this was a good business, she decided to work independently and start her own business selling beauty products such as Avon, Fuller and Jafra. Later, she also started to sell jewelry and, currently, she is also selling clothing. She is fortunate that she is able to sell such a variety of articles due to the demand from her clients.

At the moment, she needs a larger supply of merchandise such as clothes and jewelry for the winter season to offer to her clients. Rosa is seeking a credit of $375 to be repaid in four months. With your help, Rosa will be able to expand her small business so that her children can finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Debido a que su esposo no ganaba lo suficiente, como para mantenerla a ella y sus hijos, Rosa M. en Agosto de 1992, comenzó vendiendo cerámica que una señora le daba a comisión para que ella se la vendiera. Como se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio decidió independizarse además de comenzar a vender productos de belleza como Avon, Fuller, Jafra, posteriormente se dedicó también a vender joyería y actualmente también se dedica a la venta de ropa, todo esto gracias a que su clientela le ha ido pidiendo diferentes tipos de artículos.

Actualmente necesita surtir de mercancía así como ropa y joyería de la temporada de invierno para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Rosa está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses. Con tu ayuda rosa podrá crecer su pequeño negocio, para poder sacar a sus hijos de la escuela y estos sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food kiosk business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her small business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. started her business in 2000 after learning for 3 years. She is 48 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more goats for sale. She has been with LAPO for 2 years and she is the Leader of her Group in LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock for her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted cereals and legumes including: beans, rice, peas, green lentils, etc.

loans.name: Matileda

texts.en: Matileda N.'s business is the preparation of meat pies, which she supplies to retailers and schools. She acquired the knowledge on her own and started full time production in 1982. She has been with LAPO for 5 years. She is 60 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy a deep freezer and more supplies.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and supplies needed for preparation of meat pies.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a hard-working entrepreneur from Nikolaev in the central part of Ukraine. She has a business selling women’s dress clothing and shoes at a market in Nikolaev. Lubov, who is divorced with one daughter, depends on her business to provide a very valuable source of income for her livlihood. Now in her 11th year as an entrepreneur, Lubov sells around $6000 worth of clothing and shoes per month and makes about $1100 in profit. Her future business goals include purchasing a new sales kiosk. She also would like to use part of her earnings to purchase new appliances for her home. 

Lubov is a great example of the benefits of private business ownership and the opportunities available to someone who is willing to take a risk and work hard. She has requested a loan from Nadiya Ukraine that will increase her available working capital and allow her to continue to develop her business, purchase new inventory and increase her income.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Aracelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
9 years ago Doña Aracelly started a family business selling food among friends and neighbors and with a lot of effort she saved enough money to buy a small car and 3 years ago she obtained her own stand at the municipal market which has provided her with a higher income to maintain and pay the cost of her daughters' schooling.

But today she is in need of money to buy supplies to make her business grow as the expenses for education have been growing. Doña Aracelly is asking for a loan of $475 to be able to meet the expenses of her business. She plans to repay in 5 months and the loan will be used to buy meat and supplies to prepare the "carnitas" dishes. With your support Doña Aracelly can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra. Aracelly empezó de manera familiar hace 9 años vendiendo comidas entre conocidos y vecinos, con mucho esfuerzo logró ahorrar para comprar un carrito y hace 3 años logró obtener su propio puesto en el mercado municipal, lo cual le permitió tener un ingreso mejor para poder mantener y costear los estudios de sus hijas.

Pero hoy está necesitando dinero para poder comprar insumos para poder sacar adelante el negocio. Puesto que los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos le está exigiendo muchos gastos. Aracelly está solicitando un crédito para poder solventar los gastos del negocio. Aracelly solicita un préstamo de US $475 y está dispuesta a pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 5 meses, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar carne e insumos para elaborar las carnitas. Con tu ayuda Aracelly podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare food to sell at market stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase video show equipment, including a TV set, a new aerial, TV stand, cable wire, six video packs, and a cell phone.

loans.name: Lucrecia Yrayra

texts.es:
Lucrecia is hard working and optimistic, and her charisma and responsibility have made her an excellent seamstress and her work of high-quality. She began her business seven years ago, motivated by one of her aunts who inspired her to study cutting and sewing and gave her confidence that she would be good at it. Lucrecia is a native of Arequipa who moved to Sicaya when she got married, and now lives in her husband’s parents’ house. She is very satisfied with her work because it allows her to care for her little daughter. Through recommendations, she has been able to earn contracts with educational institutes for sporting uniforms, and this allows her to pay for her daily home expenses. Lucrecia performs her work in a small sewing shop in her home; among her many dreams is one of opening a small shop downtown with a line of sports clothing. To keep on with her work, she is asking for a loan that she will invest in her shop and in the purchase of fabric for sportswear. Help this young mother continue on her path to success with your important contribution, and she will be able to increase her happiness and her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lucrecia es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, su gran carisma y responsabilidad en sus trabajos han permitido que ella se desempeñe como una excelente costurera, gracias a esto realiza trabajos de excelente calidad; hace siete años empezó a desempeñarse en esta actividad motivada por una de sus tías que la animó a estudiar corte y confección dándole mucha seguridad de que ella podía ser muy buena en esta actividad.Lucrecia es natural de Arequipa y viene a radicar a Sicaya cuando contrae matrimonio y decide radicar en casa de los padres de su esposo. Ahora vive muy satisfecha con la labor que realiza porque le permite cuidar a su pequeña hijita y ha logrado a través de recomendaciones recaudar contratos con instituciones educativas para que diseñe sus uniformes deportivos esto le permite contribuir con los gastos que genera día a día su pequeño hogar.Su hacendosa labor la realiza en su pequeño taller de costura instalado en su hogar, tiene grandes anhelos y uno de ellos es el de poder abrir un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad con una línea de ropa exclusivamente deportiva.Para seguir trabajando solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la implementación de su taller de costura y la compra de insumos para la elaboración de ropa deportiva.Apoya a esta joven madre a continuar por el camino al éxito con tu importante contribución podrá seguir incrementando su felicidad y satisfacciones profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making sportswear

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander owns a business distributing a very popular food product in Ukraine – sausages and a meat product called kielbasa. A hard-working man with an entrepreneurial bent, he started his business two years ago and has been very successful. He has competitors that watch him and are interested to learn how he conducts his business and does so well. With the booming economy in Ukraine, demand for services like Alexander’s is very strong and will likely increase as time goes on. Alexander is well positioned to benefit from increased business. He has requested a loan from Nadiya Ukraine to increase his available working capital. This will not only give him money to use for operations, but will also help as he pursues his goal of purchasing a new vehicle for his work. We are glad for this opportunity to help Alexander continue building a successful enterprise.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. sells plywood. She buys timber and then sells it to builders and furniture makers. She is married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to improve her business. She started her business in 2001, and has been a LAPO client for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more timber wood to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a small fruit and vegetable stand at a busy outdoor market in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. She has a large spot at the market and tries to keep a good selection of fresh, attractive produce on hand. Before operating at her current location, Anna had sold produce at the large Central market in Uzhgorod. When she decided to move to a smaller market, many of her customers came with her.

Due to the nature of Anna’s business with a high inventory turnover rate, she benefits from short term loans that allow her to purchase more fruits and vegetables and then quickly repay the loan. She has requested $200 to use for this purpose. This loan will help her to continue earning a good income and provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetable inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I., who sells timber wood, is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She buys timber logs and sells to builders and furniture makers. She has been with LAPO for 3 years, and has 6 years of experience in business. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more timber logs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more timber wood to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, who is married with two daughters, helps provide for her family with her business selling inexpensive, small electrical appliances and light fixtures. She has a large kiosk at one of the busy markets in Uzhgorod. Hers is one of the few businesses selling this type of product at her market and with a good selection to choose from, her kiosk is a popular stop with customers looking for inexpensive, electrical goods. Anna has been in business for twelve years, so she also has excellent experience to offer customers.

Anna has requested a short term loan of $200 to help purchase new inventory. She hopes to continue increasing her income and has a couple goals for the future. One immediate goal is to pay some wedding expenses for her daughter who was recently married. Eventually she would also like to make a major improvement to her business by moving to a store facility rather than continuing to operate in an outdoor market. We are glad for this new opportunity to help Anna with her business as she pursues her goals.

loans.use: Purchase inventory items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E. is 52 years old, married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City. She has a store where she sells soup supplies. She started her business in 2002. According to her, if the loan of $475 is given to her, it will go a long way to improving her business. She has been with LAPO for 6 years.

loans.use: To buy more soup supplies to sell.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero A. deals in soup supplies, a business that she learned from her friend before starting her own in 1996. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of $475 to enable her to improve her business. She is married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more soup supplies, palm oil, ogbolor from the village to sell.

loans.name: Rocío Elsa

texts.es:
Rocío works every day to meet the needs of her family, the ones who keep her motivated to move forward. She’s sure that the great love she feels for them will keep up her efforts to succeed her work, selling alfalfa. Twenty years ago, ever since she was young, she began her long journey by working for others cutting alfalfa in other fields. Later on, a woman watching her labor encouraged her to purchase a large lot of alfalfa so she could begin her business without intermediaries. She was successful in this first venture, and this gave her more confidence to continue. Now married with five children, she has managed to integrate her family such that they work together without problems or delay. Throughout her journey, she has faced difficulties, but Rocío and her husband have overcome them in spite of her delicate health situation, and it has never impeded her in sustaining her family. Her spouse helps by raising rabbits. Like any large family, they have large dreams of improving their quality of life and providing education to all such that they can become successful professionals in the future. To do this and to achieve their dreams, they have decided to increase the amount of money they invest in beginning to build their dreams. Let’s help this family with their noble dreams of self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Rocío día a día trabaja para satisfacer con éxito las necesidades de su familia que la motiva a seguir adelante y está segura de que el inmenso amor que le brindan le seguirá dando fuerzas para desempeñarse muy bien en la labor que realiza, la venta de alfalfa.

Hace 20 años, desde su juventud, inició su larga travesía en un primer momento trabajando para otras personas cortando alfalfa en otros campos de cultivo y luego observando su hacendosa labor una señora la animó a comprarle un lote grande de alfalfa para que inicie su comercialización sin intermediarios; tuvo éxito en su primera incursión y venta y esto le dió aún más ánimos para continuar en este rubro.

Ahora ya casada y con cinco hijos ha logrado integrar una familia que trabaja en equipo con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar sin ningún problema ni tardanza.

A lo largo de su travesía se han presentado dificultades pero Rocío y su esposo han sabido superarlas y a pesar de la situación delicada de salud por la que tuvo que atravesar esta diligente madre, no se convirtió en impedimento para lograr sosteniendo a su familia y su esposo añadió a su acostumbrada labor la crianza de conejos de raza.

Como toda familia numerosa tienen grandes anhelos y deseos de incrementar la calidad de vida y educación de todos y cada uno de sus miembros con el objetivo de convertirse en unos exitosos profesionales en el futuro y para colmar los ánimos de sus queridos hijos han decidido incrementar su capital de inversión para iniciar a construir sus sueños.

Apoyemos a esta familia con nobles ideales de superación

loans.use: Increase capital for improving the sale of alfalfa.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is 56 years old, married with 8 children, and lives in Benin City. She has a milling machine for the milling of grains, and also sells foodstuffs. She learned this business from her mother and then established her own in 1958. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She has been with LAPO for the past 5 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy an additional milling machine.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga A. is dedicated to making crafts of alpaca wool, principally mantillas which are very valued outside her community. She has owned this business for 30 years improving her art and is now working with her oldest son teaching him as she was taught by her parents.

Doña Olga has her own stand in the town of Cochabamba, but she also sells her products in Oruro and sometimes travel to Desaguadero. In La Paz she sells in Av. Tumusla, located in one of the most comercial areas of this city

Doña Olga manufactures approximately 50 alpaca wool mantillas per week, but ocassionaly the demand is higher. For that reason, Doña Olga needs funds to increase the production buying more materials and hiring an assistant in order to increase her income for the subsistence of her family. She is asking for a loan of $300 which she plans to repay in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Se dedica a la confección de artesanías en lana de alpaca, principalmente mantillas, que en el exterior son muy cotizadas. Son 30 años que ella posee este negocio, perfeccionando cada vez su arte, ahora trabaja con su hijo mayor, enseñándole al igual que hicieron sus padres con ella.

Olga A. tiene un puesto propio en la ciudad de Cochabamba, pero también vende sus productos en Oruro y algunas veces viaja a la localidad de Desaguadero. En la ciudad de La Paz vende en la Av. Tumusla, que se encuentra en una de las zinas más comerciales de esta ciudad.

A la semana, Olga produce aproximadamente 50 unidades de mantillas de lana de alpaca, pero en ocasiones la demanda existente puede superar ese número de producción. Por tal motivo, Olga precisa de capital para poder incrementar su producción, mediante la compra de materia prima y la contratación de dependientes que colaboren en el trabajo, con el fin de generar mejores ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia. El préstamo que solicita es de $300 y se pagará en 6 meses.

loans.use: To buy material and hire an assistant to increase production of alpaca wool mantillas

payments.comment: This is a "catch-up" payment for this entrepreneur.  Due to an administrative error that occurred during the uploading process for this entrepreneur profile, a number of payments were dropped over the past few months.  As such, this entrepreneur appeared to be delinquent when in fact she was making on-time payments to her field partner in Bolivia, Pro Mujer.   We apologize for any confusion this may have caused, and for the long delay in remedying this situation.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia U.'s business is selling food items and provisions. She would like to receive a loan in the amount of $475 to enable her to buy more food items & provisions to sell. She started this business in 1985, which she learned from her mother. She has been a client of LAPO for 4 years. She is 58 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy food Items, provisions & drinks to sell.

loans.name: Goya

texts.es:
Previously she used to run a restaurant from her mother’s house, but the family had to sell the house due to economic reasons. For this reason, she had no other option than to work in another field to generate her own income.

Goya Y. Poma is mother of four children and married to a public transportation driver. She started about four years ago handcrafting sweaters from wool. She mostly sells in the main markets in the city of El Alto. She also sells by the dozen to distinct shops that sells this type of products. Goya works by herself and is need of capital to acquire her prime material in larger quantities to prepare for the production for the celebration of Alasitas in January. Due to this celebration, it is also the time when the sales of her clothes are the highest since it is the only miniature fair in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Anteriormente administraba un restaurante ubicado en la casa de su madre, pero por cuestiones económicas la familia tuvo que vender la casa. Por tal motivo no quedó otra opción que dedicarse a otro rubro para generar sus propios ingresos. Goya Y. Poma, es madre de 4 hijos y casada con un chofer de transporte público, se dedica a la confección de chompas de lana, aproximadamente son 4 años en esta actividad, vendiendo en las principales ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, vende por docena, ofreciendo a los distintos puestos y tiendas que se dedican a la venta de este producto.. Goya trabaja sola, por tal motivo precisa de capital para poder adquirir en mayor cantidad su materia prima, esto con el fin de preparar su producción por la cercanía de la fiesta de Alasitas en el mes de enero, fecha en la que la venta de trabajos es alta al tratarse de la única feria de la miniatura en la ciudad de La Paz.

loans.use: To purchase material to make wool sweaters to sell in the fair in the city of La Paz for the celebration of Alasitas.

payments.comment: This is a "catch-up" payment for this entrepreneur.  Due to an administrative error that occurred during the uploading process for this entrepreneur profile, a number of payments were dropped over the past few months.  As such, this entrepreneur appeared to be delinquent when in fact she was making on-time payments to her field partner in Bolivia, Pro Mujer.   We apologize for any confusion this may have caused, and for the long delay in remedying this situation.

loans.name: Ikechukwu

texts.en: Ikechukwu E. is 27 years old and lives in Benin City. He sells provisions, and is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to enable him to buy more provisions for sale. He has been in business since 2003.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira M. Calani is an expert in making crafts such as mantillas, aguayos and other garments. She learned this activity from her mother and is continuing the tradition.

Her customers are found at the most important fairs in the town of El Alto, at the doors of the "Iglesia de Gran Poder", one of the most traditional churches of La Paz because of its religious and folkloric connotations which are related.

Elvira makes her handcrafts alone but occasionally she needs an assistant to help out with the finish of her crafts.

Elvira needs capital to buy machinery so she can vary and improve the production and thus increase her earnings getting a better life quality with a real workshop to weave and knit the garments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Elvira M. Calani, es experta en la confección de artesanías en tela, principalmente mantillas, aguayos y otros. Esta es una actividad que aprendió de su madre y que ella continúa con la tradición.

Su principal mercado se encuentra en las más importantes Ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, como también en las puertas de la Iglesia de Gran Poder, que es una de las iglesias más tradicionales de la ciudad de La Paz, por las connotaciones religiosas y folklóricas que posee y que se interrelacionan.

Elvira trabaja sola, y todo el trabajo que ella realiza es a mano, en ocasiones precisa contratar algunos dependientes que colaboran en el acabado de los trabajos.

Elvira necesita capital para poder incrementar su producción, principalmente para la compra de maquinaria especializada para tejido, solo de esta forma podrá tanto variar como incrementar la producción y de esta manera mejorar su oingresos por este concepto. De esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida, estableciendo un verdadero taller de producción de tejidos.

loans.use: To buy machinery to establish a workshop for woven garments.

payments.comment: This is a "catch-up" payment for this entrepreneur.  Due to an administrative error that occurred during the uploading process for this entrepreneur profile, a number of payments were dropped over the past few months.  As such, this entrepreneur appeared to be delinquent when in fact she was making on-time payments to her field partner in Bolivia, Pro Mujer.   We apologize for any confusion this may have caused, and for the long delay in remedying this situation.

loans.name: Aída Rocelia

texts.es:
Rocelia is a single mother who lives her small son at home with her parents. She relies on her store as a means of earning money for the primary needs of her family. Her father helps her run the store now that she works as a clerk in a shop in the city. In this way, she helps improve everyone’s quality of life. As it grows, the shop has begun to need more stock since it is the only shop on the block. Rocelia looks to satisfy the needs of her customers by purchasing more groceries so she can have more and more varied stock. She has great dreams of graduating soon so that she can educate her son better, hoping he will play his role in society without fear and without want. Currently she needs a loan to increase the number of products and improve the small sales shop to reach each of her dreams of helping her family. Let’s get together behind this request so that soon this hard working mother can realize her desires.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Rocelia es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño niño que está en el nido en compañía de sus padres; siempre contó con la bodega como medio de obtención de dinero para satisfacer las necesidades primarias de su familia y es su papá quién le ayuda con la administración ya que ella trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de artefactos en el centro de la ciudad, de esta manera contribuye con el objetivo de incrementar la calidad de vida de todos y cada uno de sus miembros.

La bodega conforme fue creciendo generó la necesidad de aumentar sus productos debido a que es la única bodega en la cuadra que habita; Rocelia aparte de la necesidad de satisfacer a su público con la compra de más abarrotes para tener un mejor y variado stock posee el enorme anhelo de titularse pronto para otorgarle una mejor educación a su pequeño con el propósito de que se desempeñe sin ningún temor y/o carencia en un futuro.

Actualmente necesita un préstamo para acrecentar la cantidad de sus productos e implementar el pequeño espacio de ventas para alcanzar cada uno de sus deseos a fin de otorgarle bienestar a los suyos.

Solidaricémonos con esta petición para que pronto esta trabajadora madre pueda cristalizar sus anhelos.

loans.use: Purchase of greater variety and quantity of products to improve a small shop

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mr. Mark O. I. is 57 years old, married with 3 children, and lives in Benin City. He sells provisions, and is seeking a loan of $800 to buy more provisions for sale. He has been in business since 1988, after learning the business for 6 years. He is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina Q. Limachi is the mother of five school-age children. Three years ago she separated from her husband, and she now lives in a small house with her children. Today Josefina devotes herself to selling a wide variety of dishes, which she sells in two stands that she has in the 16 of July Market in the city of El Alto. It’s been more than fifteen years since she began in this business model: Josefina travels to Oruro to acquire her merchandise which she later sells in the markets mentioned above. At the same time, Josefina sells toasted peanuts and other snacks at parties and folk dances, where they eat a lot of this sort of thing. Josefina needs this money to invest in purchasing toasted peanut and other snacks which she will sell at the All Souls Festival, which is a traditionally an event where she can count on lots of consumption. She will also invest it in continuing her dish sales, as these are the only ways in which she can ensure the well being of her children and herself, since she cannot rely on support from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Josefina Q. Limachi, es madre de 5 hijos, todos en edad escolar, hace 3 años se separó de su esposo, y ahora vive en una pequeña casita junto a sus hijos. Actualmente Josefina se dedica a la venta de gran variedad de vajilla, la que vende en 2 puestos que posee en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro, Josefina viaja a Oruro para poder adquirir su mercadería, que posteriormente vende en los lugares mencionados. Paralelamente, Josefina se dedica a la venta de maní tostado, pasankallas, poroto tostado y otros en fiestas, entradas folklóricas, donde se consume mucho de este producto. Josefina precisa de capital, con el fin de invertir en la compra de maní tostado y otros, los que venderá en la fiesta de Todos Santos, que es una fecha tradicional y de alto consumo de este producto, así también invertirá en la continuidad de su negocio de venta de vajilla, solo de esta manera podrá asegurar el bienestar de sus hijos y de ella misma, tomando en cuenta que ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of snacks to sell at a major festival and dishes for sale in her primary business.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Mr. Raphael I. sells wine. He started this business in 2005, after 8 years of training from his master. According to him, if the loan of $800 is given to him, it will enable him to buy more wine for sale. He is 31 years old and lives in Benin City. He is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more wine for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Mr. Stephen O. is 36 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in Benin City. He sells provisions, which he learned how to do for 6 months, before he established his own business in 2004. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $250 to enable him buy more provisions for sale. He has been a LAPO client for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
Hortensia T., married mother of four children, belongs to the Villazón de Villa Association. Before she had a kiosk where she sold sweets and candies on the edge of the city of El Alto, which helped her establish contacts for selling products that she makes of vicuña wool, including sweaters, shawls, and others. Two years ago she stopped selling candies to focus exclusively on exporting vicuña wool, primarily to the Norwegian Mission, one of the most important buyers of this product. Currently Hortensia is one of the most important providers of this raw material, which is why she needs additional cash to increase her export volume. Only by doing so will she be able to increase her income and ensure the well being of her children, establishing a prosperous business she will be able to leave to her heirs.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Hortensia T., casada y madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Villazón de Villa Adela, anteriormente tenía un kiosco de venta de dulces y golosinas en la ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto, que también aprovechaba para realizar los contactos necesarios para la venta de aquellos productos que ella confeccionaba con lana de vicuña, como ser chompas, mantillas y otros. Hace dos años dejó esta actividad para dedicarse exclusivamente a la exportación de lana de vicuña, principalmente a la Misión Noruega, que es uno de los compradores más importantes de este producto. Actualmente Hortensia es una de las proveedoras más importantes de esta materia prima, por lo que necesita de más capital con el fin de incrementar los volúmenes de exportación, solo de esta manera podrá mejorar los ingresos que percibe y asegurar el bienestar principalmente de sus hijos, estableciendo un prospero negocio que podrá heredar a su descendencia.

loans.use: Increasing export volume of vicuña wool to foreign markets

payments.comment: This is a "catch-up" payment for this entrepreneur.  Due to an administrative error that occurred during the uploading process for this entrepreneur profile, a number of payments were dropped over the past few months.  As such, this entrepreneur appeared to be delinquent when in fact she was making on-time payments to her field partner in Bolivia, Pro Mujer.   We apologize for any confusion this may have caused, and for the long delay in remedying this situation.

This is a final payment for Hortensia Ticona. Due to an error in our system the repayments for this entrepreneur were not being marked on schedule.  We apologize for this error, and can assure you that the entrepreneur has not been affected.  Thank you for your patience, and most importantly for your support of Hortensia through Kiva.  We hope you will use you Kiva credit to re-lend to another entrepreneur in need soon.  Thanks!

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith I. lives in Benin City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children. She sells fresh tomatoes, which she buys in the northern part of Nigeria to sell in Benin City. She started her business in 1991 after learning the business from her mother; she has been with LAPO for two years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her buy more fresh tomatoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fresh tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria Q. Mamani wakes up very early each morning in order to prepare her business for the day ahead. Her business is located in the Prefectura area within the city of El Alto. By 6:00 a.m., has set up her booth and has already begun to attend to her customers. Gregoria is the owner of her business in which she prepares and sells breakfast. She offers sandwiches, smoothies, teas, mate (a traditional herbal tea drink) and coffee among other foods. Previously, Gregoria sold food from her booth along dangerous Buenos Aires Ave. in the city of La Paz. Today, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. in a safer neighborhood. She is well known by her neighbors for her perseverance and consistency. Gregoria needs capital to offer a greater variety of food to her customers, primarily hot foods such as sandwiches and appetizers. She would also like to invest in goods for her kitchen such as pots, pans and storage containers in order to provide a greater level of service to her customers Only this way can she ensure her 4 year-old son’s future. He has accompanied her to work since birth. Loan amount: $1000

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria Q. Mamani, despierta muy temprano por la mañana con el fin de preparar su negocio, ubicado en cercanías de la Prefectura de la ciudad de El Alto. A las 6 de la mañana ya esta instalado su puesto, y comienza a atender a sus comensales. Gregoria es dueña de un puesto de venta de desayunos, donde vende gran variedad de sándwiches, e infusiones, te, mates, café y otros. Anteriormente Gregoria atendía el mismo puesto, pero trabajaba solo de noche en la Av. Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz, ubicada en una zona muy peligrosa de esta urbe. Hoy en día Gregoria trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 8 de la noche en un barrio seguro y donde ya es muy conocida por su perseverancia y constancia en este negocio. Gregoria necesita de capital para poder variar su menú, principalmente en lo que respecta a la comida caliente, como sándwiches y bocaditos que ofrece, también precisa invertir en menaje de cocina, como ollas, calderas, vajilla y otros que le permitan una mejor atención a su clientela. Solo de esta manera ella podrá asegurar el futuro de su hijo de 4 años que la acompaña a trabajar desde muy temprano. Crédito: $1000

loans.use:
Gregoria needs capital to offer a greater variety of food to her customers, primarily hot foods such as sandwiches and appetizers. She would also like to invest in goods for her kitchen such as pots, pans and storage containers in order to provide a greater level of service to her customers Only this way can she ensure her 4 year-old son’s future. He has accompanied her to work since birth.

Gregoria necesita de capital para poder variar su menú, principalmente en lo que respecta a la comida caliente, como sándwiches y bocaditos que ofrece, también precisa invertir en menaje de cocina, como ollas, calderas, vajilla y otros que le permitan una mejor atención a su clientela. Solo de esta manera ella podrá asegurar el futuro de su hijo de 4 años que la acompaña a trabajar desde muy temprano.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is a young mother who lives in a little dwelling with her baby and her beloved husband. She began to work thanks to the help of her mother-in-law, because she couldn’t find work and wanted to contribute to the household income, which put a lot of pressure on her and worried her a lot. She began her culinary journey by initially helping in the kitchen with the preparation of the exquisite dishes typical of her city. She learned very quickly thanks to the dedication of her mother-in-law and with the help of her husband, who suggested the brilliant idea of selling her exquisite vegetable stews in her workplace. In this way, little by little she began to see the results of her work and the well-being that her work gave her family. Due to the popularity and good flavor that she offers in her exquisite dishes, she now needs to buy kitchen utensils, just as the most important thing is a kitchen supplied with a gas canister so she can keep her clients who support her daily sales. Maritza hopes that she can count on our support to continue improving her service and work toward progress for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Maritza es una joven madre, habita una pequeña morada con su pequeño y su querido esposo.Comenzó a trabajar gracias a la ayuda de su suegra ya que no conseguía trabajo y el deseo de contribuir con la economía de su hogar la apremiaba y preocupaba mucho. Inició su travesía culinaria inicialmente ayudando en la cocina con la preparación de los exquisitos platos típicos de su ciudad y aprendió en forma muy rápida gracias a la dedicación de su suegra y con el apoyo que contó de su esposo debido a que le sugirió la brillante idea de repartir los exquisitos potajes en su centro de trabajo; así poco a poco empezó a ver los resultados de su trabajo y el bienestar que generaba su desempeño a su familia..Debido a la aceptación y buen sabor que ofrece en sus exquisitos platos, se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar utensilios de cocina, así como lo más importante que es una cocina provista de un balón de gas para cumplir con sus clientes ya que respaldan sus ventas diarias.Maritza espera contar con nuestro apoyo para poder seguir mejorando su servicio y trabajar por el progreso de su familia.

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa lives with her beloved husband and her only son. She supports herself by selling regional food on a corner near her house, which is in a highly trafficked area. Over time, she began offering a wider variety of food, which was eagerly accepted by the public; once she acquired a good number of clients, she moved from her small stand to her house since she could count on a better atmosphere for working comfortably there. Although they have detected a mental illness, she has continued to work hard, along with support from her husband, who is in charge of preparing the meals, and her son, who helps to make sure his mother recovers quickly. She needs to acquire ingredients to make the dishes that have become the family’s main source of income and sustenance. For this reason they are requesting this loan and appealing to your sense of collaboration to help keep the work going that sustains them all.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa vive en compañía de su querido esposo y su único hijo, la venta de comida se remonta a cuando ella se decidió a vender en la esquina de su casa comida regional debido a que la zona que habita es muy transitable.Con el transcurso del tiempo empezó a ofrecer variedad de platos con la gustosa aceptación de su público; cuando consiguió buen número de clientes optó por el traslado de su pequeño centro de ventas a su casa debido a que contaba con el ambiente necesario para poder trabajar con comodidad en el.A pesar de que le habían detectado una enfermedad emotiva siguió trabajando como siempre con la ayuda de su esposo que es quién se encarga de preparar las comidas, recibiendo también el apoyo de su hijo que coopera con el trabajo a fin de que su querida madre se recupere pronto.Necesita adquirir insumos para la preparación de las comidas que se ha convertido en la fuente principal de ingresos y sustento familiar. A razón de este hecho solicita un préstamo y apela a vuestro espíritu colaborador para seguir trabajando en beneficio de los suyos

loans.use: Purchase and stock of ingredients for making food

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
Doña Rosita is 26 years old, the mother of three children, and a long-time rancher. Ever since she was little, she learned alongside her parents, and now that she has a family of her own with Gilberto, they decided to buy two milking cows, despite the sacrifices, to help pay the family expenses by selling milk. As the family grew, the expenses grew as well, and Gilberto had to leave the home to find a stable job. Currently he works as a miner far from their village. Meanwhile, Rosita has continued to devote herself to selling milk, which brings in a good income. They hope to purchase another cow to improve their economic situation and allow Gilberto to return to his home and care for the animals, selling milk alongside his beloved wife and children. To make her wishes come to life, Rosita is requesting a loan and is committed to repaying it within six months. We can help this young couple enjoy their marriage and family love.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosita tiene 26 años de edad es madre de tres niños y desde muy jovencita se dedicó a la labor ganadera, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres; luego de formar su familia con Gilberto decidieron comprarse con mucho sacrificio un par de vaquitas lecheras para solventar sus gastos familiares con la comercialización de la leche; sin embargo con la llegada de más miembros a su familia los gastos se iban incrementando, motivo por el cual Gilberto tuvo que salir de su hogar en busca de un trabajo estable y actualmente labora como obrero en una mina muy apartada de su localidad.Mientras tanto Rosita sigue dedicándose a la comercialización de leche, que por cierto le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos, por lo que planea comprar otra vaquita más, con el que mejorará su situación económica y al mismo tiempo le permitirá volver a Gilberto a su hogar y dedicarse de lleno a la crianza de sus animales y a la venta de leche junto a su querida esposa e hijos.Para concretar sus deseos Rosita solicita un préstamo y promete rembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses, nosotros podemos ayudar a esta joven pareja a disfrutar de la unión y amor familiar.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleuteria, a native of the Purina-Ayaviri community, is a loving mother of three small children. Since starting a family of their own, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to making and selling cheeses, a highly valued product, through which they have been able to cover the basic needs of their home. Eleuteria begins her workday at 4:30 in the morning, buying milk from neighboring ranchers that she will use to make her cheeses and offer them in the market through an intermediary. Her dreams is to grow her business so she can offer her products personally in markets throughout the regions of her country, thereby earning greater income to cover the higher learning expenses that her darling children will soon need. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to do these things, promising to repay within six months. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her keep making cheese and making her children’s dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Eleuteria, natural D. la comunidad D. Purina- Ayaviri es una madre amorosa D. tres pequeños niños; desD. que formó su familia se dedica junto a su esposo a la elaboración y venta D. quesos, productos muy cotizados D. su ciudad, con el que les ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas D. su hogar.Eleuteria inicia su jornada D. trabajo a las 4.30 D. la M.ñana, hora en que se dedica a comprar la leche D. sus vecinos ganaderos, para luego elaborar sus deliciosos quesos y ofrecerlos en el mercado a través D. un intermediario.El deseo que tiene es acrecentar mucho más su negocio para distribuir sus productos personalmente en los mercados D. los diferentes departamentos D. su país y así generar mayor ingresos económicos para cubrir los estudios superiores que dentro D. poco tiempo iniciarán sus queridos hijos, por esa razón solicita un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos y promete rembolsarles en un lapso D. 6 meses.Solidaricémonos con esta dedicada madre para que siga fabricando en su hogar estos deliciosos quesos además D. cada uno D. los sueños D. sus hijos

loans.use: Increase of capital for making cheese

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Her love for her little girl and the desire to bring her a better quality of life are why Nelly continues to work hard day after day. She patiently and affectionately cares for her calves so they grow up healthy and strong, and are able to produce large amounts of milk. Now in addition to caring for them to sell later on, she also devotes herself to making cheeses that she can sell in the market of her home city, Ayaviri. With this activity, she is able to satisfy herself economically. Seeing how much demand there is for her product, Nelly wishes to purchase another milk cow to increase her income and bring a better quality of life to her daughter. For this goal she is requesting a loan that will allow her to acquire a small cow that will quickly improve the economy of her household and bring well being to Sindy, her pride and joy and her only companion.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El amor que siente por su pequeña niña y el deseo de querer brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, son algunas de las razones que impulsan a Nelly ha seguir trabajando y esforzándose día a día en la labor de crianza de sus becerritos con mucho cariño y paciencia con el objetivo de que crezcan sanas y fuertes para que sigan produciendo excelente cantidad de leche.Ahora además de criarlos para posteriormente venderlos se dedica a la elaboración de quesos, productos que luego los ofrece en el mercado de su ciudad natal Ayaviri, trayéndola esta actividad mucha satisfacción económica.A poco tiempo de haber observado la gran demanda que tienen sus productos Nelly desea comprar otra vaquita lechera para así incrementar sus ingresos económicos con el objetivo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su niña.Para esto solicita un préstamo que le permitirá adquirir una pequeña vaquita para mejorar pronto la economía de su hogar y le brindará bienestar a Sindy quién es su mayor alegría y su única compañera.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow to increase production of cheeses

loans.name: Test's Group
loans.use: test

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos is a self-sacrificing, loving father, 64 years old with eight children, six of whom are independent. In spite of his age, he continues to fight to get his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation. Ever since he was very little, Santos has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to selling herd animals, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of all herd animals – cattle, sheep, and alpaca – he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Santos harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By selling these, he can create more income and pay for the higher education and trade of each of his two younger children. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his darling wife María, who always supports him unconditionally in his daily work. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well being and security to the members of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Santos tiene 64 años de edad y es un padre abnegado y muy cariñoso, tiene ocho hijos y seis de ellos ya independientes, pese a la edad que tiene aún sigue esforzándose y luchando para salir adelante y mejorar su situación económica y la de su querida familia.Santos desde muy pequeño siempre ha estado en contacto directo con la labor y crianza de animales y gracias a este conocimiento se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, oficio que aprendió de sus humildes padres y con la experiencia que ha adquirido durante todo este tiempo en la compra y venta de ganado (vaca, oveja y alpaca) ha podido brindarle estabilidad a su familia. El deseo que tiene Santos albergado en su corazón es el de incrementar su capital de inversión para adquirir más animales y con la comercialización de estos generar mayores ingresos económicos con el fin de brindarles una educación superior adecuada y acorde a la vocación de cada uno de a sus dos menores hijos y sobre todo ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su querida esposa María, quién siempre la apoyó incondicionalmente en su labor diaria.Solidaricémonos con la solicitud de este diligente padre para que siga brindándole bienestar y seguridad a los miembros de su familia.

loans.use: Acquisition of more animals for sales

loans.name: Waldemar

texts.es:
Mr. Waldemar is 44 years old, married, and has 3 kids. In his home he has a small factory that produces bricks and tiles. He has dedicated himself to this activity for more than 20 years. Thanks to the business he was able to build his own house and provide basic commodities for his family. One of his best helpers is his son, who is in charge of the purchase of firewood and clay. Thus his son is also accustomed to producing bricks.

Mr. Waldemar's business is doing very well now that it's the time of year when production and sales are at their highest. This business also provides a source of jobs for many of the citizens in the area, generating a dynamic economy. Mr. Waldemar has asked for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya so that he can purchase raw materials in order to satisfy the great demand for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

El señor Waldemar tiene 44 años esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, en su domicilio posee una pequeña fabrica de producción de ladrillos y tejas, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 20 años, gracias a este oficio pudo construir su casa propia, y dotarle de las comodidades mínimas a su familia. Uno de sus ayudantes es su hijo, quien se encarga de la compra de las arcillas y leñas, como así también le suele ayudar en la producción y quemas de los ladrillos.

Actualmente su negocio registra buen movimiento de ventas, ya que es la temporada donde hay mayor movimiento de producción y ventas, generalmente los meses cercanos a fin de año. Este rubro provee de fuentes de trabajos a numerosos pobladores de la zona lo cual genera una dinámica en la economía de la zona. Waldemar tiene pensado renovar su crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de materia prima ya que tiene gran cantidad de pedido que necesita satisfacer.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, clay, etc.

loans.name: Juana Agripina

texts.es:
Juana and Eduardo formed their household with dreams of living in an atmosphere of warmth, harmony, and familial love. The fruit of this dream and their immense love was the birth of six children. Everything was going well in the home until tragedy struck. Eduardo was heartlessly murdered by a band of rustlers (animal thieves) in front of his entire family, an event that has scarred their lives and been terribly difficult to overcome.

With the pain and fragility of their small children, Juana had to work hard at many different jobs, always accompanied by her little ones to earn a daily income. Thanks to her arduous work and dedication, she was able to save enough to buy a pair of cows, and by selling the milk she achieved a certain economic stability and improved her family’s quality of life. Now, many years later, she and her older daughters wish to grow their business of selling milk. They are requesting a financial loan that will allow them to increase their capital and acquire more cows. She is committed to repaying the loan in six months. This spirited family anxiously awaits your rapid response.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juana y Eduardo formaron su hogar con muchas ilusiones de vivir en un ambiente cálido y sobre todo en armonía y unión familiar, fruto de esa concepción y el inmenso amor que se profesan nacieron seis hijos y cuando todo marchaba muy bien en su hogar de pronto se presentó una tragedia, Eduardo fue asesinado por una turba de abigeos (ladrones de animales) en presencia de toda su familia sin ninguna compasión, hecho que les marcó la vida y fue muy difícil de superar.Con la pena y fragilidad de sus pequeños niños Juana tuvo que trabajar arduamente en diferentes oficios eventuales siempre acompañado de sus pequeños para generar el sustento diario, gracias a su ardua tarea y dedicación pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un para de vaquitas y con la comercialización de la leche que obtenía de ellas logró cierta estabilidad económica e incrementó la calidad de vida de su familia.Ahora, después de muchos años, junto a sus hijos ya mayores desea seguir acrecentando su negocio de venta de leche y para esto está solicitando un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá aumentar su capital y adquirir más animales (vacas); ella promete retornarles el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.“Esta familia luchadora espera ansiosamente tu pronta respuesta”

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés comes from a humble home; her father died in a traffic accident when she was just five years old, leaving in charge her beloved mother, Gabina, who worked very hard to get her ahead in life. Now Inés has formed her own family with Vicente, and they both dedicate themselves to selling cattle, a job that brings economic stability to their two small children, their reason for working and struggling day in and day out. They are currently living with her mother-in-law, and her hope is to build her own cottage that will offer a safe dwelling for her little ones. She is certain that with the work she and her husband do, they can succeed in this dream. She’s asking for a loan to invest in her business that will allow them to save enough to build this little dream home. Inés and her husband are committed to responsibly repaying the loan within six months. With your help, they can accomplish their dream very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Inés, proviene de un hogar muy humilde, su padre falleció en un accidente de transito cuando tenia cinco añitos, quedando a cargo de su querida madre Gabina, quién trabajó arduamente para sacarla adelante.Actualmente Inés ya formó su propia familia junto a Vicente, ambos se dedican a la comercialización de ganado, trabajo con el que están brindando estabilidad económica a sus dos niños menores, quienes son el motivo que los impulsa a trabajar y esforzarse día a día.En este momento vive en el domicilio de su suegra y el deseo que tiene es el de construir su propia casita para ofrecerle una morada segura a sus pequeños, está segura que con la labor que desempeña junto a su esposo puede lograrlo, para esto solicita un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y así ahorrar lo suficiente para hacer construir su tan deseada casita.Inés y su esposo se comprometen a retornar responsablemente el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.Con tu colaboración ellos pueden cumplir en poco tiempo sus deseos.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire more small animals.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Mr. Juan is 59 years old and married. He has a small ceramics factory in his home, where he manufactures tiles and regular and hollow bricks. He has been dedicated to this activity for more than 30 years. He has a fixed client base. The loans that the Fundacion Paraguaya gave him permitted Juan to expand his business to a larger physical area sufficient for a large quantity of production.

One of his short term objectives is to buy a 4 cylinder vehicle to transport his raw materials and his products. This way he will avoid paying the costly freight charges that diminish his potential. In order to do this he will need some income. Therefore he is pursuing one of his other projects by soliciting a loan from Fundacion Paraguaya to realize his goal. He requests a loan for the purchase of raw materials in order to satisfy the demand of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Juan tiene 59 años es casado y tiene una pequeña fabrica de cerámica en su domicilio, dónde fabrica, tejas, ladrillo común y ladrillo hueco, esta dedicado a la actividad hace mas de 30 años, posee clientela fija que son los principales depósitos de materiales de la zona. Los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya le permitió hacer crecer su negocio ya que el cuenta con buen espacio físico lo suficiente como para almacenar gran cantidad de producción.

Uno de sus objetivos a corto plazo es comprarse un vehiculo de por lo menos 4 toneladas, para transporta sus materias prima y también su producción, con esto evitara pagar los costosos fletes que hace disminuir su utilidad, para el efecto necesitará de un capital y dentro de su proyectos ésta la de solicitar un préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya para concretar su objetivo. Ahora solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima de modo a satisfacer las demandas de los clientes.

loans.use: To buy firewood and clay

loans.name: Un Nuevo Sol Group

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Cristina, and I’ve run a small grocery store in the town of Alto de Villa Nueva for the last ten years. I need the money to buy various things such as pastries, crackers, soda, water, sugar, etc. With the earnings my business generates, I help my husband with the expenses of my three children. I have my best sales on weekends since the store is located in front of a soccer field; at the end of the game the players come and buy soda and candy from me.

My name is Faviana, and I devote myself to selling tortillas; I’ve had this business for 20 years, and it’s located in the town of Altos de Villa Nueva. At this time I need to buy corn, firewood, oil, salt and tanks to keep my tortillas in. As you can see, I’m an older woman and I can’t find work in my country at my age. I’m married and have two children. My husband works, but he earns very little; with the profits from this business, we manage our expenses. I am grateful for your help so that I can buy what I need.

My name is Martha S., and for fifteen years, I’ve devoted myself to making and selling donuts. I need the money to buy flour, firewood, sweetener, and other items. At this time, I don’t have much material to make my donuts; this lack is becoming urgent now that I have orders from nearby schools and other customers. With my income, I pay for my children’s education and help my husband with our home’s monthly expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Cristina, mi negocio es un pulperia en la colonia Alto de Villa Nueva hace 10 años. El dinero lo necesito para hacer varias compra como: Churros, galletas, sodas, agua azucar etec. Con las ganancias que me genera mi pequeño negocio ayudo ami esposo con gastos de mis 3 hijos. Mi mayor venta los tengo los fines de semana ya que esta hubicado frente a un campo de Foot- Boll, los jugadopres llegan al final del partido y me comprar sodas y golosinas.

Mi nombre es Faviana, yo me dedico a la venta de Tortillas, este negocio lo tengo hace 20 años esta hubicado en la colonia Altos de Villa Nueva. En estos momentos nesecito comprar maiz. leña, acite, sal, y pailas donde pongo mis tortillas. Como ustedes pondran ver ya soy una mujer de edad y no puedo conseguir un trabajo aqui en mi fpais por la edad, estoy casada y tengo dos hijos. Mi esposo trabaja pero sus ganancias son muy pocas y con las ganacias del negocio sobrevivimos con nuestros gastos. Les agradesco que me puedan ayudar para poder comprar lo que que nesecito.

Mi nombre es Martha S., yo me didico a la venta y elaboracion de Donas, este negocio lo tengo hace 15 años. El dinero lo necesito para comprar harina, leña, dulce y otros. En estos momoneto no tengo mucho paterial para hacer mis donas y me urge ya que tengo varios pedidos de las Esculas que estan serca de mi colonia y tambien de otros clientes. Con las ganancias pago los estudios de mis hijos y ayudo a mi esposo con gastos mensuales que tenemos en nuestro hogar .

loans.use: Purchase of flour, pastries, soda, oil, rice, crackers, firewood, corn, and salt.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Nilda is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She is owner of a vegetable and fruit stand in the municipal market for over 12 years. She depends on her steady amount of clients who visit her in the market daily to purchase her products. She comments that this job has helped her husband to maintain family expenses; provide her children with a good education; and to finish and expand her house.

The loans that she was granted from Fundación Paraguaya allowed her to attain an operating capital so that she was able to purchase the products on sale and in greater quantities since prices vary constantly in this sector.

Her goal is to open a small convenience store at her house so that her children can manage and watch over. Hence, she is seeking a loan to purchase the necessary elements such as a freezer and merchandise such as tomatoes, onions, lettuce, oranges, apples, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nilda tiene 45 años está casada y tiene 3 hijos ella es propietaria de un puesto de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal ya hace más de 12 años. Cuenta con clientela fija que diariamente vienen al mercado a comprarle sus productos, ella comenta que con éste trabajo pudo ayudarle a su marido a mantener el gasto de la familia, dar una buena educación a sus hijos y así también pudo terminar y ampliar su casa. Los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya le permitió hacerse de un capital operativo y así poder comprar los productos que se encontraban en oferta y en cantidades importantes ya que los precios en éste rubro varían constantemente. Su objetivo es la abrir una despensa en su domicilio para que sus hijos puedan administrar y cuidar, para concretar éste proyecto tiene pensado solicitar un préstamo y así poder comprarle los elementos necesarios como la congeladora y las mercaderías como tomate, cebolla, lechuga, naranja, manzana, etc.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, onions, lettuce, oranges, apples, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. He is the owner of a store located in his home. In addition to the store he owns a cow, from which he sells the milk and makes cheese to sell in his store.

Today his business has good sales, with the loan he received from the Fundación Paraguay he was able to buy more merchandise to sell and rotate daily such as milk, sugar, oil, starch, tea, etc.

Juan states that the draught has impacted his country negatively, especially with the production of livestock, as the price of feed for the livestock rose and of course this resulted in the increase in the prices of milk, cheese, and beef.

The current loan from the Fundación Paraguaya is to purchase more milk cows and therefore increase the number of beef that he owns, in order to produce more milk and cheese to then supply to various homes and businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Juan tiene 51 años está casado y tiene 4 hijos, el es propietario de una despensa y la misma lo tiene en su domicilio, aparte de ésta actividad también posee una vaca de la cual vende leche y elabora queso para la venta en su despensa.

Actualmente su negocio registra buen movimiento de ventas, ya que con el préstamo que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguay pudo comprar más mercaderías de oferta y de rotación diaria como ser la leche, azúcar, aceite, almidón, yerba, etc.

El señor Juan afirma que la sequía que afectó al país trajo consecuencias negativas en la producción muy en especial a la ganadería, ya que los alimentos para el ganado subieron de precio y por supuesto esto trae consigo el aumento en el precio de la leche, queso y misma la carne vacuna.

Tiene pensado nuevamente en realizar un préstamo con la Fundación Paraguaya para la comprar más vacas lecheras y aumentar así el número de ganado vacuno que posee, para poder producir mayor cantidad de leche y queso para luego proveerles a varios hogares y a otros negocios.

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is 39 years old, married, has three children and owns a hardware store where she sells all types of tools for construction. She has run the hardware store from her home for more than 8 years. Maria says that sales have been good due to the fact that the store is in a neighborhood that is experiencing a lot of growth, where there is a lot of construction on new houses and this generates sales because the store is fairly lucky to have the variety of merchandise that it offers.
