With the loans that the Fundación Paraguaya awarded her in the past, Maria was able to buy a wider variety of merchandise to supply her business. Nevertheless, she says that she’s going through months of high sales when it comes to construction, and she plans on requesting another loan to expand her showroom, as it is quite small and it is impossible to adequately exhibit all of her merchandise. Maria wishes that the economic situation of her country would improve, and that more jobs are created, because the high level of emigration that the country is experiencing due to the lack of work makes her very sad.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria tiene 39 años está casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee una ferretería, dónde se vende todo tipo de artículos para construcción, la misma lo tiene en su mismo domicilio, y hace más de 8 años. Comenta la señora Maria, que registra buen movimiento de venta debido a que está en un barrio en proceso de crecimiento, dónde existe gran cantidad de construcción de nuevas casas y eso genera movimiento ya que su ferretería es bastante surtida por la variedad de mercaderías que posee. Con los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya la señora María pudo comprar mercaderías y surtir más su negocio, no obstante afirma que está en los meses de mayor movimiento en cuanto al tema de construcción y tiene pensado solicitar un nuevo préstamo para ampliar su salón ya que actualmente por el pequeño espacio que posee le imposibilita exhibir adecuadamente sus mercaderías. Uno de sus anhelos es que mejore la situación económica del país y se generé más fuentes de trabajo ya que le causa mucha tristeza el alto índice de emigración que atraviesa actualmente el país, por causa de la falta de trabajo.

loans.use: Buy paint, wire, lime, electric accessories, etc.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia Elizabeth Pérez Rivera is 21 years old, single, lives with her mother, and is an artisan (she makes embroidered items with a technique called crochet). She has knitted wallets, blouses, bikinis, skirts, hats, gloves, clothing for babies, etc. Elivia Elizabeth learned from her mother the art of embroidering with yarn when she was very young. Currently, With her earnings she helps her mother with the household expenses.

She wishes to use the loan to buy a variety of materials such as needles to embroider, various colors and sizes of yarns, wool, etc. She hopes to increase her sales as summer is coming and it is a season of higher demand for items made of yarn.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Elvia Elizabeth Pérez Rivera , tiene 21 años, es soltera viven con la madre, es Artesana (realiza bordados con una técnica llamada crochet, entre las cosas que teje podemos citar: carteraa, blusas, bikinis, faldas, gorras, guantes, ropas para bebés, etc . La Señorita Elivia Elizabeth aprendió con la madre el arte del bordado con hilo desde muy pequeña. Hoy día con lo que gana ayuda a la madre con los gastos de la casa.

Ella desea utilizar el crédito para comprar diversos materiales como: agujas para bordar, hilos de distintos colores y tamaños, lana, etc. Desea con esto aumentar su venta., pues se acerca el verano que es la época de mayor demanda de las prendas hechas de hilo.

loans.use: Purchase materials to embroider and knit, various colors and sizes of yarns, wool, etc.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
Benigna is 36 and the loving mother of four. Her husband, the father of her children, long abused her physically then abandoned her and the children without means of support. Since then she was worked tirelessly making small clay figurines of animals thought to bring good fortune in childbirth. Her children give her reason to live. The whole family helps with the enterprise and tries to put their difficult moments behind them and work for a better future. Benigna's greatest dream is to give her children a good education. She wants to increase production before Christmastime when she sells the most and is asking for a loan to buy clay. She promises to repay it within seven months. Benigna is counting on your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Benigna tiene 36 años de edad y es una cariñosa madre de cuatro niños. Durante mucho tiempo después de haber concebido nupcias con el hombre que se convirtió en su esposo y padre de sus hijos este la maltrató físicamente para luego abandonarla sin ningún amparo económico; desde entonces se dedica arduamente a la fabricación de objetos artesanales, trabajos en miniatura que realiza a base se arcilla (animalitos para armar el nacimiento) con apoyo de sus queridos hijos, quienes la motivan y se han convertido en la razón de su vida. Todos juntos tratan de olvidar los momentos difíciles que pasaron y luchan día a día para salir adelante.El mayor deseo de Benigna es ofrecerles una adecuada educación a sus queridos socios y para esto trabaja incansablemente, más aún en el mes de diciembre, época navideña, en el que recibe mayor pedido y demanda de los objetos que produce.Para hacer realidad sus sueños solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en la compra de materia prima (arcilla) para la elaboración de sus delicados trabajos y con la venta de éstos generar mayor beneficio económico para ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y encaminarlos hacia un futuro prometedor. Benigna se compromete responsablemente a retornar el préstamo en un lapso de 7 meses y apela a vuestros generosos corazones para lograr lo que anhela.

loans.use: To buy clay for making figurines.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina Mercedes Florentin Lopes, 51, is a micro- entrepreneur from Valle Apua – Lambaré, Paraguay. She is married to Alfonso Escurra, a shoemaker. Together they have five adult children.

Lina owns a despensa, or small convenience store, which she runs out of her house. She began this business with a loan she obtained from the Foundation. Since its inception she has been doing very well. In addition to what she earns from the despensa, her husband also helps with household costs.

Lina is requesting a loan to purchase a more diverse array of merchandise, such as: sugar, flour, oil, soaps, sodas and coffee. She currently belongs to a committee of women in Kuña Katypyry. This committee consists of 16 women and is designed to provide support for each member in running their business and paying their loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. Antonio O., 67 years old, lives with his wife Felicia Mendoza de O. in Cerrito de Carapeguá, Paraguay. The couple has three grown children. Mr. and Mrs. O. sell bedspreads and embroidered quilts, all hand-made by Mrs. O.. They use a mobile stand to sell their wears and can be found in a new location daily.

Mr. O. remarks that at times his work can be quite risky and frequently exposes him to danger. Unfortunately, in an incident not too long ago, he fell victim to robbery and assualt, which cost him all of his merchandise and the money he had earned that day.

With some luck and hard work, Mr. O., has been able to move forward. In addition to selling bedding, he also has a job feeding and caring for animals. With the little money he receives from this second job and the help of his children he is back on his feet. His business is on the right path again. He reports that he has been able to improve his daily life through this small endeavor and is more than happy to be able to do so.

Mr. O. is requesting a loan with which to buy yarn and dye.

loans.use: To buy yarn and dye.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio is a selfless father and son. He works hard to provide for his aging mother and his family. For the last 12 years he and his family have made ornamental pottery to sell in markets around the country. Through his labors he has given the family a good home. He would like to continue to expand his production and especially to begin to export his products. He is asking for a loan to buy clay and firewood and promises to repay it within seven months. Your help can make his dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Eladio es un abnegado padre y ejemplar hijo, que lucha por brindarle lo mejor a su anciana madre y a su querida familia. Desde hace más de 12 años está dedicado junto a su familia a las labores artesanas y realiza trabajos decorativos en grandes cantidades utilizando como materia prima para la elaboración de estos trabajos la arcilla para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados de las ciudades de su país, gracias a su desempeño ha podido brindar estabilidad económica a su hogar.Mantiene el deseo de seguir expandiendo la venta de sus productos y sobre todo de exportar su mercadería al exterior, para esto requiere de un préstamo que invertirá en comprar más cantidad de arcilla y leña insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus trabajos. Así mismo se compromete a retornar el préstamo en un lapso de 7 meses. Vuestra ayuda posibilitará la cristalización de este anhelo.

loans.use: To buy clay and fuel for making ornamental pottery.

loans.name: César

texts.en:
César C., 32, owns a mobile stand selling hammocks and decorative blankets. He is married and has two young children who currently attend grade school.

Mr. C. has been working since he was very young. When he was about 9 years old he began selling bedding that he and his mother had made. At a little more than 10 years old Mr. C. decided to begin selling on his own. He sells his crafts to the towns of Areguá, Luque and Limpio from his motorcycle. Thanks to this work he has been able to obtain a modest house, some conveniences for his home and provide for his family.

He has asked for a loan to buy more crafts that are the primary source of income for his family. With the approaching holiday season he has had an increase in orders for hammocks, throws and other bedding.

loans.use: To buy more crafts items

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Mr. Dionisio, 48, and his wife, Angela Isasi, 47, work together to care for their four children. Their two daughters are in college and the two boys attend high school. Angela works as a caretaker for retired persons. Mr. Dionisio has been selling electronics and other high demand items for the last 6 years. He works out of a small store located on the main street in the town of Quiindy. Before opening this store he made frames. When this work was no longer profitable he decided to sell electronics instead.

His business has been well accepted and is constantly growing thanks to a strong demand in the community and Mr Dionisio's good management skills. He hopes to expand his business by enlarging the range of products and services he offers in his store. In this way he hopes to provide a better life for his children.

Mr. Dionisio has asked for a loan to buy merchandise for his store, including: sunglasses, wallets, calculators and belts that have been demanded by his clients.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sunglasses, wallets and calculators.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy snacks and beverages

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Mr. Isidro, 57, and his wife, Silvia Elizeche, 49, are married with three children and live in Carapeguá, Paraguay. All their three children are in college. Their only daughter studies in the capital city of Asuncion while the two boys study and help their father with his business.

Mr. Isidro works as a carpenter and Silvia is a nurse. Mr. Isidro began working in carpentry 30 years ago. He learned this trade from a family friend when he was very young. This mentor taught Mr. Isidro how to make professional carpentry products. As he came of age, he began working as a professional carpenter out of his house. Day by day, thanks to the help of his family he has been successful.

Mr. Isidro has asked for a loan to buy a compressor, which would both save him time and lessen his workload. With this machine he would be able to provide better quality products.

loans.use: To buy a compressor

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier is a young man of 23 living with his family in the city of Caapucú. He is currently studying accounting and preparing to finish his final year of college. In school Javier has learned how to organize his principal life goals and how to work toward these goals.

From a very young age Javier began working with his father in the fields. Already, at this young age he was a livestock farmer. Thanks to this activity, he was able to generate his own income and with much sacrifice was able to use this money to begin his own business. Javier opened his store 2 years ago selling sports footwear, clothing and watches. He is well known in his city and has already established a regular client base.

Javier is requesting a loan so that he can buy more footwear and watches as requested by his store's clients. The increased revenue will allow Javier to purchase well-known brands and satisfy his clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy more footwear and watches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make improvement to his shop/home

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is a selfless and dedicated mother of four. Everything was going well for her and her loving husband Fermin. They raised dairy cattle and worked together to provided for their children. Five years ago Fermin began to suffer from heart problems and since then he has been laid up in bed unable to work. Cecilia took up the reins and through much hard work they now own seven cows. The sale of their milk supports the family. Cecilia would like to buy two calves and increase the family income so they can buy Fermin the medicine he needs and get him medical treatment. She is counting on your generous support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una abnegada y dedicada madre D. cuatro hijos menores.DesD. que formó su familia junto a Fermín su inseparable y amado esposo todo iba bien, ambos se dedicaron a la ganadería y siempre lucharon por brindarles lo mejor a sus queridos hijos; sin embargo desgraciadamente hace cinco años él enfermó del corazón y tiene que permanecer postrado en caM. sin poder hacer ningún esfuerzo físico, entonces Cecilia decidió tomar las riendas D. su hogar y se hizo cargo sola D. su familia y puso mayor empeño en su actividad D. crianza D. animales en respuesta a tan dedicada labor ahora ya cuenta con siete vacas, D. las que obtiene leche y venD. para incrementar el ingreso económico en su hogar.Su deseo es adquirir dos vaquitas más y con la comercialización D. la leche busca ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar los medicamentos necesarios e iniciar un tratamiento con el objetivos D. mejorar la situación D. salud que padece su querido compañero que tanta falta le hace.Para lograr sus objetivos esta madre trabajadora recurre a tu generoso aporte y solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. iniciar pronto sus planes.

loans.use: To buy two calves and finance medical treatment.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel I. is 26 years old and lives with his father and child in the town of Carapeguá. Joel lost his mother early in life and thanks to the example of his hardworking father, has been able to continue moving forward and providing for the family. As both a student and a worker,Joel sacrifices a lot in order to achieve economic self-sufficiency.

Joel is well known in the area. He began working by establishing an office supply store, which he runs out of his house. Unfortunately, this business did not turn out as well as initially expected and he decided to change. He then began selling local crafts from a mobile stand. He has been doing this for the past three years.

Joel has requested a loan to buy bedding and clothing that he can sell from his stand. In this way he will be able to increase the variety and quantity of goods he sells and continue to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy bedding and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in different types of meats

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Juan C., 42, is married to Sra. Tomasa Báez; together they live in the town of Arasaty de Roque González with their three young children. Mr. and Mrs. C. got married when they were very young and both worked as street vendors to make ends meet. Mr. C. worked very hard during the day in order to earn the money to allow Mrs. C. to go to school. Mrs. C. is now an assistant in a local school as well as a homemaker. Together they hope to provide their children with a bright future.

Mr. C. is a very hard worker. He is the director of a committee of men who raise and sell pigs. This business has been very successful and creates a steady source of income for every man involved. On the weekends Mr. and Mrs. C. sell craft items from a mobile stand. They are both well liked and their weekend business has regular clients. With the extra money they earn from this they have been able to improve their quality of life.

Mr. C. has asked for a loan in order to buy piglets, which he will raise on the collective farm.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify and increase his product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his lottery sales

loans.name: Lisandra

texts.en:
Lisandra is 23 years old and has a four-year-old son. She lives in Carapeguá, Paraguay with her partner Jorge Avalos,with whom she has lived for the past 5 years. Jorge contributes to the family income by selling household appliances.

When Lisandra was a younger, her tough family situation compelled her to leave Paraguay and her family in search of work in neighboring Argentina. After 1 year she decided to return and form a family of her own. For two years, with the help of her partner Jorge, they have run a store where they sell clothing and footwear. They have begun to sell their goods around the town on a moving stand. Today Lisandra has established a formal client base with whom she meets on a weekly basis.

This business was formed as part of a group of micro-enterprises called New Hope. The organization is run out of Carapeguá. Here they are able to generate a saving of 10% of what is earned on money borrowed. Lisandra has asked for a loan to purchase new stock for her business including seasonal clothing and footwear.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for her seasonal clothing and footwear business.

loans.name: Sergio Julio

texts.es:
Sergio and his enterprising wife Antonia have been together for more than fifteen years. They work very hard to give their five children a good home. The whole family works together making clay piggybanks in various sizes, colors and models to export. Recently, while everything was going well, Sergio was struck with apendicitis and had to have an operation. He was recovering slowly when he suffered a severe setback. Sergio is unable to work and his medical treatment has been very costly but Antonia has taken up the reins and the children too are working very hard to get by. The family has a great backlog of orders to fill and they need to streamline and ramp up production. They are asking for a loan to buy a clay mixer and to refit the kiln. They promise to repay the loan within seven months. Sergio and his faithful wife are counting on your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Sergio y su emprendedora esposa Antonia formaron su hogar hace más de 15 años, con muchas ilusiones de ofrecer lo mejor a sus cinco hijos, la familia en pleno se dedica a la elaboración y venta de alcancías de diferentes modelos, tamaños y colores, fabricados con arcilla para luego exportarlos en grandes cantidades al exterior.Cuando todo marchaba bien en su hogar Sergio enfermó y tuvo que ser operado de apendicitis en un nosocomio de su pequeña ciudad se iba recuperando poco a poco con sumo cuidado, sin embargo acaba de sufrir una recaída y el tratamiento para restablecerse con éxito está siendo muy costoso es por eso que su fiel esposa Antonia ha asumido las riendas de su hogar y con ayuda de sus queridos hijos trabaja arduamente para cubrir los gastos que le demanda la recuperación de Sergio.En estos momentos tienen gran cantidad de pedidos y necesitan acelerar la producción de su mercadería, para eso solicitan un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una batidora de arcilla y refaccionar su horno a fin de mejorar y acelerar la producción de su mercadería comprometiéndose a devolver vuestro generoso aporte en un período de siete meses.“En estos momentos Sergio y su incondicional esposa necesitan de nuestra ayuda, ellos esperan pronto una respuesta alentadora”

loans.use: To buy a clay mixer and pay for kiln repairs.

loans.name: Maria Andresa

texts.en:
Maria Andresa is 53 years old and lives in Carapeguá, Paraguay. She is married to Sr. Cristino Sanabria with whom she has five children. All of their children are fully-grown; four of them are married and one is still in school. Maria Andresa and her husband own a small grocery in their town.

Before beginning her business, Maria and her husband sold charcoal. She also spent many years working as a domestic servant. These years did not pass easily and after two years of working in this manner, Maria fell ill. It is for this reason that Maria and her children decided to open a small grocery operating out of their home. This way, Maria is able to work without having to leave her home. The grocery store is well-regarded and well-run. Maria’s neighbors rely on her to obtain basic staples for their homes.

Maria has asked for a loan in order to purchase additional merchandise for her store such as sodas, beer, noodles, sugar and rice. All of these products are very high in demand. The loan will allow her to satisfy her clients and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store, including sodas, beer, noodles, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Lily Salimoba

texts.es:
Lily is 42 years old. Several years ago she moved to Lima, but the man with whom she had hoped to form a family left her alone with her young son Jesus and no means of support. She returned to her native village Ayaviri and with the help of her aged parents opened a business making "ekeko" dolls. These small figures are thought to bring joy and properity to the home. She has two other people working for her. Lily's dream is to distribute these clay figures to various markets around the country and some day to export them. To do this she needs to raise capital for raw materials so she is asking for a loan which she promises to repay within seven months. She is counting on your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Lily tiene 42 años de edad y hace algunos años decidió emigrar a la ciudad de Lima, donde sufrió una gran decepción, la persona con la que pensó formar una familia la abandonó, dejándola sola junto a su hijo Jesús sin ningún respaldo económico. Ante este penoso hecho que le causó mucho dolor , Lily y su pequeño niño decidieron volver a su pueblo natal Ayaviri, para dedicarse completamente a las labores artesanas, oficio al que se consagraban sus ancianos y queridos padres; desde entonces trabaja diligentemente para sacar adelante el pequeño taller de fabricación de muñecos ekeko ( pequeño hombrecito denominado en su pueblo natal portador de alegría y abundancia para el hogar) elaborados en arcilla, en el que también ofrece trabajo a otras dos personas El anhelo de Lily es ofrecer sus productos en los diferentes mercados de su país para más adelante exportarlos al exterior. Para hacer realidad sus deseos necesita incrementar su capital de inversión con el objetivo de adquirir más materia prima extendiéndoles el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de siete meses. Lily espera contar con vuestra generosa ayuda para iniciar sus proyectos pronto.

loans.use: To buy clay and raw materials to make dolls.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Consuelo J. and I have been a maker and seller of totrtillas for the last ten years. I need this loan to purchase milk, corn and plastic bags to package the tortillas. With the profits of my tortila sales I cover the cost of my children's education and medical expenses. I also help my husband with the monthly household expenses, as his salary is very low. I would greatly appreciate your help with this loan so I can purchase what I need.

Translated from Spanish by Wendy Wise, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Consuelo J., yo me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas hace 10 años. el dinero lo necesito para comprar; lecha, quintales de maiz, mantas y pailas plasticas para colocar las tortillas. Con los ingresos del que genera el negocio cubro los gastos de mis hijo de us estudios, medicinas y tambien ayudo ami esposo con los gastos mensuales ya que el sueldo de el es muy bajo. Les agradecere que me ayuden para poder comprar lo que necesito.

loans.use: Purchase corn, salt, milk and plastic bags for the tortillas

loans.name: Bethy Rossio

texts.es:
Bethy and her enterprising husband make beautiful decorative pieces of clay and plaster. They both work diligently 6 days of the week, putting their creativity and talent into every design. They sell their pieces from a small mobile stand at the fairs in the different cities. They are always accompanied by their daughter Marisol, who is the pride and happiness of their lives.

Bethy wants to increase the quantity of their merchandise and is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase materials and paint used to make their handicrafts, giving them a colorful finish so that they can generate more income for their family. She has committed to repay your generousity by repaying the loan within 6 months.

Bethy and Francisco are waiting for your kind support so that they can continue forward.

Bethy y su emprendedor esposo Francisco, se dedican a realizar hermosos trabajos decorativos a base arcilla y yeso, ambos trabajan diligentemente durante seis días a la semana, poniendo su creatividad y sacando a flote sus talentos en cada diseño, para luego ofrecerlos en su pequeña movilidad los días de feria en las diferentes ciudades de su país acompañados siempre de su querida hija Marisol, quién es el mayor orgullo y alegría de sus vidas. Ella desea acrecentar la cantidad de su mercadería y para esto solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá en la compra de pintura para moldear sus excelentes trabajos a fin de otorgarles un mejor y vistoso acabado y posteriormente con la venta de estos generar mayor ingreso económico para su familia; así mismo les extiende su compromiso de retornar vuestro generoso aporte en un lapso de siete meses. “Bethy y Francisco esperan tu desinteresado apoyo para salir adelante”

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS AND PAINT FOR THEIR BEAUTIFUL HANDMADE CRAFTS,  SO THEY CAN GIVE THEM A MORE COLORFUL FINISH, SELL MORE OF THEM, AND INCREASE THEIR INCOME.

loans.name: Justina Eustaquia

texts.es:
Justina is a loving and hard-working mother of three small children and for four years she has been selling Andean products (potato starch, quinoa, potatoes and barley) in a very popular market in Juliaca, the city where she lives. The business generates an acceptable amount of money and allows her to cover the basic needs of her household.

She begins to sell her products every day at 7:00am and finishes at 5:00pm, six days a week, working every day to give her children a higher quality of life and, most importantly, education so that in the future they can grow to be men that are useful in their communities.

In order to achieve these goals she would like to increase the quantity of merchandise and in this way increase her income. For this reason she is asking for a loan that she will invest in her business, which she promises to repay in no more than six months.

“She will keep working hard, but without your help she will not be able to achieve her goals, and for this reason she hopes for your generous support.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Justina es una amorosa y trabajadora madre de tres pequeños niños y hace más de cuatro años se dedica a la comercialización de productos andinos (chuño, quinua, papa y cebada), en un mercado muy popular de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, negocio que le genera ingresos económicos aceptables y le permite cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Ella empieza diariamente a ofrecer sus productos desde las 7:00 de la mañana y culmina a las 5:00 de la tarde durante 6 días a la semana y se esfuerza día a día con el propósito de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños y sobre todo educación para que en el futuro se desenvuelvan como hombres de bien útiles a su comunidad.

Para lograr sus objetivos desea aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y así obtener mayor beneficio económico, para esto solicita un préstamo que invertirá en su negocio y promete reembolsar el dinero en un lapso no mayor a seis meses.

“Seguirá trabajando arduamente, pero sin tu ayuda no podrá cumplir sus metas, por eso espera tu generoso apoyo”

loans.use: Obtain a greater quantity and quality of products to sell in the different markets of her beautiful city.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Mrs. Eufemia is 65 years old. She lives in Chongoyape, Paijan district in the province of Ascope del Departamento D. la Libertad. She has 10 children, none of whom depend on her. Mrs. Eufemia studied up until 1st graD. of elementary school.

She started her business selling a few vegetables, yucas, potatoes at the door in her home in Paijan. Thanks to some of her friends, she joined the Communal Bank Manos Unidas, obtaining her first loan for S/. 300 (approximately US $100). With this money she was able to buy products in greater quantities and take her chances going to sell at the market Casa GranD.. She did well, and encouraged, decided to get a greater variety of products, so with the other loans she receives she began preparing all kinds of ground peppers, packaging spices, grounding garlic and offering them for sale at Casa GranD.. Her business had a positive reception and now she sells all kinds of spices and condiments in that market.

With the loan she recently received from Manuela Ramos for S/.2,000 soles (approx. US$667) which will be terminated in 6 months, she will buy spices wholesale, to grind and package to sell and generate a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eufemia tiene 65 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Chongoyape, Distrito D. Paiján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad, tiene 10 hijos, ninguno D. ellos dependen D. ella. La señora Eufemia estudió hasta el primer grado D. primaria.

Inició su negocio vendiendo unas cuantas verduras, yucas, papas en la puerta D. su casa en Paiján; por unas amigas ingresa al Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, obteniendo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300 ($100 aprox.), con este dinero compra mayor cantidad D. productos y se arriesga a ir a vender al mercado D. Casa GranD., le fue bien y con mejor ánimo deciD. variar los productos, así que con los otros préstamos que recibe empieza a preparar todo tipo D. ajíes molidos, a embolsar condimentos, moler ajos y también lleva a vender a Casa GranD., su negocio tuvo acogida y ahora venD. solo en ese mercado todo tipo D. condimentos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.2,000.00 soles ($ 667 aprox.) el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará especias al por mayor, ahora molerá y envasará para venderlos y generar mayor ganancia.

loans.use: Buying spices wholesale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 43 years old and lives in Licapa, in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province, Department of La Libertad. She has one son who no longer lives with her now that he is an adult, and she has given him work in her business. Norma attended school until 9th grade.

She started her business when she worked with a friend in Laredo in a brick factory, and learned from that business. She made herself independent and was able to work alone when she received her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $100) from the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas.” With this money she bought a plot of land, and with subsequent loans she bought her tools. In this way the business grew and she was able to give more and more work to the youth who live in the area.

This loan of 2,300 soles (about $767) from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 months, will be used as capital to buy another truck to deliver the bricks that they produce.

Norma dreams of having a business with state-of-the-art technology, and in this way grow and be able to export her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Norma tiene 43 años de edad, actualmente vive en Licapa, Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope del Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 1 hijo, el cual no depende de ella, ya es mayor y le ha dado trabajo en su negocio. La señora Norma estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria.

Su negocio empezó cuando se asoció con un amigo para trabajar en Laredo, en la fabricación del ladrillo, allí aprendió del negocio, se independizó para trabajar sola cuando recibió su primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 ($ 100 aprox.) en el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”. Con ese dinero pagó el derecho de tierra, con los siguientes préstamos compró sus implementos y así su negocio fue creciendo y pudo dar cada vez más trabajo a jóvenes de su zona.

El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.2,300.00 ($ 767 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo utilizará para completar el capital para la compra de otro camión, el cual será utilizado para la repartición del ladrillo que fabrica.

La señora Norma sueña con poner una empresa, con tecnología de punta, de esta manera crecer y llegar a exportar.

loans.use: Buy a truck (mobility).

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Mrs. Teofila is 70 years old. She lives in Licapa, district of Piján, Province of Ascope of the Department of Freedom. She has one daughter with whom she lives, and they depend on each other. Mrs. Teofila studied until the third year of high school. Shortly before receiving the first loan from the United Hands Communal Bank, she was approved for selling in a kiosk belonging to a school of Piján, and has been lucky enough to have been offered the post to sell there every year thereafter. With the first loan (approx. $100 ), Mrs. Teofila purchased greater amounts of treats and soft drinks for sale in her kiosk. Now she's requesting an additional loan (approx. $ 267 USD), to be paid in 6 months. With this loan she will buy products to restock her supplies like: sugar, food coloring, flour, cake decorations. Besides running her treats kiosk, she runs a catering business and prepares foods for events like marriages, baptisms, etc. Mrs. Teofila dreams about having grandchildren someday.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teofila tiene 70 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Licapa, distrito D. Piján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene 1 hija con la cual vive y se apoyan mutuamente. La señora Teofila estudió hasta el tercer año D. secundaria. Poco antes D. recibir el primer préstamo del Banco Comunal Manos Unidas ganó la licitación para vender en el kiosko D. un colegio D. Piján y desD. esa época tiene la suerte D. ganar la licitación año tras año y vender allí. Con su primer préstamo D. S/.300 ($100 aprox.) que recibió D. Manuela Ramos compró mayor cantidad D. golosinas y gaseosas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.800.00 soles ($ 267 aprox.) que será pagado en 6 meses; comprará insumos para repostería como azúcar, colorantes, harina, adornos para tortas, ya que aparte D. vender en el kiosko se dedica a la repostería y prepara comida para algunos eventos (matrimonios, bautizos, etc.). La señora Teofila sueña con ver a sus nietos realizados.

loans.use: To purchase food products to supplement her catering stock supply like:  sugar, food coloring, cake decorations, flour, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Business Description

Maria C. has a dressmaking studio where she sews all types of clothing and also a shop where she sells sewing supplies

Loan Use

She needs the loan in order to purchase more fabric for clothing and supplies for her shop. She would also like to purchase a better sewing machine to improve the quality of the clothing she makes.

Personal Information

She is 44 years old and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her husband is a carpenter and together they live in a cement house. They live in a stable community and get along well with their neighbors.

loans.use: Purchase more fabric for clothing and supplies for her shop

loans.name: Olinda Mariela

texts.es:
Olinda is 42 years old. She lives in Mache, in the Otuzco province, Department of La Libertad. She has one son who still lives with her because he is young and attends high school. Olinda only completed elementary school.

She began by selling some products (groceries), sweets and juices from her house. With this business she became a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres con Futuro” and obtained her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $100). She bought hens and ducks with the loan, to raise and sell to the people who bring products to Trujillo. At the same time, she also ran a kiosk at the school in Mache.

With this loan of 1,000 soles from Manuela Ramos (approximately $333), which she will repay within four months, she will buy candy to supply the kiosk and use another part of the loan to buy hens that she will fatten to sell for the New Year’s celebrations. She dreams of seeing her only son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Olinda tiene 42 años de edad, actualmente vive en Mache provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 1 hijo, que aun depende de ella ya que está pequeño y va al colegio. La señora Olinda estudió solo primaria completa.

Se inició vendiendo unos cuantos productos (abarrotes), golosinas y jugos en su casa, con este negocio ingresó al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” y obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 ($ 100 aprox.) con este dinero compró gallinas y patos para criar y vender a la gente que lleva productos a Trujillo. Paralelamente a estas actividades también vende en el kiosko de la escuela de Mache.

Con el reciente préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ( $ 333 aprox.) para pagarlo en 4 meses, comprará golosinas para surtir el kiosko y otra parte para comprar gallinas las que engordará para vender en las fiestas de fin de año. Ella sueña con ver a su único hijo profesional.

loans.use: Buy sweets; Buy hens.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene takes care of her 6 year old daughter, and for the last four years she has worked selling used clothing. She started this business thanks to the initiative of her sister Gregoria and now she's doing well.

She works from 5 in the morning, 6 days a week, moving around the plaza dominical selling her clothing. Her daughter, always by her side, has become a partner and a great model.

Marlene would like to expand her business, and to continue her work she is requesting a loan which will allow her to expand the variety of clothing during this season of greater demand.

Work with us so that this can become a reality for Marlene, a diligent mother who continues to work hard to improve the quality of life for her and her young daughter.

Marlene tiene bajo su cobijo a una pequeña niña de seis años y desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de segundo uso, trabajo que emprendió gracias a la iniciativa de su hermana Gregoria y que ahora desempeña satisfactoriamente. Inicia arduamente su labor a las cinco de la mañana y durante seis días a la semana en forma ambulatoria en la plaza dominical, acompañada siempre de su adorable niña quién se ha convertido en su engreída socia y modelo espectacular. Marlene está deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio y para continuar con su labor desea obtener un préstamo que le permitirá ampliar su puesto de ventas e incrementar la variedad de prendas de vestir aún más en esta temporada en la que existe mayor demanda. Colaboremos para que este deseo se haga realidad en poco tiempo y para que esta diligente madre siga cobijando en su corazón deseos de superación.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE VARIETY OF CLOTHING TO SELL, GROW HER BUSINESS, AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HERSELF AND HER YOUNG DAUGHTER.

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
Mrs. Grimaldina is 54 years old and lives in Mache District, Otuzco Province, Department of La Libertad with her only child that she is still supporting. From the age of 15 she has been working (she finished primary school). She learned various trades including cooking, making clothes, selling prepared food door to door, making paper flowers. With the money she saved she purchased clothing wholesale to sell at retail. And as she progressed selling clothes, she used her savings to purchase her home.

The birth of her child was by cesaerean section which maD. it impossible for her to continue selling clothes door to door. A friend suggested that she join the Communal Bank “Working Women” and with her first $100 loan she opened a pension house for local workers. With the $500 she received from Manuela Ramos, Mrs.Grimaldina will purchase some chairs and tables to improve her restaurant and purchase feed for the animals she grows in her backyard to sell in the market.

Mrs.Grimaldina is currently the president of her Communal Bank “Working Women”. She dreams of opening a funeral home in her residence to increase her income and not have to cook anymore in the pension.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Grimaldina tiene 54 años D. edad, actualmente vive en el distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene 1 solo hijo que aún depenD. D. ella. La señora Grimaldina estudió solo primaria completa. DesD. los 15 años, al salir del colegio, aprendió a cocer y hacer alguna ropa, así como coronas y flores a base D. papel, esto fue en Mache, luego se fue a Trujillo y por un tiempo vendió ceviche (comida criolla) y otros platos en condición D. ambulante, con este negocio hizo un poco D. capital y se dedicó a vender ropa, compraba al por mayor en Trujillo para venderlos en Mache, Julcán y otros poblados. Con sus ganancias pudo comprar su casa; estaba embrazada y ya tenía que dar a luz, le hicieron cesárea la que se complicó y le impidió continuar viajando, en ese momento una amiga la integró al Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Trabajo” y con el primer préstamo que obtuvo D. S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) empezó nuevamente a trabajar pero en otro negocio, dar pensión a algunos trabajadores D. la zona. El reciente préstamo obtenido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,500.00 ($ 500 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, lo utilizará para comprar algunas mesas y sillas para mejorar su restaurant y otra parte para comprar alimentos para sus animales que también cría (cuyes, chanchos, gallinas) para luego venderlos. Actualmente la señora Grimaldina es presidenta D. su Banco Comunal. “Mujeres del Trabajo”, ella sueña con poner en su casa una funeraria para tener mejores ganancias y ya no cocinar porque ese negocio es muy sacrificado.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and livestock feed.

loans.name: Lisleys

texts.en:
Description of business

Lisleys C. has a well known dispensary where she has been selling basic necessities and cosmetics for 5 years. Her son helps her at the store. She started with $150 that she had saved from another business.

Use for loan

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise and also to improve and renonvate the entrance to her business.

Personal information

She is 40 years old and has one son who is in school and also works in construction. She is separated from her husband. She and her son live in a cement house.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 49 years old, lives in Mache District, Otuzco Province, La Libertad state. She has 7 children who all depend on her. Alejandrina completed elementary school.

She learned her business from her mother at a young age and also how to do a variety of activities. She has some cows, and when she milks them she makes the cheese and curd, put it is not enough to meet the orders she has so she also goes to different farms to buy them already made to later sell in Mache and Trujillo. She also raises animals (guinea pigs, chickens, turkeys) to sell. Along with these activities she grows some crops.

The business of buying and selling cheese and curd began with a loan the Communal Bank "Mujeres de Trabajo" sought from Manuela Ramos, and at that time she only sold the product she herself produced.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos for 1300 soles (approximately US$433), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy food for her animals and turkeys to fatten and sell at Christmas.

Alejandrina dreams of having a house on the coast so that she can take her children there to study.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandrina tiene 49 años de edad, actualmente vive en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 7 hijos, todos dependen de ella. La señora Alejandrina estudió solo primaria completa.

Desde muy joven aprendió de su mamá el negocio y también a realizar varias actividades, tiene algunas vaquitas y cuando descargan leche ella misma prepara los quesos y la cuajada, pero no es suficiente para atender sus pedidos así que también sale a los diferentes caseríos a comprarlos preparados para vender luego en Mache y también en Trujillo, también cría animales (cuyes, gallinas, pavos) para luego venderlos. Paralelamente a estas actividades siembra algunas hortalizas.

El negocio de la compra y venta de quesos y cuajada lo inició con el primer préstamo que le otorgó Manuela Ramos en el Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” ya que antes sólo vendía lo que ella misma producía.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,300.00 ($ 433 aprox.) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará alimento para sus animales y pavos para engordarlos y venderlos en la navidad.

La señora Alejandrina sueña con tener una casa en la costa para que pueda llevar ahí a sus hijos a estudiar.

loans.use: Purchase of animal feed and turkeys.

loans.name: Elvira De Jesus

texts.es:
I have owned a little grocery store for the last 8 years ago. I opened this business when I became jobless. I require the funds in order to buy the following products: rice, sugar, corn, bread, eggs, carbonated beverages, soaps, churros (fried bread) and other items. I am in urgent need of it, since I have to supply my business in order to offer better service to my customers. With my earnings, I support my family since my husband doesn't make much of an income and we have many expenses because of our children.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo tengo una pequeña pulperia (grocery store) hace 8 años. Este negocio lo abrí cuando me quede sin trabajo. El dinero lo necesito para hacer las siguientes compras: arroz, azúcar, maíz, pan, huevos, sodas jabones churros y otros. Me urege ya que tengo que surtir mi negocio para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes. Con las ganancias sostengo a mi familia porque mi esposo gana muy poco y tenemos muchos gastos con nuestros hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, rice, dishwasher soap, quintals of corn, churros (fried bread), cookies, bread and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more meat for her shop

loans.name: Demofila Susana

texts.es:
Demofila Susana is 33 years old, lives in the Centro Poblado Menor Piscopampa, Mache District, Otuzco Province, La Libertad State. Susana has one little boy who is 2 years old. She completed 5th grade in elementary school.

She began her business young, more or less at 16 years of age; her mother loaned her 150 soles and with that money she bought animals which she fattened and sold. With the earnings she bought sugar, rice, oil, matches, and started a grocery business in her mother's home.

Upon seeing her dedication and responsibility, her older sister had her join the Communal Bank "Mujeres de Trabajo" of which she too is a member. She received her first loan of 300 soles (approximately US$100), and with this money she bought shelves and tables to organize and show her products. Little by little she expanded her store, with other loans she bought guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, and turkeys to raise and sell. In addition she buys and sells grain wholesale.

With the currently loan from Manuela Ramos of 2000 soles (approximately US$667), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy food for her animals and sacks of grain wholesale.

Susana dreams of having her own home in which she can live peacefully with her son as she is a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Demofila Susana tiene 33 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Centro Poblado Menor Piscopampa del Distrito de Mache de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Susana tiene solo un hijito de 2 años. Ella estudió sólo hasta quinto grado de primaria.

Empezó su negocio desde muy joven, más o menos a los 16 años; su mamá le prestó S/.150.00 soles y con ese dinero compró animales los engordó y vendió, con las ganancias obtenidas compró azúcar, arroz, aceite, fósforos e inició la venta de abarrotes en la casa de su madre.

Al ver su dedicación y responsabilidad su hermana mayor la integra al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” del que también es socia; recibió su primer crédito de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100), con este dinero compró andamios y mesas para ordenar y mostrar sus productos. Poco a poco fue implementando más su bodega, con los otros préstamos compró cuyes, gallinas, patos, pavos los que cría y luego vende, además se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales al por mayor.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará alimentos para sus animales y sacos de cereales al por mayor.

La señora Susana sueña con tener su casa propia en la que pueda vivir tranquila con su niño ya que es madre soltera.

loans.use: Purchase of food for animals (chickens, guinea pigs, turkeys), purchase of grain at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more ingredients, chairs , and tables.

loans.name: Dailan Evelyn

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Dailan Z.. My business is dedicated to the sale of sweets and foods (pastries, enchiladas and tacos). I run this business in the park, in the city of San Lorenzo, which is a good spot for my sales because so many people visit.. I've had this business for 6 years already. I am a single mother, and have two children who study because I want them to have a better future. I appreciate your help very much.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hola, mi nombre es Dailan Z., yo me dedico a la venta de golosinas (pastelitos, enchiladas y tacos) este negocio lo tengo en el parque de la ciudad de San Lorenzo ya que es un buen puento para mis ventas, porque mucha personas lo vicitan. El negocio lo tengo hace 6 años. Soy madre soltera tengo dos hijos los cuales los tengo estudiando porque quiero que tengan un mejor futuro. Le agradesco mucho por su ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase cabbage, avocados, carrots, onions, sweet peppers, maize flour, oil, etc.  (compra de repollo, aguacate, zanahorias, cebolla, chile dulce, harina de maiz, aceite etec)

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es:
Mrs.Elvia María is a 69 years old lady from Centro Poblado Menor D. Monchacap . She currently divides her residence between Trujillo and Monchacap. Her 3 adult children do not live with her.

Up until her husbands´ illness, Mrs.Maria used to take care of the house and helped in the family vegetable garden. Since her husband could not work anymore she started travelling to the market in Trujillo to sell the produce from their plot of land. In Trujillo she saw the opportunity to purchase 200 chicks to raise back home to increase the family income. A niece suggested she join the Communal Bank “Las Lomas II” to help her obtain a $100 loan to purchase chicken feed. Three months later she sold all the chickens.

Mrs. Maria dedided this was a profitable business venture and moved to Trujillo to dedicate herself fulltime to raising chickens. However, she must travel to Monchacap weekly to help a family member with a plot of land. She brings back to the Trujillo market the harvests and brings chickens and clothing back to her home town to sell. Currently she has 400 chicks and 50 chickens ready to sell. The $567 loan she received from Manuela Ramos will be payed back in four installments. The money will be used to purchase chicken feed which will get them ready to sell in time for the New Year´s Eve family celebrations.

Mrs. Maria dreams of having a larger plot of land which will allow her to increase the production of chicks. She would like to save up enough money to lead a worry free life when she is no longer able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elvia María tiene 69 años D. edad, es natural del Centro Poblado Menor D. Monchacap del Distrito D. Otuzco D. la Provincia del mismo nombre en el Departamento D. La Libertad, actualmente pasa un tiempo en Trujillo y otro en Monchacap. Tiene sólo 3 hijos, todos adultos y viven fuera. La señora Elvia se dedicaba sólo a las tareas D. su casa y a ayudar a su esposo en la chacra pero debido a que él cae con una enfermedad delicada, la que le impiD. trabajar, la señora asume sola el negocio, empieza por traer la cosecha a vender a los mercados D. Trujillo pero como tenía que permanecer más tiempo en Trujillo por acompañar a su esposo busca que hacer para entretenerse y empieza a criar pollitos, cuando compró su primer lote D. 200 pollitos le faltó dinero para la compra del alimento, ahí acepta la invitación D. su sobrina e ingresa al Banco Comunal “Las Lomas II”. Con el primer crédito que recibió D. S/.300.00 soles ($ 100 aprox.) compró alimento para los pollitos, después D. tres meses sacó a la venta este primer lote y como le fue muy bien decidió dedicarse a esta actividad así que se trasladó a vivir a Trujillo pero todas las semanas viaja a Monchacap porque allí tiene tierras que han sido sembradas por un pariente, lo que cosecha también lo trae a vender a Trujillo, además lleva pollos y otros productos como ropa y frazadas, a vender en Monchacap. Actualmente tiene 400 pollitos pequeños y otros 50 que ya están para venderlos. Con el reciente préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,700 ($ 567 aprox.), el mismo que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará alimento para los pollitos, los que estarán listos para vender en las fiestas D. fin D. año. La señora Elvia sueña con tener un terreno más amplio que le permita criar mayor cantidad D. pollo y con tener un buen ahorro para descasar sin preocupaciones cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Elvia Domitila

texts.es:
Elvia is 54 years old and lives in Licapa, in the district of Paiján, Province of Ascope, in the department of La Libertad. She has 6 children, two of whom still live with her. The rest of her children are adults and they help her cover some of her expenses. Elvia studied until 9th graD..

Elvia has sold beauty products for a long time and with the earnings that were left she would, little by little, buy merchandise like adult clothing and undergarments, etc. She now has a stall at the AAHH José Carlos Mariátegui-Licapa market. In addition, she delivers her merchandise to some of her neighbors and friends and charges them weekly. She also sells natural medicine.

She heard about Manuela Ramos from the governor of Paiján. She formed the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” and obtained her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $100). With this money she traveled to Lima and bought merchandise at a better price than in Trujillo (plastics, comforters and also clothing), products that she brought to sell in different parts of the Ascope province.

With this loan of 1,700 soles (approximately $567) from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy women’s and children’s clothing, and she will use another part of the loan to change the door of the stall where she sells her merchandise, to make it safer.

Elvia was president of the Mothers of Licapa Club for 10 years, and now is president of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas.” Her greatest dream is to buy another stall in order to start another business selling groceries, and to have a truck to sell all types of tubers and vegetables in different markets in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elvia tiene 54 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Licapa, distrito D. Paiján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene 6 hijos, 2 dependen D. ella, los demás ya son mayores y le ayudan a cubrir algunos gastos. La señora Elvia estudió hasta el tercer año D. secundaria.

Hace mucho tiempo que se dedicaba a la venta D. productos D. belleza y con las ganancias que le dejaba fue comprando poco a poco mercadería como ropa D. adulto, ropa interior, etc. Actualemnte tiene un puesto en el mercado del AA.HH José Carlos Mariátegui- Licapa, a su vez reparte su mercadería a algunas vecinas y amistades para cobrar semanalmente, también venD. medicina natural.

Se enteró D. la existencia D. Manuela Ramos por medio D. la Gobernadora D. Paiján; formó el Banco Comunal Manos Unidas y obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/.300 ($ 100 aprox.), con este dinero viajó a Lima y compró a mercadería a mejor precio que en Trujillo (plásticos, edredones, y también ropa) productos que llevó a vender por diferentes lugares D. la provincia D. Ascope.

Con el reciente préstamo obtenido D. Manuela ramos D. S/. 1,700.00 ($ 567 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará ropa D. dama y niños, y otra parte del préstamo lo utilizará para cambiar la puerta del puesto donD. venD. y hacerlo más seguro.

La señora Elvia fue presidenta del club D. madres D. Licapa por 10 años actualmente es presidenta D. su Banco Comunal Manos Unidas. Su mayor sueño es comprar otro puesto para tener el negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y una camioneta para vender todo tipo D. tubérculos y verduras en las diferentes ferias D. la zona.

loans.use: Buy women's and children's clothing; infrastructure (change the door of her store).

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Julio is dedicated to baking breads and he has eighteen years experience in this activity. He works every day of the week until Sunday preparing his product with high quality for his community, and he has great support from his wife who helps him in his job.

Loan Use

Julio needs the loan to buy more ingredients since the his clientel has really increased in size. Julio needs to increase his sales now, as a result of the effort that he makes day after day in his work. He and his wife know how to move their business forward with dedication, hard work, and responsibility.

Personal Information

Presently Julio is 38 years old and lives together with his wife and three beautiful children, and thanks to his effort, he and his wife have been able to keep educating them. Their home is a cement structure in a stable and cozy condition. The dreams of Julio are to have a shop with a greater variety of products that he will offer by means of his great efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Don Julio se dedica a la elaboración de panes, teniendo como experiencia 18 anos en esta actividad. Trabaja todos los días de la semana hasta los domingos elaborando su producto de buena calidad hacia la comunidad, ya que tiene un gran apoyo de su esposa el cual le facilita en el trabajo.

Uso del Préstamo

Julio necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos, ya que por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener y aumentar, Julio necesita incrementar sus ventas esto, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo. El y su esposa con dedicación han sabido llevar el negocio adelante, con esfuerzo y responsabilidad.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Julio tiene 38 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 bellos hijos, que gracias al esfuerzo que realiza junto a su esposa a logrado mantener educándolos. Su casa es de estructura de cemento en condiciones estables y acogedora. Los sueños de Julio es tener el local con más variedad de productos que gracias a su esfuerzo Julio los provee y demuestra.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients to increase his production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more ingredients to increase his production

loans.name: Deysi Xiomara

texts.es:
I've had a small grocery store in my house for eight years. I need this money to make various purchases like: coffee, sugar, rice, eggs, etc. As you all can see, I don't have anything in my business right now, and I need to supply it to have good sales and to give better service to my clients, who are loyal customers. With the income from my sales, I help my husband with the costs that we have from our son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo tengo una peque pulperia en mi casa hace 8 años. el dinero lo necesito para hacer varias ccomprar como : cafe, azucar, arroz, huevos etec. como ustedes pueden ver no tengo ya nada en mi negocio y necesito surtirla para tener buenas ventas y dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes los cules son muy fieles compradores. Con los ingreso de las ventas ayudo a mi esposo con los castos que tenemos de nuestro hijo que esta estudiando en la escuela.

loans.use: Purchase of popcorn, bread, rice, sugar, oil, coffee, cookies, donuts, eggs, dairy products, juice, and other items.

loans.name: Dirma

texts.es:
I sell and make delicious tortillas. I've had this business on the patio of my house for 10 years. I sell to various restaurants in the city of San Lorenzo, and I also take orders from my neighbors. Now I want to buy corn, firewood, lime, and presses to make the tortillas. I would like it if you would help me buy what I need because I have various orders and also family costs from my two sons, like medicines and things they need for school. This is why I need to increase my sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo vendo y elaboro ricas tortillas, este negocio lo tengo en el patio de mi casa. Hace 10 años . Yo les vendo a varios restaurantes de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y tambien tengo pedidos de mis becinos. Ahora quiero comprar qintales de maiz, Leña, cal y comales para hacer las tortillas. Me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder compar lo que necesito, porque tengo varios pedidos y tambien gastos familiares los de mis 2 hijos que comoro medicinas y utiles de estudio y por eso necesito ingrementar las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, lime, corn, salt, and presses

loans.name: Jose Martir

texts.es:
I have made a living selling fruit for 7 years. I make my sales by traveling around with my old little cart. I cover several neighborhoods where I have my steady customers. I need this money to buy various fruits because I have several orders for apples and grapes. I also have responsibilities like my family, my wife, and a son, who is studying in elementary school. I hope to give the best education I can to my son. The money is very urgent for me right now, and I am very grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo me ddico a la venta de frutas hace 7 años. Las venta las hago ambulante en mi carrito viejo. Yo recorro varias colonias donde tengo mis clientes fijos. El dinero lo necesito para comprar varias frutas porque tengo pedidos de manzanas y uvas. Tambien tengo varios responzabilidad con mi familia, miesposa y un hijo que lo tengo estudiando en la escula, yo deseo darle lo mejor a mi hijo que con sus estudios. En estos momentos me urge el dinero, les agradesco mucho por su ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits like watermelons, oranges, bananas, papayas, apples, and grapes.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudys

texts.es:
Hi, my name is María A.. I have made and sold tortillas for 10 years. I have this business in my house. I make my sales by taking orders from various restaurants in my neighborhood. My daughter helps me deliver the orders in the afternoon after she comes home from school. Right now I need to buy firewood and corn. I don't have much left right now to make the tortillas, so I am losing sales. I would be very grateful if you could help me as soon as possible because I have a lot of expenses with my family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Maria A., yo eleboro y vendo tortillas hace 10 años. Este negocio lo tengo en mi casa. Pero vendo por pedidos a varios restaurantes y mis neborhood. Mi jçhija me ayuda a repartir los pedidos por la tarde despues que regresa del colegio. En estos momentos necesito comprar: lecña, maiz. Ya que no tengo mucho para poder elaborar las tortillas y estoy perdiendo de vender. Les agradesco me ayuden lo mas pronto posible.,poque tengo variso gastos con mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, salt, lime, and corn.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
I sell snacks like tacos, enchiladas, and little meat and chicken pies. I've had this business in front of my house for 8 years. I have good sales because I sell at lunchtime and at night, and I have my loyal customers who love my food. I need this money to buy vegetables and meat. With the income from my sales, I can cover my medication costs since I'm an old woman, and I also help my husband with the expenses of our home. We are poor people but are very hardworking. Thanks for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo vengo golosinas que son: tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de carne pollo y res) Este negocio lo tengo frente a mi casa hace 8 sños. Yo tengo buenas ventas porque yo vendo al mediodia y en la noche, y tengo mis fieles compradores ya que les encanta mi comida. El dinero lo ocupo para hacer las compras de verduras y carnes. Con los ingresos de mis venta yo cumbro los gasto de mis medicinas ya que soy una mujer vieja y tambien ayudo ami esposo con gastos que tenemos en nuestro hogar, nosotros somos unas personas pobres pero muy trabajadoras. Gracias por su ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, flour, tomatoes, green peppers, cabbage, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
I have made a living by sewing for 10 years. I have this small business in my house. I make curtains, dresses, skirts, and blouses. I have very good clients who are housewives and people who work in offices. I need this money to buy fabric, thread, and other items. I have clients who like to choose from the fabrics I have because they don't have time to go shopping since they leave work in the evenings. This gives me a competitive advantage. With the money I earn, I buy medicine since I'm an old woman and suffer from high blood pressure. I have two sons who are very poor and help me when they can.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo me dedico a la costura, hace 10 años, este pequeño negocio lo tengo en mi casa. Yo elaboro, cortinas, bestidos, faldas y busas. Tengo muy buenas clientas que son las amas de casa y personas que trabajan en oficnas. El dinero lo ocupo para hacer compra de telas, hilos y otros. Tengo clientas que ellas les gusta escoger las telas que tengo ya que a ellas no lesda tiempo para ir a comprar ya que salen tarde de sus trabajos esto a mi me favorse porque tengo mejor en tradas. Con lo que gano compro medicinas para mi persona ya que soy una mujer vieja y padesco de alta presion. Tengo dos hijos los cuales son muy pobres y me ayudan en lo que pueden

loans.use: Purchase of thread, fabric, needles, pins, etc.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Description of Business

Doña Modesta earns a living by making uniforms for businesses and P.E. uniforms for schools. Modesta has 25 years of experience in this business. With a little bit of capital she established her own little workshop in her own house. Modesta attends her clients as early as 8am until as late as 8pm. Modesta serves clients that live both inside and outside of her neighborhood.

Use of the Loan

Modesta is requesting this loan so that she will be able to buy materials for business. She would like to buy materials for Christmas, since there is a great demand for items made of this material during the Christmas season. Also, because of the economic level of clients she has begun to attract, she needs to increase the variety of merchandise that she has to offer. She wants all of her clients to receive the best products and service possible.

Personal Information

Modesta is 43 years old and she lives with her three children. She is able to pay for all three of them to be in school. This is thanks to the money that she has earned by working hard. Her home is humble yet warm and charming. Modesta’s dream is to continue to be successful in her business and to make it grow as much as possible so that she can increase her income for the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela and Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Modesta se dedica a la confección de uniformes para empresas y también uniformes para educación física a Escuelas y Colegios. Modesta tiene experiencia en este negocio 25 años. Con pequeño capital inicio su taller el mismo que lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio. Modesta atiende a sus clientes desde 8am, hasta las 20pm. Modesta presta su servicio dentro y fuera del sector donde vive.

Uso del Préstamo

Modesta solicita el crédito para comprar más materiales como telas navideñas, ya que por vísperas de navidad necesita incrementar este tipo de material. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Modesta se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su mercadería, para de esa manera tener a sus clientes muy bien atendidos.

Información Personal

Modesta tiene 43 años de edad, en donde solo vive con sus 3 hijos, que actualmente los tienen estudiando, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza en su actividad a podido darles esa oportunidad de estudio, además su domicilio es de estructura mixta pero acogedora. Los anhelos de Modesta es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de sus hijos y del negocio.

loans.use: Buy more materials in preparation for Christmas

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
I have sold firewood for 5 years, since I lost my other job. I have various clients who live near my neighborhood. I have to do this work because the money my husband earns isn't enough to cover our home's expenses, since we have 3 kids in school, and we want to keep giving them an education. They help us deliver the orders that we have. We are poor and honest people, and we teach our children the value of money and that it's necessary to work and be responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo me didico a la venta de leña hace 5 años, desde que me qwuede sin trabajo. Tengo variso clientes que viven serca de mi becindario. Tengo que hacer este trabajo porque con lo que gana mi esposo no nos ajusta con nuestros gastos que tenemos en nuestro hogar, ya que tenemos 3 hijos que estudian y nosotros no queremos que ellos dejen de estudiar, ellos nos ayudan a repartir los pedidos que tenemos. Somos personas pobres y honradas y les enserñamos a nuestros hojos el valor del dinero que hay que trabajar y ser responzables.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Delmy Yamileth

texts.es:
Hi, I have sold hot dogs for 5 years now. I am a street vendor and sell to people who love my hot dogs because they are delicious. I need to buy buns, hot dogs, onions, mustard, and other items. I have 3 kids. With the income I earn from my sales, I help my family with our home's expenses. I have this business because I haven't been able to find a job. I fight to give my children the best possible in education, food, and love. I would be very grateful if you could help me as soon as possible because I have a lot of responsibility with my family, and I want to have good sales and give better service to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hola, yo me dedico a la venta de hot-dog, hace 5 ños. Soy venddora ambulante a las personas les encanta mis hot dog porque los preparo riqisimos.Necesito comprar; pan, hot dog, cebollas, mostaza y otros. Tengo 3 hijos, con los ingresos de las ventas ayudo a mi familia con los gastos familiares. Tengo este negocio porque no he podido conseguir un trabajo, soy una mujer muy lucahadora poruqe deseo que mis hijos tenga lo mejor que son; sus estudios, comida y mucho amor. Les voy a gradecer que me ayuden lo mas pronto posible ya qure tengo baste responsabilidad con mi familia y quiero tener buenas ventas y dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of buns, hot dogs, onions, mayonnaise, mustard, ketchup, napkins, plates, and pickles.

loans.name: Marlin Joselinda

texts.es:
Yo me dedico a la venta de ropa de niños y adultos. Este negocio lo tengo hace 6 años. Yo vendo en oficnas y casas que visito a las amas de casa. Tengo varios pedidos porque se aserca la navidad por eso me urge el dinero para poder comprar lo que me hace falta, y  no quiero fallarles a mis clientes. El unico ingreso que tengo son lo de las ventas de la ropa. Soy madre soltera y tengo dos hijs que mantener.

ព្រឹតិ្តការណ៍បច្ចុប្បន្ន៖ របាយការណ៍ថ្មីៗពីប្រទេសកម្ពុជា
កិច្ចព្រមព្រៀងប្រទេសជប៉ុន និងវៀតណាម
ក្រុមអភិរក្សបិរស្ថានប្រឆាំងនឹងគំរោងសាងសង់វារីអគ្គិសនីរបស់ឡាវ

loans.use: compra de pantalones, jeans, camisas, camisetas, faldas y blusas.

loans.name: Telma De Jesus

texts.es:
My name is Telama de Jesús. I sell snack foods (enchiladas, chicken and beef tacos, and fried green plantains). I have had this business for one year, and it is located in the corner of my house. I have a lot of customers, since they my food. I sell from the afternoon until evening. I have 4 children, all of whom are in grade school. With my earnings from the food sales, I help my husband pay for the family expenses. I use the money to buy supplies and achieve good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Telama de Jesus, yo ne dedico a la venta de golosinas (enchiladas, tacos de carne pollo y res, y tajas de patano fritos) este negocio lo tengo hace un año imedio y esta hubicado en la esquina de mi casa. Tengo bastantes clientes ya que les encanta mis golosinas, mis ventas las hago en la tarde hsta la noche. Tengo 4 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela. Con las ganancias de las ventas le ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos que tenemos con nuestra familia. El dinero lo ocupo para hacer las comprar y tener buenas ventas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, cooking oil, cooking gas, and meats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more tires to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make improvements to her home so she can run her business there.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in highly sought after products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her clients to chose from

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise (metallic and plastic containers for water)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a larger freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: enlarge her store

loans.name: Sanggam

texts.id:
Every day Sanggam and wife buy to be recycled goods. The have a push cart to place the to be recycled items bought. Every day they need a capital as high as Rp500,000.00 (about US$55) to buy those items. That capital could give them profit up to Rp350,000.00 (about US$38.50). They profit from each item about Rp2,000-Rp4,000 (about 22-44 cents)/kg. Sanggam lives with wife and 2 children. His first child is first grader, and cost Rp20,000 (US$2.20)/day and education expenses of Rp75,000 (about US$8.25)/month. Business and living quarters are rented. Expected loan would be used to buy more to be recycled goods. This business is the only source of income for Sanggam and family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap hari Sanggam bersama dengan isterinya membeli barang-barang rongsokan. Mereka menggunakan gerobak – yang mereka dorong - untuk tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang mereka beli. Setiap tiga hari mereka memerlukan modal sampai sebesar Rp 500.000,00 untuk membeli barang-barang tersebut. Modal sejumlah itu dapat memberikan keuntungan bagi mereka sebesar Rp 350.000,00. Mereka mengambil keuntungan untuk setiap barang antara Rp 2.000,00 - Rp 4.000,00/kg-nya. Sanggam tinggal bersama isteri dan dua orang anaknya. Anaknya yang pertama kelas 1 SD dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 20.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak Rp 75.000,00/bulan. Tempat usaha menyewa. Tempat tinggal juga menyewa. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan digunakan untuk membeli barang – barang rongsokan yang lebih banyak. Usaha ini merupakan satu-satunya sumber penghasilan bagi Sanggam sekeluarga

loans.use:
To buy to be recycled goods

Membeli barang – barang rongsokan

loans.name: I Putu Darmawanta

texts.id:
To have his own furniture business in Putu Darmawanta's goal since he married Ni Made Murtini 6 years ago. However, because lack of capital, this parents of Ni Putu Aprilianti awaits his dreams by working as furniture maker in other people's business. Because of his hard work and persistent, Putu Darmawanta saved little by little to buy his craft's tools. Although the tools Putu owns are stll manual, it was enough as starting capital, besides his expertise. After Two years, Putu Darmawanta furniture business expanded quite well, orders after orders came, since his production were quite good, clean and guaranteed quality, so that his customer base increased. With Dinari's loan, Putu Darmawanta could complete his business machineries with larger machines like grinder, saw and other machines. Within one business day Putu Darmawanta with 3 laborers could produce Rp 1,000,000 (about US$110) worth of goods, with a nett profit of Rp 150,000 (about US$16.50). Putu Darmawanta is happy with his current achievements, and hopes it would continue expanding, and absorb more workforce, and to pay for family expenses, including mother in law expenses who stays with them.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Memiliki usaha meubel sendiri merupakan cita –cita Putu Darmawanta sejak menikah dengan Ni Made Murtini 6 tahun yang lalu . Namun karena tak punya modal , orang tua dari Ni Putu Aprilianti ini menunda keinginannya dan bekerja sebagai tukang meubel di usaha milik orang lain. Berkat ketekunan dan kerja kerasnya , Putu Darmawanta mengumpulkan sedikit - demi sedikit hasil yang didapat untuk di belikan alat-alat pertukangan . Meski alat –alat yang Putu miliki termasuk alat yang masih manual, itu cukup sebagai modal awal disamping ketrampilan / keahlian yang sudah dimiliki.
