Dua tahun sudah Usaha meubel Putu Darmawanta berjalan dan usaha itu berkembang cukup pesat , pesanan demipesanan pada berdatangan mengingat hasil produksi Putu Darmawanta cukup baik, rapi dan kwalitasnya terjamin sehingga pelanggannya makin hari makin bertambah . Dengan tambahan modal dari Dinari , Putu Darmawanta telah melengkapi mesin – mesin usahanya dengan mesin yang lebih besar Seperti : Mesin Serut , Gergaji dan mesin mesin lainnya . Dalam satu hari usaha Putu Darmawanta dengan 3 orang tenaga kerja tukang bisa berproduksi sebesar Rp.1.000.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih yang didapat sebesar Rp.150.000,- . Putu Darmawanta merasa sangat senang dengan usaha yang dijalankannya sekarang , dan berharap usaha ini terus berkembang sehingga bisa menyerap tenaga kerja yang lebih banyak lagi dan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarga termasuk menanggung biaya hidup Ibu mertua yang tinggal bersamanya.

loans.use:
To buy grinder & other machines to increase productivity

Membeli mesin serut untuk mempercepat kerjanya

loans.name: Ni Luh Suerni

texts.id:
Using a motor cycle Ni Luh Suerni travels from one village to another, from one farmer's home to another, to buy cocoa fruits from farmers. With a profession as a Cocoa salesperson is a satisfying work for Ni Luh Suerni, since besides a relatively good income, she would get to know the area and other villages. Each day from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM, Ni Luh Suerni could collect 1.5-2 kwintal (about 150-200kg) with a price of Rp11,500 (about US$13)/kg. The cocoa seeds are then delivered and resold to the distributor at Rp500 (about 6 cents) higher than purchase price. With a nett profit of Rp80,000 (about US$8.80) Ni Luh Suerni could help her husband who works as a building laborer to pay eductaion for their 2 children to finish highschool and another one still in Grade school. Ni Luh Suerni has many customers, since as a saleslady, Suerni is considered friendly and honest in her purchases. That makes the farmers happy to sell their cocoa to Suerni, although there are many others coming and made offers too. However Suerni has a problem, that is capital limitations, so that many times she could not take all of her customers cocoa production. Additional capital from Dinari would help smoothen Suernis' business, and results would increase too.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan mengendarai sepeda motor Ni Luh Suerni berkeliling dari desa satu kedesa lain , dari rumah petani satu ke petani lainya untuk membeli buah kakao milik petani .Berprofesi sebagai pedagang kakao bagi Ni Luh Suerni merupakan pekerjaan yang menyenangkan , karena di samping hasil yang di dapat cukup lumayan , Ni Luh Suerni juga mendapatkan pengalaman dan bisa mengenal daerah / desa desa lain. Dalam sehari yaitu mulai pukul 10 pagi sampai dengan 4 sore, Ni Luh Suerni mampu memperoleh barang dagangan sebanyak 1,5 sampai dengan 2 kwintal dengan harga pembelian rata-rata Rp 11.500,- per kilogram . Biji kakao ini kemudian di jual kembali kepada pengepul di desanya dengan selisih harga Rp. 500,- lebih tinggi dari harga pembelian. Dengan ke untungan bersih Rp. 80.000,- per hari , Ni Luh Suerni bisa membantu suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai buruh bangunan untuk menanggung 2 orang anaknya hingga tamat SMA dan seorang lagi yang masih duduk di Sekolah Dasar. Ni Luh Suerni memiliki banyak pelanggan , karena sebagai seorang pedagang suerni terkenal ramah dan jujur dalam berbelanja ,Dan Itu Membuat petani senang menjual kakauNya kepada Suerni meskipun banyak pedagang yang datang untuk menawar . Namun begitu Suerni juga memiliki masalah yaitu terbatasnya modal yang dimiliki,sehingga sering kali Suerni tak bisa mengambil semua barang ( Kakau ) pelangganya.Mendapat tambahan modal dari Dinari sangat membantu pada kelancaran usaha dari Suerni, dan hasil yang didapat pun kini berlipat ganda.

loans.use:
To increase business capital so that she could buy more cocoa seeds to sell more to Distributor

Menambah modal usaha agar dapat membeli lebih banyak biji kakao sehingga dapat menjual lebih banyak lagi kepada pengepul

loans.name: Ni Ketut Ani Antari

texts.id:
Quick, persistent and modest, description given to Ni Ketut Aniantari. Although aged 32, this mother of 3 has a steady income as a Cocoa seeds buy & sell sales lady. She has been in the business since 2 years. With an initial capital of Rp3,000,000 (about US$330), Ani, her nickname, within one day could buy cocoa up to 300kg from several farmers who directly came to her home. Price per kg varied depending on quality, and water content. After processed (dried in the sun) for half to 1 day, Ani resells it to the distributor, of course at a higher price. Usually she delivers once every 2 days. Sales results are around Rp3,200,000-Rp3,300,000 (about US$352-363). So within 2 days Ani could get a nett profit of Rp100,000-200,000 (about US$11-22) after subtracting labor and transportation cost. Additional loan from Dinari would be used to buy a scale and additional capital to buy more goods for sale. Her hope is that results / profits could increase, and help Ketut Suarba, her husband to pay for education expenses of their 2 daughters, who are already in Middle school & Grade school, and atoddler son.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Gesit, ulet dan bersahaja , julukan itu cocok di berikan pada Ni Ketut Aniantari meski usianya baru 32 tahun Ibu dari tiga orang anak ini sudah memiliki sumber penghasilan tetap yaitu sebagai seorang Pedagang Jual Beli Biji Kakao. Usaha ini telah ditekuninya sejak 2 tahun lalu . Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 3.000.000,- Ani, begitu orang biasa memanggilnya, dalam sehari bisa membeli kakao sampai 300 Kg dari beberapa petani yang datang langsung kerumahnya . Harga per 1 Kg nya berpariasi tergantung pada kwalitas barang dan kadar kandungan airnya . Setelah di proses ( dijemur ) kurang lebih ½ s/d 1 hari, oleh Ani dijual kembali kepada pedagang induk tentunya dengan harga yang lebih tinggi . Pengiriman yang dilakukan biasanya setiap 2 hari sekali dengan hasil penjualan berkisar Rp. 3.200 000;- s/d Rp. 3.300.000.- . Jadi dalam waktu 2 hari Ani mendapatkan keuntungan bersih Rp 100.000,- s.d 200.000 setelah di potong ongkos buruh maupun ongkos angkut. Mendapat tambahan modal dari Dinari oleh Ani dipergunakan untuk membeli sebuah alat timbangan dan sebagai tambahan modal untuk bisa membeli barang dagangan yang lebih banyak lagi . Dengan harapan hasil / keuntungan yang di dapat semakin banyak , dan dapat membantu Ketut Suarba, suaminya, dalam membiayai pendidikan 2 orang putrinya yang sudah duduk di bangku SMP & SD dan satu lagi putranya yang masih balita.

loans.use:
To add capital to buy more cocoa seeds and buy a sitting scale

Menambah modal usaha agar dapat membeli lebih banyak biji kako dan untuk membeli timbangan duduk

loans.name: I Wayan Landep

texts.id:
I Wayan Landep as a farmer is not nailed to one farming commodity. Before rice planting is due, he is using the time to plant hot peppers. The 1 ha (10,000 square meters) field is not his, he rented it by result division system. According to I Wayan Landep the hot pepper plants would be ready for harvest after 4 months. From his previous experience, in one week he could pick 400 kg hot peppers. Production results usually are picked up by the distributor at Rp3000 (33 US cents)/kg. When calculated nett profit per harvest could reach Rp400,000 (about US$44). I Wayan Landep has 5 helpers. Capital of Rp6,000,000 (about US$675) from Dinari would be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and labor expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

I Wayan Landep sebagai seorang petani tidak hanya terpaku pada satu komoditi pertanian.Pada saat tanaman padi belum turun taman ia memanfaatkan untuk menaman tanaman cabe.Lahan seluas 1 ha ini memang bukan kepunyaannya ia menyewa dengan sistem bagi hasil.Menurut I Wayan Landep tanaman cabenya baru siap dipanen setelah berumur 4 bulan. Dari pengalaman sebelumnya dalam satu minggu bisa dipetik 400 Kg cabe . Hasil produksinya biasanya diambil oleh pengepul dengan harga per-Kg Rp. 3.000.- Kalau di hitung keuntungan bersih per panen sampai Rp.400.000.- I Wayan Landep mempekerjakan 5 orang tenaga . Dana Rp. 6.000.000,- dari Dinari dipakainya untuk membeli bibit tanaman , membeli Pupuk , Obat-obatan dan ongkos tenaga kerja.

loans.use:
To buy hot pepper best seeds and fertilizers

Membeli bibit cabai jenis unggul dan pupuk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Ni Wayan Riki

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Riki originally from Karangasem migrated to Denpasar to work. The business she is in this time is Ceper sales. Ceper is part of offerings used for praying by Hindu religion. Ceper is sold to customers araound her house. Ceper ingredients are young coconut leaves that could be bought at the Badung market. The price of coconut leaves are uncertain, some times up, other times down. However, because it was needed by Hindu members, she did not change profession, and continue with Ceper sales business. The profit she got from this business could reach Rp20,000 (about US$2.20)/day. She is doing this to increase family income. Her husband's income of Rp300,000 (about US$33)/month is not enough to pay for living expenses of minimum Rp15,000.00 (about US$1.65)/day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Riki berasal dari Karangasem dan merantau ke Denpasar untuk bekerja. Usaha yang ditekuninya sampai sekarang adalah Jualan Ceper. Ceper adalah bagian dari sesajen yang dipakai sebagai sarana sembahyang oleh umat Hindu. Ceper ini dijual pada langganan yang ada di sekitar rumahnya. Bahan Ceper, yaitu daun kelapa muda yang dapat dibeli di Pasar Badung. Harga daun kelapa tak tentu kadang naik kadang turun. Tapi karena sangat diperlukan oleh umat Hindu, dia tidak beralih profesi dan tetap menekuni usaha jualan Ceper. Keuntungan yang didapatkan dari usaha ini mencapai Rp 20.000,00/hari. Usaha ini dia lakukan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga. Penghasilan suaminya yang Rp 300.000,00/bulan tentu tidak mencukupi untuk biaya hidup Rp 15.000,00/harinya.

loans.use:
To buy young coconut leaves for ceper ingredients

Membeli daun kelapa muda untuk bahan ceper.

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en: Metanet N.  is a 36-year-old woman who owns her farm in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Sabirabad region. Metanet is married and has three sons. She  works hard raising vegetables and selling them to the local bazaar traders. It brings her a profit, however she and her husband are unemployed and it is very hard to maintain the family. Only one financial source is not enough to cover family needs. As children grow up they need many expenses, such as for school supplies, clothes and other necessary things. Metanet has decided to improve conditions of her family life and applied for 1200 USD to expand her farming business.

loans.use: Going to expand her farming business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali N. is a 39-year-old married man who owns a car repair shop in Sabirabad. He has eleven years of experience in this field. This business is in high demand and people use car repair services very often. Sometimes Ali works till late at night to finish all the orders and next morning wakes up very early to start his work. Ali is married and has three children. He is planning to repair his shop. He believes this will attract more clients. He has applied for 800 USD to purchase material to start repairing his shop.

loans.use: Need funds to repair his auto repair shop

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.en: Nuriyya V. is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Imishli in the southern region of Azerbaijan. Nuriyya has raised livestock since 1999 and during these years she sold calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders and butchers. She is very proud to have her animals and she could feed the family. Nuriyya`s husband is person with special needs and he does not work. Two of her three sons are high school students. They help Nuriyya to look after calves. For the last two years life in the region has been getting harder and Nuriyya understands that  her business of raising livestock is not enough to bring up her kids and earn enough money for a normal life . Now she would like to purchase calves and raise them up for milk cows and start dairy production. So she has applied for 1200 USD to purchase four calves for estimated cost 300 USD.each.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace A. is 58 years old and lives in Benin City; she is married and has seven children. She sells chickens to people living in her community. She spent five years learning the business and opened her own business in 2002. She has been with LAPO for the past three years. She is in need of a loan of $800 to enable her buy more chickens to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Matilde Bassane

texts.pt:
Matilde is unmarried but she lives with the father of her 4 children. She lives in Chibuto in the district of the same name. She began the loan program in 2005 as part of a group. Now she is applying for an individual loan. Her business is running smoothly. All of her children are in school. She helps her husband with household expenses. She is a seamstress. She has practiced this profession since she was young. She hopes to invest in her business with this loan and attract more clients.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde e solteira mas vive com umhomem com quem tem 4 filhos. Ela vive em Chibuto, sede do distrito do mesmo nome.Ela entrou para o Programa de credito em 2005 como membro de um grupo. Agora ela quer tomar o emprestimo individualmente. O negocio esta a correr-lhe bem. Todos os filhos de Matilde estao a estudar. Ela consegue ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. Ela e modista. Desde jovem que ela exerce esta profissao.Assim com o emprestim ela quer investir no seu negocio para poder angariar mais clientes.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth U. is 57 years old and lives in Benin City; she is married and has children. She sells drinks. She learned the business from her sister and started her own business in 2002. She is seeking a loan of $1,175 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She is a member of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene O. is 48 years old; she is married, has four children, and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and drinks to people living in her community. To improve her business, she is seeking a loan of $800 in order to buy more drinks and provisions to sell. She has 17 years of experience in the business and has been a LAPO member for 9 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her hardware stock.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Mrs. Theresa I. is 36 years old, is married, and has three children. She sells provisions and drinks to people living in her community. She spent a year learning the business and opened her own store in 2006. She is requesting a loan of $250 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther A., 58 years old, lives in Benin City. She is married and has nine children. Sells beef to people living in her community. She has been in this business since 1977 after one year of learning the business. She has been with LAPO for two years now and she is a faithful client. She seeks the sum of $400 to buy more beef to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more beef to sell

loans.name: Flavia Adozinda

texts.pt:
Flavia studies. She is a first grade teacher by profession in a primary school. She has a business to supplement her salary, which is low. Her stand (store) has helped greatly to pay for her expenses. She has already bought construction materials because if things go well, she intends to improve her home.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Flavia esta a estudar. Ela e professora de profissao numa escola primaria do primeiro grau. Ela faz negocio para reforcar o seu salario que e baixo.A barraca(tenda) tem-lhe ajudado muito para o pagamento das despesas. Ela ja comprou algum material de construcao , pois que pensa no futuro se tudo correr bem melhorar a sua residencia.

loans.use: To buy products for her stand (store).

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Mrs. Anthonia N. is 41 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells food to people living in her community. She has been in this business since 1984 after spending a week learning the business from a friend. She has been with LAPO for seven years. She seeks the sum of $625 to buy more food to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Esohe

texts.en: Esohe E. is 56 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells food. She learned the business from her mother and has been in this business since 1980. She is requesting a loan of $250 to buy more food items and soup things to improve her business. She is a LAPO member. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Abieuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Abieuwa E. is 45 years old, is married, and has four children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks. She started this business in 1996. She is seeking the sum of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She has been a LAPO member for eight years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella O. is 58 years old, is married, and has four children. She lives in Benin City and she sells drinks. She spent four months learning her business and has five years of experience in the business. She is seeking the sum of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She is a member of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Osa’S

texts.en: Osa’s O. is 24 years old, is still single, and lives in Benin City. She is a professional hair dresser who studied the business for a year and six months, after which she started her own salon in 2006. The loan amount of $250 will go a long way to improve her business; she will be able to buy more weavons, hair creams, relaxers, and drinks for sale, as well as an additional dryer. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy weavons, hair creams, relaxers, and a dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase  his business.

loans.name: Mebel

texts.en: Mrs. Mebel A. is 33 years old, is married, and has three children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks. She studied her business for 5 years, and and she has 15 years of experience in the business. She is seeking the sum of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Eki

texts.en: Eki A. is 28 years old and is still single. She lives in Benin City and is a professional hair dresser. She spent a year and six months learning the business, after which she started her own salon in 2001. A loan amount of $250 will go a long way to improve her business; it will enable her to buy more weavons, hair creams, relaxers, and drinks to sell. Eki has been a LAPO member for four years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy drinks, weavons, hair creams, and relaxers

loans.name: Osariemen

texts.en: Mrs. Osariemen O. lives in Benin, is 35 years old, and is married. She is a fashion designer and also sells clothes. She says she is always happy when she is designing clothes for people. She has been in this business since 2001 and has been a member of LAPO for four years. She hopes to receive $250 to enable her to buy more cloth and tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring materials

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience I. is 30 years old, is married, and has five children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells eggs. She spent three months learning the business and has two years of experience in the business. She is seeking the sum of $400 to enable her to buy more eggs to sell. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en: Firdavs is one of the active clients of Microinvest. He has his own DVD shop in Panjshanbe for over 2 years. He is married and has 2 children. He lives with his old parents. His wife is a teacher and in their big family they both earn money for family needs. His business is renting out DVDs and videocassettes for several days, and also he sells them. He said that the success of his business depends of regularly updating and upgrading his assortment. Presently he has a lot of disks of different movies and cartoons, songs and concerts. Today the movies and songs produced in Uzbekistan are in high demand among customers. Of course, Firdavs has several clients who prefer oldies songs and old movies. He every day in the morning buys new movies from the DVD seller. Evenings he often receives many orders and he always try to meet clients' requests. For the future, he wants to buy one TV set and DVD player for his shop, giving opportunity to customers to review disks before renting. For this purpose he needs in $350 for 5 months.

loans.use: Purchasing TV set and DVD player

loans.name: Faridun

texts.en: Faridun work at dealer center of mobile company. He opened his own stall of paying card at Panjshanbe market. He buys cards from center and sells them in his stall. He said that his business is profitable as his stall situated in the center market and clients can pay for mobile service any time. His cards are cheaper then in other stalls and his has many constant clients from Panjshanbe market. For future he wants to increase the number of his cards and he needs in 1200TJS($ 350) for 5 months.

loans.use: Business expansion.

payments.comment: Faridun is successfully repayed his curently loan as his business is going well and every day he services many clients.He is very satisfied of his business developing and wishes to KIVA lenders more success and luck.

loans.name: Utkur

texts.en: A. Utkur is an experienced entrepreneur. He is the father of three children. His wife is a housewife, and Utkur is the one member in their family who earns money for family needs. His business is sales of food products. He has his own food shop in the central market Panjshanbe, in Khujand. He has wide assortment of candies and biscuits (cookies and crackers). He buys his goods from supplies from Bishkek, Kirgizistan. Presently he has good turnover of his business, and in the near future he wants to conclude an agreement with the distributor firm who supplies food products from Russia. Utkur is requesting 4000 TJS ($1175 USD) for 6 months for future expansion.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Utkur

texts.en: A. Utkur is experienced entrepreneur. He is father of three children. His wife is housewife and Utkur is one member in their family who earn money for family needs. His business is trade of food products. He has his own food shop in the central market Panjshanbe, in Khujand. He has wide assortment of candies and biscuits. He buys his goods from supplies from Bishkek, Kirgizistan. Presently he has good turnover of his business and in nearest future he wants to conclude an agreement with distributor firm, who supplies food products from Russia. Utkur is requesting 4000 TJS($ 1175) for 6 months for future expansion.

loans.use: Business expansion.
